FeatureCatalogue.name: 'INSPIRE application schemas'
FeatureCatalogue.scope: This feature catalogue gives an informative overview of the spatial object types and data types defined in the INSPIRE data specifications. These types are used by data providers for the exchange and classification of spatial objects from data sets that relate to one or several INSPIRE spatial data themes.

For the normative requirements, please refer to the COMMISSION REGULATION (EU) No 1089/2010 of 23 November 2010 on the interoperability of spatial data sets and services. For a more detailed description of the application schemas, see the data specification guidance documents at http://inspire.jrc.ec.europa.eu/index.cfm/pageid/2.
All application schemas for spatial data themes of Annex II or III are draft schemas.
FeatureCatalogue.versionNumber: n/a (each application schema is versioned separately)
FeatureCatalogue.producer: European Commission, INSPIRE Drafting Team 'Data Specifications' and Thematic Working Groups
FeatureCatalogue.FeatureType:
Permission permission Official Decision (formal consent) granting authorization to operate all or part of an Activity Complex, subject to certain conditions which guarantee that the installations or parts of installations on the same site operated by the same operator comply with the requirements fixed by a competent authority. A permit may cover one or more functions and fix parameters of capacity. The term could be extended to other kind of certificates or documents of special relevance depending of the scope (e.g. ISO, EMAS, National Quality Standards, etc).
The term may be extended to other kind of certificates or documents of special relevance depending of the scope (e.g. ISO, EMAS, National Quality Standards, etc). NOTE This terms is referred in several legislative acts as “permit” , “authorization”, “development consent” or “exploration permit” among others. ElevationVectorObject EXAMPLE 1 “…a [written] decision by which the competent authority grants permission to operate all or part of an installation” ; EXAMPLE 2 “.. the decision of the competent authority or authorities which entitles the developer to proceed with the project..”.
Data Type

FeatureAttribute.name: Id
FeatureAttribute.title: identifier
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identifying reference to the permission.

FeatureAttribute.name: relatedParty
FeatureAttribute.title: related party
FeatureAttribute.definition: Parties related to the permission granted to the activity complex open to many different roles, such as Competent Authorities or Company among others
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Include concepts described on the legislation such as Operator, Company, Port Authority, Agent, Holder, Competent Authority or Keeper.

FeatureAttribute.name: decisionDate
FeatureAttribute.title: decision date
FeatureAttribute.definition: Temporal reference that complement the definition of the permission.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE For permissions that become effective immediately, the decision date and the start of the validity period coincide. It may however be a duration of years or decades that separates a decision date from the validity period. For example, a permission decided in 2012 may allow the recovery of waste at a particular site starting from the year
EXAMPLE Legal resolutions used to refer to a specific day from which the referred resolution and the emitted permission starts to be valid.

FeatureAttribute.name: dateFrom
FeatureAttribute.title: date from
FeatureAttribute.definition: A date starting from which the permission applies and is valid.

FeatureAttribute.name: dateTo
FeatureAttribute.title: date to
FeatureAttribute.definition: A date up to which the permission applies and is valid.

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.definition: A description of the permission.

FeatureAttribute.name: permittedFunction
FeatureAttribute.title: permitted function
FeatureAttribute.definition: Function/s for which the permission is granted. Function is as described by the Activity and potentially complemented by information about the Inputs and Outputs derived from the same.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Functions permitted according to the permission, such as a permit for a landfill.

FeatureAttribute.name: permittedCapacity
FeatureAttribute.title: permitted capacity
FeatureAttribute.definition: Maximum amounts of activity input and/or output according to the permission,
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The physical capacities of a facility may exceed the permitted capacities.
EXAMPLE Incineration of at most 100000 tons of residual waste per year.

FeatureType.name: Capacity
FeatureType.title: capacity
FeatureType.definition: A quantification of an actual or potential ability to perform an activity, that typically does not change, does not change often, or does not change to a significant degree.
FeatureType.description: NOTE Capacity could refer depending of the thematic scope to different concepts included on the legislation as “emission limits”, “capacity incineration”, “livestock units”, “nominal capacity”, “objective estimation data”, “rate of desulphurization” or “recycling rate”.

FeatureAttribute.name: activity
FeatureAttribute.definition: Categorized description of individual or organized set of technically related processes that are carried out by a economical unit, private or public, profit or non profit character.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The Activity described as part of the Function for “Activity Complex” should be recorded using a controlled vocabulary where a particular controlled vocabulary is in use within a given context, such as SIC codes in the UK, it is acceptable to use these, however, the preferred choice for European interoperability is whenever possible NACE [NACE].

FeatureAttribute.name: input
FeatureAttribute.definition: Measurable information about parameters related with the inputs related with the activity carried out by the Activity Complex.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Depending on the thematic scope it can contain different values including terms as Registered Pollutants, Waste, Processed Products, leakage, etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: output
FeatureAttribute.definition: Measurable information about parameters related with the outputs derived from the activity carried out by the “Activity Complex”.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Depending on the thematic scope it can contain different values including terms as Registered Pollutants, Waste, Processed Products, leakage, etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: time
FeatureAttribute.definition: The duration of time to which the specified capacity refers, such as 1 year for an annual capacity.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Total capacities are specified without duration of time.

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.definition: A description of the capacity.

FeatureType.name: Function
FeatureType.title: function
FeatureType.definition: The function of something expressed as an activity and optional input and/or output.
FeatureType.description: NOTE Depending on the scope it can refer to different activities (co-incineration, Collection, exploration, incineration, interim disposal, management, recycling, primary production, primary treatment, recovery , recycling, release, storage, use, waste management, etc) and Inputs and Outputs (sludge, substance, tailings, technical products, urban waste water, volatile organic compound, waste, WEEE from private households, etc).

FeatureAttribute.name: activity
FeatureAttribute.definition: Categorized description of individual or organized set of technically related processes that are carried out by a economical unit, private or public, profit or non profit character.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The Activity described as part of the Function for “Activity Complex” should be recorded using a controlled vocabulary where a particular controlled vocabulary is in use within a given context, such as SIC codes in the UK, it is acceptable to use these, however, the preferred choice for European interoperability is whenever possible NACE [NACE].

FeatureAttribute.name: input
FeatureAttribute.definition: A classified or registered type of material or something immaterial, that enters a technical and economical unit according to its function.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Depending on the thematic scope it can contain different values including terms as Biomass, Bio-Waste, Fuel, Organic Solvents, Waste Water, Waste for disposal or recovery, Primary Materials, ..

FeatureAttribute.name: output
FeatureAttribute.definition: A classified or registered type of material or something immaterial, that leaves a technical and economical unit according to its function, ".
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Depending on the thematic scope it can contain different values including terms as Registered Pollutants, Waste, Processed Products, leakage, etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.definition: A more detailed description of the function.

FeatureType.name: InputOutputAmount
FeatureType.title: amount of input or output
FeatureType.definition: Type and, where available, measurable amount of a classified or registered material that enters or leaves a technical and economical unit.
FeatureType.description: NOTE Depending on the thematic scope it can refer to different terms as Biomass, Bio-Waste, Fuel, Organic Solvents, Waste Water, Waste for disposal or recovery, Primary Materials, etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: inputOutput
FeatureAttribute.title: input/output
FeatureAttribute.definition: A classified or registered type of material or something immaterial, that enters a technical and economical unit according to its function.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Depending on the thematic scope it can contain different values including terms as Biomass, Bio-Waste, Fuel, Organic Solvents, Waste Water, Waste for disposal or recovery, Primary Materials, etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: amount
FeatureAttribute.definition: The amount (such as a volume or mass) of the classified or registered material that enters or leaves a technical and economical unit.

FeatureType.name: ActivityComplex
FeatureType.title: activity complex
FeatureType.definition: A "single unit", both technically and economically, under the management control of the same legal entity (operator), covering activities as those listed in the Eurostat NACE classification, products and services. Activity Complex includes all infrastructure, equipment and materials. It must represent the whole area, at the same or different geographical location, managed by a "single unit".
FeatureType.description: NOTE 1 This class describes the minimal set of elements necessary to describe and identify geographically a legal entity and the activities taken place on it under the context of a Environmental purposes.

NOTE 2 "Activity Complex" could be assimilated to terms described on the legislation as Facility, Establishment, Plant, Holding, Organization ,Farm, Extractive Industries or Aquaculture Production Business among others
EXAMPLE i.e. an Agro-business that is legally registered under the Emissions Directive.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.title: INSPIRE identifier
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the “Activity Complex”.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: thematicId
FeatureAttribute.title: thematic identifier
FeatureAttribute.definition: Thematic Activity Complex identifier.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE It may be the identification code provided or maintained by the Member States public authority to identify the object in the context of specific or general thematic scopes.
EXAMPLE Assigned National PRTR Code.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Descriptive name of the “Activity Complex”.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE 1 Several names in different languages may be expressed.
NOTE 2 It is recommended that the language of the name (part of the Geographical/Name data type) be filled whenever possible.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry used to define the extent or position of the “Activity Complex”.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE 1 Based on the provided description, different geometries could be used to represent the Activity Complex as a one legal whole.

EXAMPLE 1 E-prtr geometry is given by a single point based on Geographical Coordinates (see below). In other levels of detail or depending on the Data Provider this could be represented [e.g.] by a Multi-poligon.
EXAMPLE 2 PRTR - Legal act example: “ … the latitude and longitude coordinates within an arc of 5 minutes that avoid the direct identification of an individual holding….”.

FeatureAttribute.name: function
FeatureAttribute.definition: Activities performed by the activity complex. Function is described by the activity and potentially complemented with information about inputs and outputs as result of it.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The Activity described as part of the Function “Activity Complex” should be recorded using a controlled vocabulary where a particular controlled vocabulary is in use within a given context, such as SIC codes in the UK, it is acceptable to use these, however, the preferred choice for European interoperability is whenever possible NACE [NACE].

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.title: valid from
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the activity complex started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.title: valid to
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the activity complex no longer exists in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: begin lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE This date is recorded to enable the generation of change only update files.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: end lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE This date is recorded primarily for those systems which "close" an entry in the spatial data set in the event of an attribute change.

FeatureType.name: ActivityComplexDescription
FeatureType.title: activity complex description
FeatureType.definition: Additional information about an activity complex, including its description, address, contact and related parties.

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.definition: A complementary definition of the “Activity Complex” and its characteristics.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Free text to include or refer any complementary information about the Activity Complex or its characteristics.

FeatureAttribute.name: address
FeatureAttribute.definition: An address for the activity complex, i.e., an address where the activities occur.

FeatureAttribute.name: contact
FeatureAttribute.definition: Contact information for the activity complex.

FeatureAttribute.name: relatedParty
FeatureAttribute.title: related party
FeatureAttribute.definition: Information on Parties related to the Activity Complex. It is open to many different roles, such as owners, operators or Competent Authorities.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE 1 The term covers concepts described on the legislation such as Operator, Company, Port Authority, Agent, Holder, Collector, Producer, Competent Authority or Keeper.

FeatureType.name: AreaOfResponsibilityType
FeatureType.title: area of responsibility type
FeatureType.definition: Set of types for the description of spatial responsibility.

FeatureAttribute.name: areaOfResponsibilityByAdministrativeUnit
FeatureAttribute.title: area of responsibility by administrative unit
FeatureAttribute.definition: Administrative unit describing the geographic extent of the responsibility of a service.

FeatureAttribute.name: areaOfResponsibilityByNamedPlace
FeatureAttribute.title: area of responsibility by named place
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geographical object describing the geographic extent of the responsibility of a service.

FeatureAttribute.name: areaOfResponsibilityByNetwork
FeatureAttribute.title: area of responsibility by network
FeatureAttribute.definition: Part of a network describing the geographic extent of the competence of a service.

FeatureAttribute.name: areaOfResponsibilityByPolygon
FeatureAttribute.title: area of responsibility by polygon
FeatureAttribute.definition: Polygon describing the geographic extent of the responsibility of a service.

FeatureType.name: ServiceLocationType
FeatureType.title: service location type
FeatureType.definition: Set of types of references to locate a service.

FeatureAttribute.name: serviceLocationByAddress
FeatureAttribute.title: service location by address
FeatureAttribute.definition: Location of the service by referring to an address.

FeatureAttribute.name: serviceLocationByBuilding
FeatureAttribute.title: service location by building
FeatureAttribute.definition: Location of the service by referring to a building.

FeatureAttribute.name: serviceLocationByActivityComplex
FeatureAttribute.title: service location by activity complex
FeatureAttribute.definition: Location of the service by referring to an activity complex.

FeatureAttribute.name: serviceLocationByGeometry
FeatureAttribute.title: service location by geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Location of the service by referring to a geometry.

FeatureAttribute.name: serviceLocationByUtilityNode
FeatureAttribute.title: location service by utility node
FeatureAttribute.definition: Location of the service by referring to a node related to a utility network (water, telecommunication, etc.), e.g. hydrant or emergency call point.

FeatureType.name: GovernmentalService
FeatureType.title: governmental service
FeatureType.definition: Administrative and social governmental services such as public administrations, civil protection sites, schools and hospitals provided by Public Administrative Bodies or by private institutions as far as they are covered by the scope of the INSPIRE directive. This scope is mapped to the values of the corresponding code list serviceType Value.
FeatureType.description: The accordant sites are commonly presented in governmental and municipal portals and map systems as "point of interest"-data, and may be point-based locations of a variety of categories of municipal and governmental services and social infrastructure. The spatial object type itself is generic in terms of the modelling approach, that the concrete type of a GovernmentalService is determined by the value of the attribute serviceType.

FeatureAttribute.name: areaOfResponsibility
FeatureAttribute.title: area of responsibility
FeatureAttribute.definition: The spatial responsibility of a service instance.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE 1: An administration is responsible for a municipality;
EXEMPLE 2: A specialized hospital is responsible for a region.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: begin lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.
FeatureAttribute.description: Related to the life-cycle of the spatial object in the data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: end lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.
FeatureAttribute.description: Related to the life-cycle of the spatial object in the data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.title: INSPIRE identifier
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the governmental service.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE: An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object.
The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: pointOfContact
FeatureAttribute.title: point of contact
FeatureAttribute.definition: Contains necessary information to get access to a service and/or initial information regarding a service.
FeatureAttribute.description: In some cases this information will coincide with the contact information of the service authority, owner or operator (i.e. specific position or role of the responsible party, described in the relatedParty attribute of the GovernmentalServiceExtended in the extended profile).

FeatureAttribute.name: serviceLocation
FeatureAttribute.title: service location
FeatureAttribute.definition: Location where the service is offered.

FeatureAttribute.name: serviceType
FeatureAttribute.title: service type value
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of an administrative and governmental service.

ApplicationSchema.name: Agricultural and Aquaculture Facilities Extended Model
ApplicationSchema.description: extended model, harmonised with general facility model.
including activity center, and external associations to buildings, cadastral parcels and adress.

FeatureType.name: Site
FeatureType.definition: All land at a same or distinct geographic location under the management control of an organization covering activities, products and services. This includes all infrastructure, equipment and materials.
The geometry of the site must be a point or a surface.
FeatureType.description: The site can be represented by a point or by a surface.

FeatureAttribute.name: identifier
FeatureAttribute.definition: The identifier of the site.

FeatureAttribute.name: permission
FeatureAttribute.definition: -- Name --
permission
-- Definition –
Permissions, licensed or Certifications holds by the Site to carry out “Functions” or activities under certain conditions of “Capacity” and “Time”.

RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: WaterManagementInstallation
FeatureType.definition: The source of water useful for all kinds of activities of the facility site.
FeatureType.description: Agricultural and Aquacultural Activities refers to the production of primary materials (animal and vegetal) for human use, or as base material for industrial processing (animal feed, human food or other industries).
Depending on the scale, the installations would be represented by areas or points and always linked with a Facility (at less in a 1:1 relation).

FeatureAttribute.name: waterQuantity
FeatureAttribute.definition: The quantity of water given by the water source, in cubic metres per second.

FeatureAttribute.name: waterSource
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of water source, according to Regulation (EC) No 1200/2009.

FeatureType.name: AbstractInstallation
FeatureType.definition: Stationary technical unit part of a facility where one or more Agricultural and Aquacultural activities are carried out, and any other directly associated activities which have a technical connection with the activities carried out on that site.
FeatureType.description: Agricultural and Aquacultural Activities refers to the production of primary materials (animal and vegetal) for human use, or as base material for industrial processing (animal feed, human food or other industries).
Depending on the scale, the installations would be represented by areas or points and always linked with a Facility (at less in a 1:1 relation).

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: The identifier of the installation.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: thematicId
FeatureAttribute.definition: The identifier for the installation using a specified identification schema, such as a national register.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry defining the extent or position of the installation part.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: The name of the facility.

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.definition: The description of the facility.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the facility started to exists in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the facility no longer exists in the real world.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32422
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: AquacultureInstallation
FeatureType.definition: A technical unit or a delimited area operated by the same owner of the (aquaculture) holding, where one or more activities listed in Annex I of Regulation (EC) No 1893/2006 are carried out.
FeatureType.description: Source ( Plan4all - modified)

FeatureAttribute.name: aquacultureActivity
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of aquaculture activity expressed as a code.
FeatureAttribute.description: In the enumeration next values are possible:
grown out, nursery, hatchery, other.

FeatureAttribute.name: installationType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of aquaculture installation.
FeatureAttribute.description: In the enumeration fixed values for the types of installation are listed, like:
ponds, tanks and raceways, enclosures and pens, etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: environment
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of the environment in which the aquaculture organisms are kept. (a water classification).
FeatureAttribute.description: The type of water can be:
marine, freshwater or brackish water. (enumeration).

FeatureType.name: AgriBuilding
FeatureType.definition: A building used for agricultural or aquaculture activities.
FeatureType.description: A construction to store agricultural and aquaculture commodities, harvested crops , keeping of animals or storing equipment.

FeatureAttribute.name: identifier
FeatureAttribute.definition: The identifier of the agribuilding.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Representation of the geographical dimension/position of the “building”. Can be GM_Polygon or GM_Point.

FeatureAttribute.name: typeOfBuilding
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of the building, expressed as a code.
FeatureAttribute.description: A building can consists out of one or more building parts. each building part can be of an other type.

FeatureType.name: Holding
FeatureType.definition: The whole area and all infrastructures included on it, covering the same or different "sites", under the control of an operator to perform agricultural or aquaculture activities. The holding includes one specialisation of ActivityComplex, ie. Activity. the values of ActivityType are expressed in conformity with the classification of the economic activity of the holding, according to the NACE rev. 2.0 coding. Holding is a thematic extension of the generic Class “Activity Complex” shared with other thematic areas describing entities related with Economical Activities (Legal Entity Class – Business).
Holding is a thematic extension of the generic Class “Activity Complex” shared with other thematic areas describing entities related with Economical Activities (Legal Entity Class – Business).

02. forestry and logging;
03.1 fishing.

FeatureType.name: FarmAnimalSpecies
FeatureType.title: farm animal
FeatureType.definition: Identifies an animal or group of animals of the same specie kept on the specific site and the amount of them.

FeatureAttribute.name: quantity
FeatureAttribute.definition: Numerical representation of the quantity of Animals of a certain specie (counted, estimated, weight, ..).

FeatureAttribute.name: measureUnit
FeatureAttribute.definition: Unit in which the quantity of animals of a certain specie is expressed.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: First time at which this quantity of animals of the specified species exist on this site in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from at which this quantity of animals of the specified species no longer exist on this site in real world.

FeatureType.name: Plot
FeatureType.definition: Independent portion of the land or water surface, clearly delimited, including or matching the limits of a Site, that is Holding.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Representation of the geographical dimension/position of the plot. (polygons).

FeatureAttribute.name: area
FeatureAttribute.definition: Express the size of the plot, expressed in M2.

FeatureAttribute.name: activity
FeatureAttribute.definition: The economic activity executed on the plot, as coded accoring to EU regulation (EC) 1200/2009, annexII, chapter 2. (codes 2.01 - 2.04.07 an 2.06.03 - 2.06.04).

FeatureAttribute.name: irrigationMethode
FeatureAttribute.definition: Method of irrigation.
FeatureAttribute.description: Source FAO Corporate document repositiory
Source Plan4all.

FeatureAttribute.name: irrigationArea
FeatureAttribute.definition: The area of the plot which can be irrigated, expressed in m2.

FeatureAttribute.name: drainageArea
FeatureAttribute.definition: The area of the plot which is equipped with artificial subsurface drainage system(s), expressed in m2.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: First time at which this plot exist on this site in reality.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which this plot no longer exist on this site in the real world.

RelationshipRole.name: role_T32106
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: InstallationPart
FeatureType.definition: Specific technical part of the Installation which is developing a representative functionality that should be registered under the legislation.
FeatureType.description: This level of description should applied for specific parts of the installations which must be register following the legislation. Manure Storage, Tanks (Special or Raw Products) ,… would be included under this definition. Independently the dimension this entity would be represented as points.

FeatureAttribute.name: typeCode
FeatureAttribute.definition: Describes the type of the installation part, according to a code list.

FeatureType.name: Installation
FeatureType.definition: Stationary technical unit part of a facility where one or more Agricultural and Aquacultural activities are carried out, and any other directly associated activities which have a technical connection with the activities carried out on that site.
FeatureType.description: Agricultural and Aquacultural Activities refers to the production of primary materials (animal and vegetal) for human use, or as base material for industrial processing (animal feed, human food or other industries).
Depending on the scale, the installations would be represented by areas or points and always linked with a Facility (at less in a 1:1 relation).

FeatureType.name: RecognisedHealthStatus
FeatureType.definition: The granted health status of the animal or animalgroup kept on the site, expressed as a staus indicator per species.

FeatureAttribute.name: disease
FeatureAttribute.definition: The name of the observed disease, pest or infection of which the animal or goup of animals is suffering.

FeatureAttribute.name: recognisedHealthStatus
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indicator for the healthstatus, expressed per disease.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The date from when the healthstatus was granted.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The date from when the granted healthstatus is no longer valid.

ApplicationSchema.name: Agricultural and Aquaculture Facilities Model
ApplicationSchema.description: core model, harmonised toward the the core general faciclity model.

FeatureType.name: Holding
FeatureType.definition: The whole area and all infrastructures included on it, covering the same or different "sites", under the control of an operator to perform agricultural or aquaculture activities.

The holding includes one specialisation of ActivityComplex, ie. Activity. the values of ActivityType are expressed conform the classification of the economic activity of the holding, according to the NACE rev. 2.0 coding.
Holding is a thematic extension of the generic Class “Activity Complex” shared with other thematic areas describing entities related with Economical Activities (Legal Entity Class – Business).

RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: FarmAnimalSpecies
FeatureType.title: farm animal
FeatureType.definition: Identifies an animal or group of animals of the same species kept on the specific site.

FeatureAttribute.name: livestock
FeatureAttribute.definition: Define the presence of livestock species in the site.
FeatureAttribute.description: The terrestic species are coded specified according to regulation (EC) No 1165/2008.

FeatureAttribute.name: aquaculture
FeatureAttribute.definition: Define the presence of aquaculture species in the site.
FeatureAttribute.description: Aquaculture species are listed in aquacultureSpecies attribute.

The allowed values for this code list comprise only the values specified in the February 2012 version of the ASFIS (Aquatic Sciences and Fisheries Information System) List of Species for Fishery Statistics Purposes maintained by FAO.

FeatureType.name: Site
FeatureType.definition: All land at a same or distinct geographic location under the management control of a holding covering activities, products and services. This includes all infrastructure, equipment and materials. The geometry of the site must be a point or a surface. Mulitpoint or multisurface is not allowed.
FeatureType.description: The site can be represented by a point or by a surface.
the site can have only one geometry.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry defining the extent or position of the site.
FeatureAttribute.description: The geometry must be a GM_surface, when it includes installations, plots or buildings with a polygon type geometry.
In case the site only includes single object with a point type geometry, the site can have a GM_point geometry.

FeatureAttribute.name: activity
FeatureAttribute.definition: The classification of the economic activity of the site, according to the NACE rev. 2.0 coding.

ApplicationSchema.name: Area Management Restriction and Regulation Zones
ApplicationSchema.definition: The Area Management Restriction and Regulation Zones application schema contains the spatial object that represents zones or areas established to protect the environment via management, restriction or regulation.

FeatureType.name: ManagementRestrictionOrRegulationZone
FeatureType.title: management restriction or regulation zone
FeatureType.definition: Area managed, restricted or regulated in accordance with a legal requirement related to an environmental policy or a policy or activity that may have an impact on the environment at any level of administration (or used for reporting at international, European, national, regional and local) levels.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.title: inspireID
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external application to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

NOTE: ManagementRestrictionOrRegulationZone spatial objects commonly perform the role/function of "Reporting Unit" for non-spatial reported data. The reported data shall contain object references to ManagementRestrictionOrRegulationZones. Therefore, all spatial objects shall be assigned an inspireID.

FeatureAttribute.name: thematicId
FeatureAttribute.title: thematic identifier
FeatureAttribute.definition: Descriptive unique object identifier applied to spatial objects in a defined information theme.
FeatureAttribute.description: Some management, restriction or regulation zones may be assigned multiple thematic identifiers. These may have been established to meet the reporting requirements of different legislative instruments at International, European or at Member State levels.
Where multiple thematicIDs exist all should be provided. This shall allow any external dataset that uses thematicIDs to referencing to the zone to continue to be linked to the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: A geographical name that is used to identify the management, restriction or regulation zone in the real world. It provides a 'key' for implicitly associating different representations of the object.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry representing the spatial extent of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: The geometry of a Management Area, Restriction or Regulation Zone can be defined using any geometry representation. Typically this shall be either a GM_Surface or GM_MultiSurface.
NOTE: Where a zone forms as a polygon, this should be encoded as a GM_Surface or GM_MultiSurface not a GM_Curve.

FeatureAttribute.name: zoneType
FeatureAttribute.title: zone type
FeatureAttribute.definition: High level classification defining the type of management, restriction or regulation zone.

FeatureAttribute.name: specialisedZoneType
FeatureAttribute.title: specialised zone type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Additional classification value which further specialises the type of management, regulation or restriction zone relevant to the domain.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE: This value should be derived from a relevant domain-specific controlled vocabulary, where available.
EXAMPLE 1: A ManagementRestrictionOrRegulationZone where the zoneType value = airQualityManagementZone could be further classified as either:
<ul>
• specialisedZoneType = agglomeration or
• specialisedZoneType =nonAgglomeration
EXAMPLE 2: A ManagementRestrictionOrRegulationZone where the zoneType value = sensitiveArea could be further classified as either:
specialisedZoneType = lessSensitiveArea
specialisedZoneType = lessSensitiveNitrates
specialisedZoneType = lessSensitiveEutrophic
specialisedZoneType = lessSensitiveShellfish

FeatureAttribute.name: designationPeriod
FeatureAttribute.title: designation period
FeatureAttribute.definition: Time period defining when the management, restriction or regulation zone was legally designated or became effective in the real world.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE: designationPeriod uses the ISO 19108 TM_Period which is comprised of two properties - gml:beginPosition and gml:endPosition.
If the zone shall remain in force for an indeterminate period of time then the endPosition/indeterminatePosition="unknown" can be used to state that the zone is still effective.

FeatureAttribute.name: environmentalDomain
FeatureAttribute.title: environmental domain
FeatureAttribute.definition: Classification of the environment domain(s) for which, through the establishment of the zone, certain environmental objectives shall be reached.
FeatureAttribute.description: A zone may be established within one environmental domain (e.g. water) or may to cover a wide range of environmental objectives that cross-cut several domains. For example, Marine Regions may relate to water, land use, sustainable development.

FeatureAttribute.name: competentAuthority
FeatureAttribute.title: competent authority
FeatureAttribute.definition: Description of the organisation(s) responsible for managing, restricting or regulating measures or activities within the zone.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: begin lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: end lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

RelationshipRole.name: legalBasis
RelationshipRole.definition: Reference to, or citation of the legal instrument or document that required the establishment of the zone.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32035
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: relatedZone
RelationshipRole.definition: Reference to a related management, regulation or restriction zone.
RelationshipRole.description: EXAMPLE 1: River basin districts (RBD) exist at three levels:
1) International River Basin District
2) National River Basin District
3) River Basin District Sub units.
An international RBD may contain one or more national RBD and/or River Basin Sub Units.
A national RBD may be related to an International RBD and one or more RBD sub-units.
EXAMPLE 2: A WFDWaterBody may be related to a River Basin District.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32037
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: plan
RelationshipRole.definition: Reference to, or citation of a plan (management or action plan) that describes the environmental objectives and measures that shall be undertaken in the zone to protect the environment.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32040
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

ApplicationSchema.name: Atmospheric Conditions and Meteorological Geographical Features
Base Types
ApplicationSchema.definition: schema for basic types used by multiple themes

FeatureType.name: SpatialDataSet
FeatureType.definition: Identifiable collection of spatial data.
FeatureType.description: NOTE The type SpatialDataSet is offered as a pre-defined type for spatial data sets. The scope of this type is packaging pre-defined data sets for the non-direct access download service. It may be reused in thematic application schemas, but if it does not fit an application-schema-specific data set object should be modelled. This type may have the same name and definition like this type, but may have a different set of properties.
This type specifies three properties: an external object identifier, a container for metadata (may be void), and an association to zero or more spatial objects.

FeatureAttribute.name: identifier
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identifier of the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: metadata
FeatureAttribute.definition: Metadata of the spatial data set.

FeatureType.name: Identifier
FeatureType.definition: External unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object.
FeatureType.description: NOTE1 External object identifiers are distinct from thematic object identifiers.
NOTE 2 The voidable version identifier attribute is not part of the unique identifier of a spatial object and may be used to distinguish two versions of the same spatial object.
NOTE 3 The unique identifier will not change during the life-time of a spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: localId
FeatureAttribute.definition: A local identifier, assigned by the data provider. The local identifier is unique within the namespace, that is no other spatial object carries the same unique identifier.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE It is the responsibility of the data provider to guarantee uniqueness of the local identifier within the namespace.

FeatureAttribute.name: namespace
FeatureAttribute.definition: Namespace uniquely identifying the data source of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The namespace value will be owned by the data provider of the spatial object and will be registered in the INSPIRE External Object Identifier Namespaces Register.

FeatureAttribute.name: versionId
FeatureAttribute.definition: The identifier of the particular version of the spatial object, with a maximum length of 25 characters. If the specification of a spatial object type with an external object identifier includes life-cycle information, the version identifier is used to distinguish between the different versions of a spatial object. Within the set of all versions of a spatial object, the version identifier is unique.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The maximum length has been selected to allow for time stamps based on ISO 8601, for example, "2007-02-12T12:12:12+05:30" as the version identifier.

NOTE 2 The property is void, if the spatial data set does not distinguish between different versions of the spatial object. It is missing, if the spatial object type does not support any life-cycle information.

ApplicationSchema.name: Base Types 2
ApplicationSchema.definition: schema for additional basic types used by multiple themes
ApplicationSchema.description: NOTE The additional types specified with Annex II/III data specifications are placed in a separate schema to maintain backwards compatibility.

FeatureType.name: OfficialJournalInformation
FeatureType.title: official journal information
FeatureType.definition: Full citation of the location of the legislative instrument within the official journal.

FeatureAttribute.name: officialJournalIdentification
FeatureAttribute.title: official journal identification
FeatureAttribute.definition: Reference to the location within the official journal within which the legislative instrument was published. This reference shall be comprised of three parts:
<ul>
• the title of the official journal
• the volume and/or series number
• Page number(s)
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: Official Journal of European Union (OJEU), L108, Volume 50, 1-14

FeatureAttribute.name: ISSN
FeatureAttribute.definition: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) is an eight-digit number that identifies the periodical publication in which the legislative instrument was published.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE: Periodical publilcations are issued in successive parts, usually having numerical or chronological designations and required that each serial publication can be uniquely identified.
EXAMPLE: OJ Series in which INSPIRE Directive is published has been assigned the ISSN: 1725-2555

FeatureAttribute.name: ISBN
FeatureAttribute.definition: International Standard Book Number (ISBN) is an nine-digit number that uniquely identifies the book in which the legislative instrument was published.

FeatureAttribute.name: linkToJournal
FeatureAttribute.title: link to online version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Link to an online version of the official journal

FeatureType.name: Contact
FeatureType.title: contact
FeatureType.definition: Communication channels by which it is possible to gain access to someone or something.

FeatureAttribute.name: address
FeatureAttribute.definition: An address provided as free text.

FeatureAttribute.name: contactInstructions
FeatureAttribute.definition: Supplementary instructions on how or when to contact an individual or organisation.

FeatureAttribute.name: electronicMailAddress
FeatureAttribute.definition: An address of the organisation's or individual's electronic mailbox.

FeatureAttribute.name: hoursOfService
FeatureAttribute.definition: Periods of time when the organisation or individual can be contacted.

FeatureAttribute.name: telephoneFacsimile
FeatureAttribute.definition: Number of a facsimile machine of the organisation or individual.

FeatureAttribute.name: telephoneVoice
FeatureAttribute.definition: Telephone number of the organisation or individual.

FeatureAttribute.name: website
FeatureAttribute.definition: Pages provided on the World Wide Web by the organisation or individual.

FeatureType.name: DocumentCitation
FeatureType.title: document citation
FeatureType.definition: Citation for the purposes of unambiguously referencing a document.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name of the document.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE For legal documents, this should be the official name assigned to the legislative instrument.

EXAMPLE The official legal name for the INSPIRE Directive is "Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 14 March 2007 establishing an Infrastructure for Spatial Information in the European Community (INSPIRE)"

FeatureAttribute.name: shortName
FeatureAttribute.title: short name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Short name or alternative title of the document.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE For legal documents, this should be a short name or alternative title commonly used to identify the legislation.

EXAMPLE 1: INSPIRE Directive is the short name for "Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 14 March 2007 establishing an Infrastructure for Spatial Information in the European Community (INSPIRE)"
EXAMPLE 2: CAFE Directive is the short name for the Directive 2008/50/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 21 May 2008 on ambient air quality and cleaner air for Europe"

EXAMPLE 3: Water Framework Directive the short name for "Directive 2000/60/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing a framework for the Community action in the field of water policy"

FeatureAttribute.name: date
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date of creation, publication or revision of the document.

FeatureAttribute.name: link
FeatureAttribute.title: link to online version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Link to an online version of the document

FeatureAttribute.name: specificReference
FeatureAttribute.title: specific reference
FeatureAttribute.definition: Reference to a specific part of the document.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE For legal documents, this attribute can contain a reference to article(s) that specify a specific requirement or obligation.

FeatureType.name: ThematicIdentifier
FeatureType.title: thematic identifier
FeatureType.definition: Thematic identifier to uniquely identify the spatial object.
FeatureType.description: Some spatial objects may be assigned multiple unique identifiers.
These may have been established to meet data exchange requirements of different reporting obligations at International, European or national levels and/or internal data maintenance requirements.

FeatureAttribute.name: identifier
FeatureAttribute.definition: Unique identifier used to identify the spatial object within the specified identification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: identifierScheme
FeatureAttribute.title: identifier scheme
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identifier defining the scheme used to assign the identifier.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE 1: Reporting requirements for different environmental legislation mandate that each spatial object is assigned an identifier conforming to specific lexical rules.
NOTE 2: These rules are often inconsistent so a spatial object may be assigned multiple identifiers which are used for object referencing to link information to the spatial object.

FeatureType.name: RelatedParty
FeatureType.title: related party
FeatureType.definition: An organisation or a person with a role related to a resource.
FeatureType.description: NOTE 1 A party, typically an individual person, acting as a general point of contact for a resource can be specified without providing any particular role.

FeatureAttribute.name: individualName
FeatureAttribute.title: individual name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name of the related person.

FeatureAttribute.name: organisationName
FeatureAttribute.title: organisation name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name of the related organisation.

FeatureAttribute.name: positionName
FeatureAttribute.title: position name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Position of the party in relation to a resource, such as head of department.

FeatureAttribute.name: contact
FeatureAttribute.definition: Contact information for the related party.

FeatureAttribute.name: role
FeatureAttribute.definition: Role(s) of the party in relation to a resource, such as owner.

FeatureType.name: LegislationCitation
FeatureType.title: legislation citation
FeatureType.definition: Citation for the purposes of unambiguously referencing a legal act or a specific part of a legal act.

FeatureAttribute.name: identificationNumber
FeatureAttribute.title: identification number
FeatureAttribute.definition: Code used to identify the legislative instrument
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE 1: 2007/2/EC is the identification number for the INSPIRE Directive
EXAMPLE 2: 2008/50/EC is the identification number for the CAFE Directive
EXAMPLE 3: 2000/60/EC is the identification number for the Water Framework Directive

FeatureAttribute.name: officialDocumentNumber
FeatureAttribute.title: official document number
FeatureAttribute.definition: Official document number used to uniquely identify the legislative instrument.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE: An official document number may be assigned to uniquely identify the legislative instrument.
EXAMPLE: CELEX Number used to uniquely identify European Union Legislation

FeatureAttribute.name: dateEnteredIntoForce
FeatureAttribute.title: date entered into force
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date the legislative instrument entered into force.

FeatureAttribute.name: dateRepealed
FeatureAttribute.title: date repealed
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date the legislative instrument was repealed.

FeatureAttribute.name: level
FeatureAttribute.title: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: The level at which the legislative instrument is adopted.

FeatureAttribute.name: journalCitation
FeatureAttribute.title: journal citation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Citation of the official journal in which the legislation is published.

FeatureType.name: Bio-geographicalRegion
FeatureType.title: bio-geographical region
FeatureType.definition: An area in which there are relatively homogeneous ecological conditions with common characteristics.
FeatureType.description: EXAMPLE Europe is divided into eleven broad bio-geographical terrestrial zones and 5 zones for marine bio-geographical regions.
NOTE The marine regions are used in the context of Natura2000 due to practical / technical reasons only; they do not have any legal status in contrast to the "terrestrial" Bio-geographical Regions.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.title: inspire id
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry defining the ecological region.

FeatureAttribute.name: regionClassification
FeatureAttribute.title: region classification
FeatureAttribute.definition: Regionclass code, according to a classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: regionClassificationScheme
FeatureAttribute.title: region classification scheme
FeatureAttribute.definition: Classification scheme used for classifying regions.

FeatureAttribute.name: regionClassificationLevel
FeatureAttribute.title: region classification level
FeatureAttribute.definition: The classification level of the region class.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: begin lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: end lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

ApplicationSchema.name: Buildings3D
ApplicationSchema.definition: The 3D application schema for INSPIRE theme buildings.

FeatureType.name: Building
FeatureType.definition: A Building is an enclosed construction above and/or underground, used or intended for the shelter of humans, animals or things or for the production of economic goods. A building refers to any structure permanently constructed or erected on its site.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry2D
FeatureAttribute.title: geometry 2D
FeatureAttribute.definition: <font color="#0f0f0f">2D or 2.5D geometric representation.</font>
<font color="#0f0f0f">
</font><font color="#0f0f0f">
FeatureAttribute.description: </font>
<font color="#0f0f0f">NOTE: Multiple representations of the geometry are possible (e.g. by surface and by point).</font>

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry3DLoD1
FeatureAttribute.title: geometry 3D LoD 1
FeatureAttribute.definition: 3D geometric representation at level of detail (LoD) 1, consisting of the generalized representation of the outer boundary by vertical lateral surfaces and horizontal base polygons.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry3DLoD2
FeatureAttribute.title: geometry 3D LoD 2
FeatureAttribute.definition: 3D geometric representation at level of detail (LoD) 2, consisting of the generalized representation of the outer boundary by vertical lateral surfaces and a prototypical roof shape or cover (from a defined list of roof shapes)
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE: The prototypical roof shapes come from a defined list of roof shapes, in City GML; this list is equivalent to the code list RoofTypeValue, provided in the extended2D profile (without the hyperbolic parabaloidal roof).

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry3DLoD3
FeatureAttribute.title: geometry 3D LoD 3
FeatureAttribute.definition: 3D geometric representation at level of detail (LoD) 3, consisting of the detailed representation of the outer boundary (including protrusions, facade elements and window recesses) as well as of the roof shape (including dormers, chimneys).

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry3DLoD4
FeatureAttribute.title: geometry 3D LoD 4
FeatureAttribute.definition: 3D geometric representation at level of detail (LoD) 4, consisting of the detailed representation of the outer boundary (including protrusions, facade elements, and window recesses) as well as of the roof shape (including dormers, chimneys).
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE: The LoD4 representation is equivalent to the LoD3 representation in core 3D application schema. The LoD 4 representation is more meaningful in extended 3D application schema, with the optional description of building interior.

FeatureType.name: BuildingPart
FeatureType.title: Building part
FeatureType.definition: A BuildingPart is a sub-division of a Building that might be considered itself as a building.
FeatureType.description: NOTE 1: A building part is homogeneous related to its physical, functional and temporal aspects.
EXAMPLE: A building may be composed of two building parts having different heights above ground.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry2D
FeatureAttribute.title: geometry 2D
FeatureAttribute.definition: <font color="#0f0f0f">2D or 2.5D geometric representation.</font>
<font color="#0f0f0f">
</font><font color="#0f0f0f">
FeatureAttribute.description: </font>
<font color="#0f0f0f">NOTE: Multiple representations of the geometry are possible (e.g. by surface and by point).</font>

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry3DLoD1
FeatureAttribute.title: geometry 3D LoD 1
FeatureAttribute.definition: 3D geometric representation at level of detail (LoD) 1, consisting of the generalized representation of the outer boundary by vertical lateral surfaces and horizontal base polygons.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry3DLoD2
FeatureAttribute.title: geometry 3D LoD 2
FeatureAttribute.definition: 3D geometric representation at level of detail (LoD) 2, consisting of the generalized representation of the outer boundary by vertical lateral surfaces and a prototypical roof shape or cover (from a defined list of roof shapes).

NOTE: The prototypical roof shapes come from a defined list of roof shapes, in City GML; this list is equivalent to the code list RoofTypeValue, provided in the extended2D profile (without the hyperbolic parabaloidal roof).

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry3DLoD3
FeatureAttribute.title: geometry 3D LoD 3
FeatureAttribute.definition: 3D geometric representation at level of detail (LoD) 3, consisting of the detailed representation of the outer boundary (including protrusions, facade elements and window recesses) as well as of the roof shape (including dormers, chimneys).

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry3DLoD4
FeatureAttribute.title: geometry 3D LoD 4
FeatureAttribute.definition: 3D geometric representation at level of detail (LoD) 4, consisting of the detailed representation of the outer boundary (including protrusions, facade elements, and window recesses) as well as of the roof shape (including dormers, chimneys).
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE: The LoD4 representation is equivalent to the LoD3 representation in core 3D application schema. The LoD 4 representation is more meaningful in extended 3D application schema, with the optional description of building interior.

FeatureType.name: BuildingGeometry3DLoD
FeatureType.title: Building geometry 3D LoD
FeatureType.definition: Data type grouping the 3D geometry of a building or building part and the metadata information attached to this geometry.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometryMultiSurface
FeatureAttribute.title: Geometry multi-surface
FeatureAttribute.definition: Representation of the outer boundary by a Multi Surface, which may - in contrast to a solid representation - not be topologically clean. In particular, the ground surface may be missing.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometrySolid
FeatureAttribute.title: Geometry solid
FeatureAttribute.definition: Representation of the outer boundary by a solid.

FeatureAttribute.name: terrainIntersection
FeatureAttribute.title: Terrain intersection
FeatureAttribute.definition: Line or multi-line where the spatial object (Building, BuildingPart, ...) touches the terrain representation.

FeatureAttribute.name: verticalGeometryReference3DBottom
FeatureAttribute.title: Vertical geometry reference 3D bottom
FeatureAttribute.definition: Height level to which the lower height of the model (Z-value of the lower horizontal polygon) refers to.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: generalGround, bottomOfConstruction.

FeatureAttribute.name: horizontalGeometryEstimatedAccuracy
FeatureAttribute.title: Horizontal geometry estimated accuracy
FeatureAttribute.definition: The estimated absolute positional accuracy of the (X,Y) coordinates of the geometry, in the INSPIRE official Coordinate Reference System. Absolute positional accuracy is defined as the mean value of the positional uncertainties for a set of positions where the positional uncertainties are defined as the distance between a measured position and what is considered as the corresponding true position.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE: this mean value may come from quality measures on a homogeneous population of buildings or from an estimation based on the knowledge of the production processes and of their accuracy.

FeatureAttribute.name: verticalGeometryEstimatedAccuracy
FeatureAttribute.title: Vertical geometry estimated accuracy
FeatureAttribute.definition: The estimated absolute positional accuracy of the Z- coordinate of the geometry, in the INSPIRE official Coordinate Reference System. Absolute positional accuracy is defined as the mean value of the positional uncertainties for a set of positions where the positional uncertainties are defined as the distance between a measured position and what is considered as the corresponding true position.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE: this mean value may come from quality measures on a homogeneous population of buildings or from an estimation based on the knowledge of the production processes and of their accuracy.

FeatureType.name: BuildingGeometry3DLoD1
FeatureType.title: Building geometry 3D LoD 1
FeatureType.definition: Data type grouping the specific metadata attached to the 3D geometry, when provided by a LoD 1 representation.

FeatureAttribute.name: horizontalGeometryReference
FeatureAttribute.title: Horizontal geometry reference
FeatureAttribute.definition: Element of the real world object that was captured by the (X,Y) coordinates of the LoD1 Multisurface or Solid geometry.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: footprint, roof edge

FeatureAttribute.name: verticalGeometryReference3DTop
FeatureAttribute.title: Vertical geometry reference 3D top
FeatureAttribute.definition: Height level to which the upper height of the model (Z-value of the upper horizontal polygon) refers to.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: generalRoof, lowestRoof Edge.

FeatureType.name: BuildingGeometry3DLoD2
FeatureType.title: Building geometry 3D LoD 2
FeatureType.definition: Data type grouping the specific metadata attached to the 3D geometry, when provided by a LoD2 representation.

FeatureAttribute.name: horizontalGeometryReference
FeatureAttribute.title: Horizontal geometry reference
FeatureAttribute.definition: Element that was captured by the (X,Y) coordinates of the LoD2 MultiSurface or Solid geometry.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: footprint, roof edge

FeatureType.name: Pipe
FeatureType.title: pipe
FeatureType.definition: A utility link or link sequence for the conveyance of solids, liquids, chemicals or gases from one location to another.
A pipe can also be used as an object to encase several cables (a bundle of cables) or other (smaller) pipes.
FeatureType.description: <font color="#1a1a1a">This class also extends the LinkSet featureType, which allows Cable, Pipe and Duct classes to use either the (more complex) LinkSequence or (more simple) Link class.</font>

FeatureAttribute.name: pipeDiameter
FeatureAttribute.title: pipe diameter
FeatureAttribute.definition: Pipe outer diameter.
FeatureAttribute.description: For convex shaped objects (e.g. a circle) the diameter is defined to be the largest distance that can be formed between two opposite parallel lines tangent to its boundery.

FeatureAttribute.name: pressure
FeatureAttribute.definition: The maximum allowable operating pressure at which a product is conveyed through a pipe.
FeatureAttribute.description: The unit of measure for pressure is commonly expressed in "bar".

RelationshipRole.name: cables
RelationshipRole.definition: A pipe may contain one or more cables.

RelationshipRole.name: role_T31393
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: pipes
RelationshipRole.definition: A pipe may contain one or more pipes.

RelationshipRole.name: role_T31398
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: UtilityNodeContainer
FeatureType.title: utility node container
FeatureType.definition: A point spatial object which is used for connectivity, and also may contain other spatial objects (not neccessarily belonging to the same utility network).
FeatureType.description: Nodes are found at either end of the UtilityLink.
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Location of the utility node container.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

RelationshipRole.name: nodes
RelationshipRole.definition: Contained utility nodes.

RelationshipRole.name: role_T31389
RelationshipRole.definition: Utility node(s) container, e.g. manhole or pole.
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: UtilityLink
FeatureType.definition: -- name --
utility Link
-- definition --
A linear spatial object that describes the geometry and connectivity of a utility network between two points in the network.
FeatureType.description: NOTE Derived 'views' of real-world utility objects are represented through specialisations in other application schemas; all representations of the same real-world object share a common geographic name.

FeatureType.name: UtilityLinkSet
FeatureType.title: utility linkset
FeatureType.definition: <font color="#1a1a1a">An abstract utility network class which groups common properties of Cable, Pipe and Duct featureTypes.</font>
FeatureType.description: <font color="#1a1a1a">This class also extends the LinkSet featureType, which allows Cable, Pipe and Duct classes to use either the (more complex) LinkSequence or (more simple) Link class.</font>
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: utilityDeliveryType
FeatureAttribute.title: utility delivery type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Kind of utility delivery network e.g. transport, distribution, collection ...

FeatureAttribute.name: warningType
FeatureAttribute.title: warning type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Kind of overground visible warning mechanism used to indicate an underground utility network element.

FeatureType.name: UtilityLinkSequence
FeatureType.definition: -- name --
utility Link Sequence
-- description --

A linear spatial object, composed of an ordered collection of utility links, which represents a continuous path in the utility network without any branches. The element has a defined beginning and end and every position on the utility link sequence is identifiable with one single parameter.
FeatureType.description: EXAMPLE A link sequence may represent a route.

FeatureType.name: Appurtenance
FeatureType.title: appurtenance
FeatureType.definition: An appurtenance is a node object that is described by its type (via the attribute "appurtenanceType").
FeatureType.description: The "appurtenanceType" attribute uses the "AppurtenanceTypeValue" codelist for its values. But this is an empty codelist that needs to be extended by a concrete codelist of appurtenance types for each utility network type.
So e.g. for the electricity network, the "ElectricityAppurtenanceTypeValue" codelist should be used.

FeatureAttribute.name: appurtenanceType
FeatureAttribute.title: appurtenance type value
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of appurtenance
FeatureAttribute.description: The "AppurtenanceTypeValue" codelist is an abstract codelist that can be replaced by the various appurtenance type value codelists for each utility network.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificAppurtenanceType
FeatureAttribute.title: specific appurtenance type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of appurtenance according to a domain-specific classification.

FeatureType.name: Tower
FeatureType.title: tower
FeatureType.definition: Simple tower object which may carry utility objects belonging to either single or multiple utility networks.
FeatureType.description: Towers represent node objects that support reservoirs, cables or antennas.

FeatureAttribute.name: towerHeight
FeatureAttribute.title: tower height
FeatureAttribute.definition: The height of the tower.
FeatureAttribute.description: The height is the vertical extend measuring accross the object - in this case, the tower - at right angles to the lenght.

FeatureType.name: UtilityNode
FeatureType.title: utility node
FeatureType.definition: A point spatial object which is used for connectivity.
FeatureType.description: Nodes are found at both ends of the UtilityLink.
This type is abstract.

FeatureType.name: UtilityNetwork
FeatureType.title: utility network
FeatureType.definition: Collection of network elements that belong to a single type of utility network.
FeatureType.description: In the real world, objects are connected to each other: an optical cable is connected to a multiplexer that in turn is connected to copper cables connecting into our homes to provide cable TV, telephony and internet access. Using GIS to support network utility management typically involves many types of features that may have connectivity to each other. Topology in GIS is generally defined as the spatial relationship between connecting or adjacent features, and is an essential prerequisite for many spatial operations such as network analysis. Utility networks can be described as NaN (Node-Arc-Node) network using two basic geometric types: points (aka nodes) and polylines (aka arcs). NaN topologies can be directed or un-directed, depending on specific type of network (i.e. water networks are directed, while telecommunications networks are not). Such topology structure provides an automated way to handle digitising and editing errors, and enable advanced spatial analyses such as adjacency, connectivity and containment. Infrastructure networks rely on Generic network model developed during Annex I.
Note:

Via the attribute "utilityNetworkType", that uses the "UtilityNetworkTypeValue" codelist, the type of utility network can be defined. E.g. by selecting the "sewer" value, the utility network becomes a "sewer utility network".
Using the "crossTheme" value, a utility network can be created that contains e.g. ducts, which can contain pipes and cables from various utility network types.

FeatureAttribute.name: utilityNetworkType
FeatureAttribute.title: utility network type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of utility network or the utilily network theme.
FeatureAttribute.description: Uses the codelist "UtilityNetworkTypeValue" to describe the possible utility networks. This also contains the "crossTheme" value to be used for utility networks that can contain cables or pipes from various themes, typically used by utility network providers that provide ducts.

FeatureAttribute.name: authorityRole
FeatureAttribute.title: authority role
FeatureAttribute.definition: Parties authorized to manage a utility network, such as maintainers, operators or owners.

FeatureAttribute.name: utilityFacilityReference
FeatureAttribute.title: utility facility reference
FeatureAttribute.definition: Reference to a facility activity complex that is linked to (e.g. part of) this utility network.
FeatureAttribute.description: This reference can be used to link utility facilities - having a more complex geometry - to a utility network.

FeatureAttribute.name: disclaimer
FeatureAttribute.definition: Legal text describing confidentiality clauses applying to the utility network information.

RelationshipRole.name: networks
RelationshipRole.definition: A single sub-network that can be considered as part of a higher-order utility network.

RelationshipRole.name: role_T31406
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: Pole
FeatureType.title: pole
FeatureType.definition: Simple pole (mast) object which may carry utility objects belonging to either single or multiple utility networks.
FeatureType.description: Poles represent node objects that can support utility devices and cables.

FeatureAttribute.name: poleHeight
FeatureAttribute.title: pole height
FeatureAttribute.definition: The height of the pole.
FeatureAttribute.description: The height is the vertical extend measuring accross the object - in this case, the pole - at right angles to the lenght.

FeatureType.name: UtilityNetworkElement
FeatureType.title: utility network element
FeatureType.definition: Abstract base type representing an utility network element in an utility network. Every element in an utility network provides some function that is of interest in the utility network.
FeatureType.description: NOTE Derived 'views' of real-world utility objects are represented through specialisations in other application schemas; all representations of the same real-world object share a common geographic name.
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: currentStatus
FeatureAttribute.title: current status
FeatureAttribute.definition: The status of an utility object with regards to its completion and use.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.title: valid from
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the utility network element started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.title: valid to
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the utility network element no longer exists in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: verticalPosition
FeatureAttribute.title: vertical position
FeatureAttribute.definition: Vertical position of the utility object relative to ground.

FeatureAttribute.name: utilityFacilityReference
FeatureAttribute.title: utility facility reference
FeatureAttribute.definition: Reference to a facility activity complex that is linked (related) to this utility network element.
FeatureAttribute.description: This reference can be used to link a utility facility - having a more complex geometry - to a utility network element.

FeatureAttribute.name: governmentalServiceReference
FeatureAttribute.title: governmental service reference
FeatureAttribute.definition: Reference to a governmental service object that is linked (related) to this utility network element.
FeatureAttribute.description: This reference can be used to link a governmental service object to a utility network element.

FeatureType.name: Cabinet
FeatureType.title: cabinet
FeatureType.definition: Simple cabinet object which may carry utility objects belonging to either single or multiple utility networks.
FeatureType.description: Cabinets represent mountable node objects that can contain smaller utility devices and cables.

FeatureType.name: Manhole
FeatureType.title: manhole
FeatureType.definition: Simple container object which may contain either single or multiple utility networks objects.
FeatureType.description: Manholes perform following functions:
<ul>
• Provide drainage for the conduit system so that freezing water does not damage the conduit or wires.
• Provide a location for bending the conduit run without damaging the wires.
• Provide a junction for conduits coming from different directions.
• Provide access to the system for maintenance.

FeatureType.name: Cable
FeatureType.title: cable
FeatureType.definition: A utility link or link sequence used to convey electricity or data from one location to another.
FeatureType.description: <font color="#1a1a1a">This class also extends the LinkSet featureType, which allows Cable, Pipe and Duct classes to use either the (more complex) LinkSequence or (more simple) Link class.</font>
This type is abstract.

FeatureType.name: Duct
FeatureType.title: duct
FeatureType.definition: A utility link or link sequence used to protect and guide cable and pipes via an encasing construction.
FeatureType.description: A Duct (or Conduit, or Duct-bank, or Wireway) is a linear object which belongs to the structural network. It is the outermost casing. A Duct may contain Pipe(s), Cable(s) or other Duct(s).
Duct is a concrete feature class that contains information about the position and characteristics of ducts as seen from a manhole, vault, or a cross section of a trench and duct.

FeatureAttribute.name: ductWidth
FeatureAttribute.title: duct width
FeatureAttribute.definition: The width of the duct.
FeatureAttribute.description: The measurement of the object - in this case, the duct - from side to side.

RelationshipRole.name: ducts
