RelationshipRole.definition: A single duct or set of ducts that constitute the inner-duct.

RelationshipRole.name: role_T31386
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: cables
RelationshipRole.definition: A duct may contain one or more cables.

RelationshipRole.name: role_T31387
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: pipes
RelationshipRole.definition: The set of pipes that constitute the duct bank.

RelationshipRole.name: role_T31394
RelationshipRole.definition: The duct bank holding zero or more pipes.
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: Schedule
FeatureType.definition: Reoccurring time period defining when an activity is controlled.

FeatureAttribute.name: day
FeatureAttribute.definition: Day on which the restriction starts or days on which the restriction occurs.
FeatureAttribute.description: The day could either be defined as either a Date or as a Day.

FeatureAttribute.name: startDate
FeatureAttribute.definition: Day on which the restriction ends.

FeatureAttribute.name: endDate
FeatureAttribute.definition: Day on which the restriction ends.

FeatureAttribute.name: startTime
FeatureAttribute.definition: Time defining when the controlled activity starts.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: Valid values include:
<ul>
NOTE: if the startTime is empty then it shall be inferred that the restriction applies for 24 hours.

FeatureAttribute.name: endTime
FeatureAttribute.definition: Time defining when the controlled activity starts.
--Description
NOTE: if the endTime is empty then it shall be inferred that the restriction applies for 24 hours.

FeatureType.name: DayOrDate
FeatureType.definition: Choice to specify either the day or start day on which a restriction applies if it is a reoccurring scheduled restriction or a specific date or start date on which a restriction applies.

FeatureAttribute.name: day
FeatureAttribute.definition: A specified day

FeatureAttribute.name: date
FeatureAttribute.definition: A specified date

FeatureType.name: ControlledActivityInformation
FeatureType.definition: Information describing the type of activity that is controlled within the zone.

FeatureAttribute.name: controlMeasure
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of control method used to manage activities or measures within the zone.
FeatureAttribute.description: An activity can be controlled using different types of method to achieve different types of objective.
EXAMPLES:
<ul>
• Water abstraction or mineral extraction may be regulated (i.e. require a permit) to avoid over-utilisation of a resource
• Animal movements may be restricted or prohibited in the instance of an animal health epidemic (e.g. blue tongue or avian influenza)
• Hunting may be permitted or prohibited during a specific time.

FeatureAttribute.name: activity
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of activity that is controlled within the zone.
FeatureAttribute.description: This is an extensible INSPIRE codelist containing high-level classification of activity areas. The specific type of activity that this controlled should be defined using the specialisedActivity.

FeatureAttribute.name: specialisedActivity
FeatureAttribute.definition: Specific activity type defining the activity that is controlled in the zone.
FeatureAttribute.description: The specialisedActivity is a codelist value that should be derived from thematic or Member State codelist. The specialisedActivity should be an relevant activity that has a narrower definition than the ControlledActivityType.
Example:

If the ControlledActivityType is "plantAndAnimalHealth" the specialisedActivity could be "movement" or more specifically "animalMovement" and "humanMovement" (if human movements into an out of a restricted zone apply as was the case with Foot and Mouth disease outbreak in the UK).

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.definition: Narrative summary providing any additional information that explains what controls apply to the activity.

FeatureAttribute.name: restrictionPeriod
FeatureAttribute.definition: Time period defining when restrictions apply.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE: Specific controls may apply to the activities or measures within specified time periods.
There are several key use cases for defining a schedule for an activity such as a restriction:
Define a day or set of days: Monday or Weekends or Public Holidays
Define a range of days: Monday to Thursday
Define a set of days: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday
Define a date or range of dates: 2010-10-01 or 2010-04-01 to 2010-04-30
Define a day/range or set of days and time period: Monday between 12:30-13:30, Monday to Thursday 9am to 5pm 2010-10-01 between 12:30 and 17:00

FeatureType.name: ManagementRestrictionOrRegulationZone
FeatureType.definition: Area managed, regulated or used for reporting at international, European, national, regional and local levels.
FeatureType.description: Extended to include information describing activities that are controlled to achieve specific environment objectives within the zone.

FeatureAttribute.name: controlledActivity
FeatureAttribute.definition: A controlled activity is an activity that is either permitted, prohibited, promoted or restricted within the zone.
FeatureAttribute.description: The ManagementRestrictionOrRegulationZone has been established to achieve or maintain good environmental status. To achieve this goal Public Authorities must establish a range of measures. These measures may include controlling particular activities within the zone. Examples include:
<ul>
• controlling emissions to the environment
• restricting movements within the zone
• limiting pollutant values to protect health
• controlling urban or industrial development to protect cultural heritage, nature and biodiversity and greenspaces

FeatureType.name: Coverage
FeatureType.title: coverage
FeatureType.definition: Spatial object that acts as a function to return values from its range for any direct position within its spatial, temporal or spatiotemporal domain.
FeatureType.description: EXAMPLE Examples include a raster image, polygon overlay or digital elevation matrix.

NOTE In other words, a coverage is a feature that has multiple values for each attribute type, where each direct position within the geometric representation of the feature has a single value for each attribute type.
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: metadata
FeatureAttribute.definition: Application specific metadata of the coverage.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The values of this property will typically be constrained in subtypes or in profiles specified by information communities.

FeatureAttribute.name: rangeType
FeatureAttribute.title: range type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Description of the structure of the range values.

ApplicationSchema.name: Coverages (Geometry-Value Pairs)
ApplicationSchema.definition: application schema for coverages with a geometry/value pair representation
ApplicationSchema.description: NOTE This application schema has been specified to be conceptually consistent with the coverage model used by the OGC Best Practice document 06-188r1 "GML Encoding of Discrete Coverages (interleaved pattern)".

FeatureType.name: GeometryValuePair
FeatureType.title: geometry-value pair
FeatureType.definition: describes an element of a set that defines the relationships of a discrete coverage
FeatureType.description: Each instance consists of two parts: a domain object from the domain of the coverage to which it belongs and a record of feature attribute values from the range of the coverage to which it belongs.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: the domain object

FeatureAttribute.name: value
FeatureAttribute.definition: holds the record of feature attribute values associated with the domain object in the property "geometry"

FeatureType.name: MultiTimeInstantCoverage
FeatureType.title: multi time instant coverage
FeatureType.definition: coverage characterized by a finite domain consisting of time instants
FeatureType.description: NOTE This type provides a representation of the time instant/value pairs, i.e. represents a time series.

FeatureType.name: DiscreteCoverageGeometryValuePairs
FeatureType.title: coverage (geometry-value pair representation)
FeatureType.definition: coverage which provides the geometry value pairs
FeatureType.description: EXAMPLE Examples include a raster image, polygon overlay or digital elevation matrix.

NOTE In other words, a coverage is a feature that has multiple values for each attribute type, where each direct position within the geometric representation of the feature has a single value for each attribute type.

FeatureAttribute.name: domainExtent
FeatureAttribute.title: domain extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: contains the extent of the domain of the coverage
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Extents may be specified in space, time or space-time.

FeatureAttribute.name: element
FeatureAttribute.title: alement
FeatureAttribute.definition: list of the geometry/value pairs of the coverage

FeatureType.name: ElectricityCable
FeatureType.title: electricity cable
FeatureType.definition: A utility link or link sequence used to convey electricity from one location to another.

FeatureAttribute.name: operatingVoltage
FeatureAttribute.title: operating voltage
FeatureAttribute.definition: The utilization or operating voltage by the equipment using the electricity.

FeatureAttribute.name: nominalVoltage
FeatureAttribute.title: nominal voltage
FeatureAttribute.definition: The nominal system voltage at the point of supply.

FeatureType.name: ElevationGridCoverageAggregation
FeatureType.title: elevation grid coverage aggregation
FeatureType.definition: Geometrical characteristics of the elevation grid coverage aggregation.

FeatureAttribute.name: contributingFootprint
FeatureAttribute.title: contributing footprint
FeatureAttribute.definition: Multi polygon delineating the geographic area of the elevation grid coverage that contributes to the aggregated elevation grid coverage.

FeatureType.name: ElevationGridCoverage
FeatureType.title: elevation grid coverage
FeatureType.definition: Continuous coverage which uses a systematic tessellation based on a regular rectified quadrilateral grid to cover its domain, where the elevation property value is usually known for each of the grid points forming this domain.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE Adapted from [ISO 19123:2005].

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: begin lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: domainExtent
FeatureAttribute.title: domain extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: Extent of the spatiotemporal domain of the coverage.
FeatureAttribute.description: SOURCE [ISO 19123:2005].
NOTE 1 The data type EX_Extent, is defined in ISO 19103. Extents may be specified in both space and time.

NOTE 2 The domain extent shall be specified at least in space by using EX_BoundingPolygon, EX_GeographicBoundingBox or EX_GeographicDescription. The whole geographic extent of the elevation coverage is affected, including areas where grid points hold nil reason values.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: end lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.title: inspire ID
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: propertyType
FeatureAttribute.title: property type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Attribute determining the elevation property represented by the elevation grid coverage.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE Height, depth.

FeatureAttribute.name: surfaceType
FeatureAttribute.title: surface type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Attribute indicating the type of elevation surface that the coverage describes in relation to the Earth's bare surface.

RelationshipRole.name: contributingElevationGridCoverage
RelationshipRole.title: contributing elevation grid coverage
RelationshipRole.definition: Reference to the elevation grid coverages that compose an aggregated elevation grid coverage.
The association has additional properties as defined in the association class ElevationGridCoverageAggregation.

RelationshipRole.name: role_T32222
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: ElevationTIN
FeatureType.title: elevation TIN
FeatureType.definition: Collection of elevation spatial objects forming a particular tessellation of the space based on a Triangulated Irregular Network (TIN) according the geometry GM_Tin (defined in ISO 19107:2003). Its components are a set of control points whose elevation property values are known, and a set of break lines and stop lines.
FeatureType.description: NOTE The TIN can be calculated using any triangulation method, which determines the spatial relationships between the spatial objects in the collection.
EXAMPLE An elevation TIN model calculated by means of the Delaunay triangulation method.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: begin lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: end lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometries
FeatureAttribute.definition: Represents the collection of geometric properties of the elevation TIN spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.title: inspire ID
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: propertyType
FeatureAttribute.title: property type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Attribute determining the elevation property represented by the elevation TIN.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE Height, depth.

FeatureAttribute.name: surfaceType
FeatureAttribute.title: surface type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Attribute indicating the type of elevation surface that the elevation TIN describes in relation to the Earth's bare surface.

FeatureType.name: SpotElevation
FeatureType.title: spot elevation
FeatureType.definition: Point spatial object which describes the elevation of an Earth's surface at a specific location. It provides a single elevation property value.
FeatureType.description: NOTE 1 It often represents a singular point in the morphology of a land or water body's floor surface.
NOTE 2 The attribute propertyType is equal to 'height' in the case of spot heights. It is equal to 'depth' in the case of spot depths.

FeatureAttribute.name: classification
FeatureAttribute.definition: Class of spot elevation according to the LAS specification of the American Society for Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing (ASPRS).

FeatureAttribute.name: geographicalName
FeatureAttribute.title: geographical name
FeatureAttribute.definition: A geographical name that is used to identify a named land or water body's floor location in the real world, which is represented by the spot elevation spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Represents the geometric properties of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: propertyValue
FeatureAttribute.title: property value
FeatureAttribute.definition: Value of the elevation property of the spatial object referred to a specific vertical coordinate reference system.

FeatureAttribute.name: spotElevationType
FeatureAttribute.title: spot elevation type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of elevation spot.

FeatureType.name: ChartDatum
FeatureType.title: chart datum
FeatureType.definition: Local vertical coordinate reference system which is used to refer and portray depth measurements as property values.
FeatureType.description: NOTE This data type is intended to describe the main characteristics of a vertical CRS for measurement of depths in cases where this information is rarely or not available through a CRS registry (e.g. like EPSG).
EXAMPLE Local datums for referring depths in lakes and navigable rivers.

FeatureAttribute.name: datumWaterLevel
FeatureAttribute.title: datum water level
FeatureAttribute.definition: Water level determining the origin of depth measurements for the chart datum.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE High water, low water, etc.
NOTE 1 Values in the code list are applicable either for sea or inland waters.

NOTE 2 When defining a depth datum for inland waters, it is recommended the use of "highWater", "lowWater" or "meanWaterLevel" - as applicable. All the other levels in the code list are well defined but usually just locally and do not serve for cross border purposes.

FeatureAttribute.name: offset
FeatureAttribute.definition: Relative difference between the height of each reference point and the height of the water level determining the chart datum.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE 1 In order to calculate the offset parameter, the height(s) of the reference point(s) and the height of the water level determining the chart datum must be compared in the same vertical CRS.
NOTE 2 When a single reference point is provided, the offset parameter is supposed to be zero (by default). If this condition is true, there is no need to inform the offset parameter.

NOTE 3 When a set of reference points is provided, an individual offset parameter shall be provided for each of these points. The multiplicity between both properties - "referencePoint" and "offset" - is ordered with the aim to maintain this correspondence.

FeatureAttribute.name: referencePoint
FeatureAttribute.title: reference point
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geographical position(s) of:
- Case A: a single point which is used to refer depth values within the geographical scope of the chart datum.
- Case B: a set of points where water level measurements are performed to determine the water level of the chart datum.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE 1 The altimetric position of each reference point must be its height in a common vertical CRS:
- in EVRS within its geographical scope (continental Europe).
- in a vertical CRS identified and documented by the Member State concerned, outside the geographical scope of EVRS (overseas territories).
<font color="#ff0000">

</font>NOTE 2 In Case A - The altimetric position of the reference point can be directly utilised as input to calculate approximate heights in a common vertical CRS for those vector objects whose depth values are referred to the chart datum.

NOTE 3 In Case B - The altimetric positions of the reference points can be utilised, together with the respective offset parameter, as input to calculate approximate heights in a common vertical CRS for those vector objects whose depth values are referred to the water level of the chart datum.
NOTE 4 The common vertical CRS mentioned in Note 2 and Note 3 shall be the one determined by Note 1.

FeatureAttribute.name: scope
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geographic scope in which the local depth datum is practically used.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Chart datums should only be used to refer and portray depths at local level, since they are determined by a local water level.
EXAMPLE 1 Lake or part of a lake in which a specific water level is used as depth datum.
EXAMPLE 2 River section in which a specific water level is used as depth datum.
EXAMPLE 3 Extent of the sea area in which a specific local tide level is used as depth datum.

FeatureType.name: VoidArea
FeatureType.title: void area
FeatureType.definition: Area of the Earth's surface where the elevation model is unknown because of missing input data. This area shall be excluded from a DEM.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE "ObscureArea" [GIS4EU D3.5].
NOTE 1 A void area may contain a number of isolated areas with elevation data. These are considered as holes of the container void area.
NOTE 2 Void areas can be useful as masks when calculating a more appropriate or accurate DEM.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Represents the geometric properties of the spatial object.

FeatureType.name: ElevationVectorObject
FeatureType.title: elevation vector object
FeatureType.definition: Elevation spatial object forming part of a vector data set, which participates in the description of the elevation property of a real world surface. It consists of an identity base for all vector objects which can be included as part of an elevation data set.
FeatureType.description: It is an abstract feature type which generically describes every possible type of elevation vector object. It includes common attributes, properties and constraints for such spatial objects.
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: begin lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: end lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: localDepthDatum
FeatureAttribute.title: local depth datum
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identification of a local vertical coordinate reference system not included in a registry, which is used to refer depth measurements.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE This data type is applicable only to bathymetric vector objects.
EXAMPLE Local datums for referring depths in lakes and navigable rivers.

FeatureAttribute.name: propertyType
FeatureAttribute.title: property type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Attribute categorizing the elevation vector object as a land-elevation or a bathymetry spatial object. It determines the elevation property represented by the object.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE Height, depth.

FeatureType.name: IsolatedArea
FeatureType.title: isolated area
FeatureType.definition: Delimitation of an area of the Earth's surface where an isolated part of the elevation model exists. Its outside surroundings have no elevation information.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE Adapted from "IslandArea" [GIS4EU D3.5].
NOTE 1 It includes the delimitation of any island of elevation data which are isolated from the main DEM. They may be included inside void areas.
NOTE 2 Isolated areas can be useful as masks when calculating a more appropriate or accurate DEM.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Represents the geometric properties of the spatial object.

FeatureType.name: ContourLine
FeatureType.title: contour line
FeatureType.definition: Linear spatial object composed of a set of adjoining locations characterized by having the same elevation property value. It describes, together with other contour lines present in the area, the local morphology of the Earth's surface.
FeatureType.description: NOTE 1 The attribute propertyType is equal to 'height' in the case of contour lines and it is equal to 'depth' in the case of depth contours.

FeatureAttribute.name: contourLineType
FeatureAttribute.title: contour line type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of contour line with regard to the normal contour vertical interval (if any).
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE This attribute is often applicable to contour lines describing the relief of a land-based area. For depth contours describing the floor of a water body is not always applicable.

FeatureAttribute.name: downRight
FeatureAttribute.title: down right
FeatureAttribute.definition: Property indicating that the contour line spatial object is digitized in a way that the height of the elevation surface is lower at the right side of the line.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE 1 In the case of contour lines, when the downRight attribute is 'true' this indicates that the height of the surface is lower at the right side of the line.
NOTE 2 In the case of depth contours, when the downRight attribute is 'true' this indicates that the depth of the surface is higher at the right side of the line.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Represents the geometric properties of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: propertyValue
FeatureAttribute.title: property value
FeatureAttribute.definition: Value of the elevation property of the spatial object referred to a specific vertical coordinate reference system.

FeatureType.name: BreakLine
FeatureType.title: breakline
FeatureType.definition: A line of a critical nature which describes the shape of an elevation surface and indicates a discontinuity in the slope of the surface (i.e. an abrupt change in gradient). Triangles included within a TIN model must never cross it.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE Adapted from [ISO 19107:2003].
EXAMPLE
Breaklines represent local ridges or depressions (streams or drainage lines) in the surface, man-made structures (e.g. roads), etc.
NOTE 1 A breakline connects points with different elevation and therefore its description using 2.5-D coordinates (using the 'geometry' attribute) is fully recommended.
NOTE 2 No triangle in a TIN may cross a breakline (in other words, breakline segments are enforced as triangle edges), even if doing so violates the triangulation criterion.
NOTE 3 All breaklines are located on the ground surface or on any of the artificial structures built on it.
NOTE 4 Breaklines are useful as input data for the generation of a more appropriate or accurate digital elevation model by using interpolation methods.

FeatureAttribute.name: breakLineType
FeatureAttribute.title: break line type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of break line with regard the natural or man-made real world characteristic it represents, or the specific function it has in calculating a Digital Elevation Model (DEM).

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Represents the geometric properties of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: manMadeBreak
FeatureAttribute.title: man-made break
FeatureAttribute.definition: Line which represents an elevation break due to an artificial or man-made construction present on the terrain.

FeatureType.name: VerticalExtentRangeType
FeatureType.title: Vertical extent range type
FeatureType.definition: Value indicating the upper and lower bounds of the height/depth range.
FeatureType.description: In the case of depth, the range between the deepest (lower bound) and most shallow (upper bound) aspect of the deposit body, where the depth is true vertical depth below a chosen vertical reference level.

FeatureAttribute.name: lowerBound
FeatureAttribute.title: Lower bound
FeatureAttribute.definition: Value indicating the lower bound of the height/depth range.
FeatureAttribute.description: In the case of subsurface resources, true vertical depth below a chosen vertical reference level to the deepest vertex of the deposit body.

FeatureAttribute.name: upperBound
FeatureAttribute.title: Upper bound
FeatureAttribute.definition: Value indicating the upper bound of the height/depth range.
FeatureAttribute.description: In the case of subsurface resources, depth is the true vertical depth below a chosen vertical reference level to the shallowest vertex of the deposit body.

FeatureType.name: VerticalExtentValue
FeatureType.title: Vertical extent value
FeatureType.definition: Either a single number or a range of height/depth values to describe the height/depth position of an Energy Resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: range
FeatureAttribute.title: Range
FeatureAttribute.definition: Range of numbers representing the height or depth range of an Energy Resource.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE depth values are represented by negative numbers.

FeatureAttribute.name: scalar
FeatureAttribute.title: Scalar
FeatureAttribute.definition: Number representing the height or depth of an Energy Resource.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE depth values are represented by negative numbers.

FeatureType.name: VerticalExtentType
FeatureType.title: Vertical extent type
FeatureType.definition: Vertical dimensional property consisting of an absolute measure or range of measures referenced to a well-defined vertical reference level which is commonly taken as origin (ground level, mean sea level, etc.).

FeatureAttribute.name: verticalExtent
FeatureAttribute.title: Vertical extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: Extent of the vertical dimension represented by a scalar or by a range of values.

FeatureAttribute.name: verticalReference
FeatureAttribute.title: Vertical Reference
FeatureAttribute.definition: Reference level that was chosen to determine the vertical height/depth.

FeatureType.name: RenewableAndWastePotentialCoverage
FeatureType.title: Renewable and waste potential coverage
FeatureType.definition: Function that returns an energy potential value from its range for any direct position within its spatial, temporal or spatio-temporal domain.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE Adapted from "Coverage" [ISO 19123:2005].

FeatureAttribute.name: assessmentMethod
FeatureAttribute.title: Assessment method
FeatureAttribute.definition: A reference to the method used to assess the energy resource potential.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: domainExtent
FeatureAttribute.title: Domain extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: The attribute domainExtent shall contain the extent of the spatio-temporal domain of the coverage. Extents may be specified in both space and time.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE 1 The domain extent shall be specified at least in space by using EX_BoundingPolygon, EX_GeographicBoundingBox or EX_GeographicDescription.
NOTE 2 In specific cases information is needed on the vertical extent e.g. wind power potential.
SOURCE Adapted from [ISO 19123:2005].

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.title: Name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name of the coverage.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE The name of the catchment area for which a coverage has been extracted to represent Hydroelectric potential.

FeatureAttribute.name: potentialType
FeatureAttribute.title: Potential type
FeatureAttribute.definition: There are various types of potential energy, each associated with a particular type of power.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Most detailed classification must be provided.

FeatureAttribute.name: typeOfResource
FeatureAttribute.title: Type of resource
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of renewable and waste resource to which the measured phenomenon is applicable.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Most detailed classification must be provided.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTime
FeatureAttribute.title: Valid time
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time period for which this coverage is representative.

FeatureAttribute.name: verticalExtent
FeatureAttribute.title: Vertical extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: A number or a range of height/depth values to describe the height/depth for which the range set values are valid.
EXAMPLE wind power map represents wind power at a height of 80m above groundlevel.

FeatureType.name: CalorificValueType
FeatureType.title: Calorific value type.
FeatureType.definition: Value or range of values describing the calorific value of an Energy Resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: calorificRange
FeatureAttribute.title: Calorific range
FeatureAttribute.definition: A range of calorific values describing the calorific value of an Energy Resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: calorificScalar
FeatureAttribute.title: Calorific scalar
FeatureAttribute.definition: Measure quantifying the calorific property of an Energy Resource.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE the unit of measure to be used is the SI unit kJ/kg.

FeatureType.name: FossilFuelResourceType
FeatureType.title: Resource type
FeatureType.definition: Type and amount of resource according to specific categorisation.

FeatureAttribute.name: calorificValue
FeatureAttribute.title: <font color="#222226"></font> <font color="#222226">Calorific value</font> <font color="#222226"> </font><font color="#222226">
FeatureAttribute.definition: </font>
<font color="#222226">Each fossil fuel resource is characterised by its own calorific value, i.e. the quantity of energy available in a unit of mass.</font>
<font color="#222226">
</font><font color="#222226">
FeatureAttribute.description: </font>
<font color="#222226">NOTE the unit of measure to be used is MJ/tonne for solid fossil fuels, MJ/tonne for oil and KJ/m³ for natural gas </font>assuming reference gas conditions (15°C; 101,325 kPa)

FeatureAttribute.name: quantity
FeatureAttribute.title: Quantity
FeatureAttribute.definition: Amount of resource according to the specific categorisation.

FeatureAttribute.name: typeOfResource
FeatureAttribute.title: Type of resource
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of fossil fuel.

FeatureType.name: RenewableAndWasteResource
FeatureType.title: Renewable and waste resource
FeatureType.definition: A spatial object defining an inferred or observable spatial extent of a resource that can be, or has been used as a source of renewable energy or waste.
FeatureType.description: <font color="#222226">Renewable energy is energy that is naturally occurring and theoretically inexhausatable that is not derived from fossil or nuclear fuel. Waste is a fuel that may consist of many materials coming from combustible industrial, institutional, hospital and household wastes such as rubber, plastics, waste fossil oils and other similar commodities. It is either solid or liquid in form, renewable or non-renewable, biodegradable or non-biodegradable.</font>

FeatureAttribute.name: Capacity
FeatureAttribute.definition: Energy capacity of a renewable energy resource within the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE the unit of measure to be used is MWe for electrical generation capacity and MWt for heat generation capacity.

FeatureAttribute.name: dateOfDetermination
FeatureAttribute.title: Date of determination
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date on which the capacity of the resource has been determined.

FeatureAttribute.name: typeOfResource
FeatureAttribute.title: Type of resource
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of renewable energy or waste resource.

FeatureType.name: FossilFuelResource
FeatureType.title: Fossil fuel resource
FeatureType.definition: A spatial object defining an inferred or observable spatial extent of a resource that can be, or has been used as a source of fossil fuel energy. The most common fossil fuel types are coal, natural gas and crude oil.
FeatureType.description: <font color="#222226">Solid fossil fuels are those non-renewable hydrocarbon energy resources that are naturally found in the solid state i.e. coals and peat. Hydrocarbons cover various types of natural gas and petroleum resources.</font>

FeatureAttribute.name: dateOfDiscovery
FeatureAttribute.title: Date of discovery
FeatureAttribute.definition: The date the energy source was discovered.

FeatureAttribute.name: resource
FeatureAttribute.title: Resource
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type and amount of fossil fuel resources in a single spatial object.

FeatureType.name: CalorificRangeType
FeatureType.title: Calorific range type
FeatureType.definition: Value indicating the upper and lower bounds of the calorific range of the energy resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: lowerBound
FeatureAttribute.title: Lower bound
FeatureAttribute.definition: Value indicating the lower bound of the calorific range.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE the unit of measure to be used is the SI unit kJ/kg.

FeatureAttribute.name: upperBound
FeatureAttribute.title: Upper bound
FeatureAttribute.definition: Value indicating the upper bound of the calorific range.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE the unit of measure to be used is the SI unit kJ/kg.

FeatureType.name: VectorEnergyResource
FeatureType.title: Vector Energy Resource
FeatureType.definition: A vector spatial object defining an inferred or observable spatial extent of a resource that can be or has been used as a source of energy.
FeatureType.description: This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: ClassificationAndQuantificationFramework
FeatureAttribute.title: Classification and quantification framework
FeatureAttribute.definition: A reference classification scheme to classify and quantify energy resources.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE in most cases, only applicable to fossil fuels.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: exploitationPeriod
FeatureAttribute.title: Exploitation period
FeatureAttribute.definition: The exploitationPeriod defines the start and, if applicable, the end date of the application.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE For several reasons there might be more than 1 exploitation period

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.title: Geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometric representation of spatial extent covered by this energy resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: reportingAuthority
FeatureAttribute.title: Reporting authority
FeatureAttribute.definition: Organisation responsible for reporting on the estimated and produced energy resources.

FeatureAttribute.name: resourceName
FeatureAttribute.title: Resource name
FeatureAttribute.definition: The name of the energy resource
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE For fossil fuels this name is the official name, as it’s registered in the national register governed by geological survey or other national authority in charge.

FeatureAttribute.name: verticalExtent
FeatureAttribute.title: Vertical extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: Vertical dimensional property consisting of an absolute measure or range of measures referenced to a well-defined vertical reference level which is commonly taken as origin (ground level, mean sea level, etc.).
FeatureAttribute.description: In the case of subsurface resources the depth or depth range between the deepest (lower bound) and most shallow (upper bound) aspect of the deposit body, where the depth is true vertical depth below a chosen vertical reference level.

FeatureType.name: ExploitationPeriodType
FeatureType.title: Exploitation period type
FeatureType.definition: The exploitationPeriod defines the start and, if applicable, the end date of the exploitation or application.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginTime
FeatureAttribute.title: Begin time
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the exploitation started.
FeatureAttribute.description: This is both for renewable and non-renewable energy sources. For non-renewable energy resources exploitation starts with certain mining activities. In the case of renewable energy resources, it starts with the extraction of energy using specific equipment.

FeatureAttribute.name: endTime
FeatureAttribute.title: End time
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the exploitation ended.
FeatureAttribute.description: This is both for renewable and non-renewable energy sources. For non-renewable energy resources exploitation ends with stopping the mining activities. In the case of renewable energy resources, it ends when specific equipment is no longer used for extraction of renewable and waste energy.

FeatureType.name: FossilFuelMeasure
FeatureType.title: Fossil fuel measure
FeatureType.definition: Amount of resources according to the specific categorisation.

FeatureAttribute.name: amount
FeatureAttribute.title: Amount
FeatureAttribute.definition: Amount of resource present in the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE the unit of measure to be used is standard m³ for natural gas assuming reference gas conditions (15° C; 101,325 kPa) and 10³ tonnes for solid fossil fuels and oil.

FeatureAttribute.name: dateOfDetermination
FeatureAttribute.title: Date of determination
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date on which the resource was quantified.

FeatureAttribute.name: resourceClass
FeatureAttribute.title: Resource class
FeatureAttribute.definition: Category indicating the different confidence levels of fossil fuel resources for distinguishing real from potential or expected amount of fossil fuels.
FeatureAttribute.description: A particular class within the classification framework.

FeatureType.name: EnvironmentalManagementFacility
FeatureType.title: environmental management facility
FeatureType.definition: A physical structure designed, built or installed to serve specific functions in relation to environmental material flows, such as waste or waste water flows, or a delimitable area of land or water used to serve such functions.
FeatureType.description: EXAMPLE In the context of waste management the "specific function" may be a waste recovery or disposal operation. Typically, waste management sites and waste management installations (such as incineration plants, landfills or storages) get distinguished. Multiple waste management installations may be found at the same site. Waste management installations can be a part of other waste management installations.
The functions considered for the Environmental Facilities Theme fall mainly under the NACE rev. 2 category E "Water supply; Sewerage; Waste management and remediation activities".

FeatureAttribute.name: type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of facility, such as installation or site.

FeatureAttribute.name: serviceHours
FeatureAttribute.title: service hours
FeatureAttribute.definition: Service hours of the facility.

FeatureAttribute.name: facilityDescription
FeatureAttribute.title: facility description
FeatureAttribute.definition: Additional information on an Environmental Management Facilities, including its address, a contact details, related parties and a free text description.

FeatureAttribute.name: physicalCapacity
FeatureAttribute.title: physical capacity
FeatureAttribute.definition: A quantification of an actual or potential ability to perform an activity, that typically does not change, does not change often, or does not change to a significant degree.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Capacity could refer depending of the thematic scope to different concepts included on the legislation as “emission limits”, “capacity incineration”, “nominal capacity”, “objective estimation data”, “rate of desulphurization” or “recycling rate”.

FeatureAttribute.name: permission
FeatureAttribute.definition: Official Decision (formal consent) granting authorization to operate all or part of an Environmental Management Facility , subject to certain conditions which guarantee that the installation or parts of installations on the same site operated by the same operator complies with the requirements fixed by the law or standards. A permit may cover one or more functions and fix parameters of capacity;
The term may be extended to other kind of certificates or documents of special relevance depending of the scope (e.g. ISO, EMAS, National Quality Standards, etc).
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE This terms is referred in several legislative acts as “permit” , “authorization”, “development consent” or “exploration permit” among others.
EXAMPLE 1 “…a [written] decision by which the competent authority grants permission to operate all or part of an installation” ;
EXAMPLE 2 “.. the decision of the competent authority or authorities which entitles the developer

FeatureAttribute.name: status
FeatureAttribute.definition: The status of the Environmental Management Facility, such as operational or decommissioned.

RelationshipRole.name: parentFacility
RelationshipRole.title: parent facility
RelationshipRole.definition: A parent facility, i.e., a facility to which this facility belongs.
RelationshipRole.description: A facility may belong to multiple other facilities.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31424
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: NetworkFacility
FeatureType.title: network facility
FeatureType.definition: Link between EnvironmentalMonitoringNetwork and EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility.

FeatureAttribute.name: linkingTime
FeatureAttribute.definition: Time period of the link.

FeatureType.name: EnvironmentalMonitoringActivity
FeatureType.title: environmental monitoring activity
FeatureType.definition: Specific set of AbstractMonitoringFeatures used for a given domain in a coherent and concise timeframe, area and purpose. Usually the information collected is treated as one time step in a long term monitoring programme. It is a concrete realisation of a given EnvironmentalMonitoringProgramme.
FeatureType.description: For example a vessel could be equipped with a collection of EnvironmentalMonitoringFacilities for a given campaign (= EnvironmentalMonitoringActivity) fulfilling an EnvironmentalMonitoringProgramme requirements. Then, after a given period this exact same vessel could be equipped with another set of EnvironmentalMonitoringFacilities for another campaign fulfilling another EnvironmentalMonitoringProgramme requirements.

FeatureAttribute.name: activityTime
FeatureAttribute.definition: Lifespan of the EnvironmentalMonitoringActivity.

FeatureAttribute.name: activityConditions
FeatureAttribute.definition: Textual description of the EnvironmentalMonitoringActivity.

FeatureAttribute.name: boundingBox
FeatureAttribute.definition: Bounding box in which the EnvironmentalMonitoringActivity takes place.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: If a research vessel has several monitoring activities (EnvironmentalMonitoringActivity) one wants to know where he cruised for each of those (EnvironmentaMonitoringActivity).

FeatureAttribute.name: responsibleParty
FeatureAttribute.definition: Responsible party for the EnvironmentalMonitoringActivity.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier.

FeatureAttribute.name: onlineResource
FeatureAttribute.definition: A link to an external document providing further information on the EnvironmentalMonitoringActivity.

RelationshipRole.name: setUpFor
RelationshipRole.definition: EnvironmentalMonitoringProgramme(s) for which the EnvironmentalMonitoringActivity is set up.

RelationshipRole.name: triggers
RelationshipRole.definition: EnvironmentalMonitoringActivity(s) triggered by the EnvironmentalMonitoringProgramme.

RelationshipRole.name: uses
RelationshipRole.definition: Specific set of AbstractMonitoringFeature(s) involved in an EnvironmentalMonitoringActivity.

RelationshipRole.name: involvedIn
RelationshipRole.definition: EnvironmentalMonitoringActivity(s) in which the AbstractMonitoringFeature is involved.

FeatureType.name: AnyDomainLink
FeatureType.title: any domain link
FeatureType.definition: Any domain relevant link to an EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility that is not hierarchical or associated with a notion of genealogy.

FeatureAttribute.name: comment
FeatureAttribute.definition: Additional information on the domain link.

FeatureType.name: EnvironmentalMonitoringProgramme
FeatureType.title: environmental monitoring programme
FeatureType.definition: Framework based on policy relevant documents defining the target of a collection of observations and/or the deployment of AbstractMonitoringFeatures on the field.
Usually an Environmental Monitoring Programme has a long term perspective over at least a few years.

FeatureType.name: EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility
FeatureType.title: environmental monitoring facility
FeatureType.definition: A georeferenced object directly collecting or processing data about objects whose properties (e.g. physical, chemical, biological or other aspects of environmental conditions) are repeatedly observed or measured. An environmental monitoring facility can also host other environmental monitoring facilities.
FeatureType.description: NOTE 1: An EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility is not a facility in the common INSPIRE sense realised by the Generic Conceptual Model class ActivtiyComplex.
NOTE 2: Laboratories are not EnvironmentalMonitoringFacilities from an INSPIRE perspective as the exact location of the laboratory does not add further information to the measurement.
The methodology used in the laboratory should be provided with observational data.

FeatureAttribute.name: representativePoint
FeatureAttribute.definition: Representative location for the EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility.

FeatureAttribute.name: measurementRegime
FeatureAttribute.definition: Regime of the measurement

FeatureAttribute.name: mobile
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indicate whether the EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility is mobile (repositionable) during the acquisition of the observation.

FeatureAttribute.name: resultAcquisitionSource
FeatureAttribute.definition: Source of result acquisition

FeatureAttribute.name: specialisedEMFType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Categorisation of EnvironmentalMonitoringFacilities generally used by domain and in national settings.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: platform, site, station, sensor, ...

RelationshipRole.name: operationalActivityPeriod
RelationshipRole.definition: Lifespan of the physical object (facility).

RelationshipRole.name: role_T31806
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: relatedTo
RelationshipRole.definition: Any Thematic Link to an Environmental Monitoring Facility.
The association has additional properties as defined in the association class AnyDomainLink.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31799
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: belongsTo
RelationshipRole.definition: A link pointing to the EnvironmentalMonitoringNetwork(s) this EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility pertains to.
The association has additional properties as defined in the association class NetworkFacility.

RelationshipRole.name: contains
RelationshipRole.definition: A link pointing to the EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility(s) included in this EnvironmentalMonitoringNetwork.
The association has additional properties as defined in the association class NetworkFacility.

FeatureType.name: ReportToLegalAct
FeatureType.title: report to legal act
FeatureType.definition: Information on the involvement of an AbstractMonitoringFeature in reporting. The information is specific per submitted reporting envelope and not per obligation/agreement.
FeatureType.description: From INSPIRE perspective, an AbstractMonitoringFeature requires the provision of ISO 19156 compliant observations & measurements only in the case that these have been required by a legal reporting obligation or a commonly agreed voluntarily data flow using INSPIRE EF dataspecification for the definition of datastructure.

FeatureAttribute.name: legalAct
FeatureAttribute.definition: LegalAct which is reported to.

FeatureAttribute.name: reportDate
FeatureAttribute.definition: Time of reporting.

FeatureAttribute.name: reportedEnvelope
FeatureAttribute.definition: Link to the reported data set according to the date indicated in the attribute reportDate.

FeatureAttribute.name: observationRequired
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indicates whether an observation is required for the AbstractMonitoringFeature.

FeatureAttribute.name: observingCapabilityRequired
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indicates whether the observingCapability is required for the AbstractMonitoringFeature.

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.definition: Additional information on the actual data reported.

FeatureType.name: AbstractMonitoringFeature
FeatureType.title: abstract monitoring feature
FeatureType.definition: An abstract base class for environmental monitoring features in the real world (EnvironmentalMonitoringNetwork, EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility).
FeatureType.description: This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: reportedTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: Information on the involvement of the AbstractMonitoringFeature in reporting.

RelationshipRole.name: hasObservation
RelationshipRole.definition: Observation of emissions, of the state of environmental media and of other ecosystem parameters (biodiversity, ecological conditions of vegetation, etc.) by or on behalf of public authorities at this AbstractMonitoringFeature.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32854
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: OperationalActivityPeriod
FeatureType.title: operational activity period
FeatureType.definition: Corresponds to a period during which the EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility has been up and running.

FeatureAttribute.name: activityTime
FeatureAttribute.definition: Lifespan of the OperationalActivityPeriod.

FeatureType.name: Hierarchy
FeatureType.definition: Hierachical link between AbstractMonitoringObjects.

FeatureAttribute.name: linkingTime
FeatureAttribute.definition: Time period of the link.

FeatureType.name: ObservingCapability
FeatureType.title: observing capability
FeatureType.definition: Explicit capability of an AbstractMonitoringObject.

FeatureAttribute.name: observingTime
FeatureAttribute.definition: Describes the time period that observations can be expected from this AbstractMonitoringObject. Can be only a start time for running measurements or an interval.

FeatureAttribute.name: processType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of object used for describing the process.

FeatureAttribute.name: resultNature
FeatureAttribute.definition: State of the provided result.

FeatureAttribute.name: onlineResource
FeatureAttribute.definition: A link to an external document providing further information about an ISO 19156 'Observations and Measurements' compliant data model used to store or exchange Observations and Measurements acquired.

RelationshipRole.name: featureOfInterest
RelationshipRole.definition: This feature is the real-world object whose properties are under observation, or is a feature intended to sample the real-world object

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32773
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: procedure
RelationshipRole.definition: Link to the Process used to generate the result. The OM_Process shall be suitable for the observed property. As a corollary, details of the observed property are constrained by the procedure used.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32843
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: observedProperty
RelationshipRole.definition: The property being observed or measured at this AMO.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S34602
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: AbstractMonitoringObject
FeatureType.title: abstract monitoring object
FeatureType.definition: An abstract base class for environmental monitoring objects.
FeatureType.description: This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Plain text denotation of the AbstractMonitoringObject.

FeatureAttribute.name: additionalDescription
FeatureAttribute.definition: Plain text description of additional information not fitting in other attributes.

FeatureAttribute.name: mediaMonitored
FeatureAttribute.definition: Monitored environmental medium.

FeatureAttribute.name: legalBackground
FeatureAttribute.definition: The legal context, in which the management and regulation of the AbstractMonitoringObject is defined.

FeatureAttribute.name: responsibleParty
FeatureAttribute.definition: Responsible party for the AbstractMonitoringObject.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometry associated to the AbstractMonitoringObject.
For mobile facilities the geometry represents the area the facility is expected to measure in.

FeatureAttribute.name: onlineResource
FeatureAttribute.definition: A link to an external document providing further information on the AbstractMonitoringObject.

FeatureAttribute.name: purpose
FeatureAttribute.definition: Reason for which the AbstractMonitoringObject has been generated.

RelationshipRole.name: observingCapability
RelationshipRole.definition: A link pointing to the explicit capability of an AbstractMonitoringObject. This provides a clean link between the observed property, the procedure used as well as the location of the measurement

RelationshipRole.name: role_T31803
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: broader
RelationshipRole.definition: A link pointing to a broader AbstractMonitoringObject (a higher level in a hierarchical structure).
The association has additional
properties as defined in the
association class Hierarchy.

RelationshipRole.name: narrower
RelationshipRole.definition: A link pointing to narrower AbstractMonitoringObject(s) (a lower level in a hierarchical structure).
The association has additional
properties as defined in the
association class Hierarchy.

RelationshipRole.name: supersedes
RelationshipRole.definition: In a genealogy, the AbstractMonitoringObject(s) that has(have) been deactivated/replaced by another one.

RelationshipRole.name: supersededBy
RelationshipRole.definition: In a genealogy, the newly active AbstractMonitoringObject(s) that replaces(replace) the superseded one.

FeatureType.name: EnvironmentalMonitoringNetwork
FeatureType.title: environmental monitoring network
FeatureType.definition: Administrative or organisational grouping of EnvironmentalMonitoringFacilities managed the same way for a specific purpose, targeting a specific area. Each network respects common rules aiming at ensuring coherence of the observations, especially for purposes of EnvironmentalMonitoringFacilities, mandatory parameters selection, measurement methods and measurement regime.

FeatureAttribute.name: organisationLevel
FeatureAttribute.definition: Level of legal organisation the EnvironmentalMonitoringNetwork is affiliated with.

FeatureType.name: ExistingLandUseDataSet
FeatureType.title: existing land use data set
FeatureType.definition: An existing land use data set is a collection of areas for which information on existing (present or past) land uses is provided.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the existing land use dataset.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: extent
FeatureAttribute.title: existing land use data set
FeatureAttribute.definition: Boundary of the geometrical union of all the instances of the spatial object type ExistingLandUseObject.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the existing land use data set was inserted or changed in the provided set of data.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the existing land use data set was superseded or retired in the provided set of data.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Human readable name of the data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: the time when the existing land use data set started to exist in the real world

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which this existing land use data set no longer exists in the real world.

RelationshipRole.name: member
RelationshipRole.definition: Existing land use objects that belong to this existing land use data set.

RelationshipRole.name: dataset
RelationshipRole.definition: Existing land use data set to which this land use object belongs.

FeatureType.name: ExistingLandUseObject
FeatureType.title: existing land use object
FeatureType.definition: An existing land use object describes the land use of an area having a homogeneous combination of land use types.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the existing land use object.
FeatureAttribute.description: An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometric representation of spatial area covered by this spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: hilucsLandUse
FeatureAttribute.definition: Land use HILUCS classes that are present in this existing land use object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The Existing Land Use model enables the provision of information on land uses inside one land use object. The ExistingLandUseObject may be associated with 1 to many HILUCSLandUse that represents the Land Uses for the polygon from the economical point of view. It makes possible the assignment of more than one HILUCSLandUse existences when they cannot be managed by HILUCSPresences.

FeatureAttribute.name: hilucsPresence
FeatureAttribute.title: land use presence
FeatureAttribute.definition: Actual presence of a land use category according to HILUCS within the object.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificLandUse
FeatureAttribute.definition: Land Use Category according to the nomenclature specific to this data set.
FeatureAttribute.description: Reference to an entry in the classfication that is part of the SpecificLandUseClassification.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificPresence
FeatureAttribute.title: land use presence
FeatureAttribute.definition: Actual presence of a land use category within the object.

FeatureAttribute.name: observationDate
FeatureAttribute.title: Observation Date.
FeatureAttribute.definition: The observation date associated to a description.
FeatureAttribute.description: Defines the observation date of the description. It could be the date of an aerial/satellite acquisition or a field survey. The observation date allows the user to have accurate date of when the description was made in the real word. In a database, not all objects are necessarily captured at the same time.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the phenomenon started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the phenomenon no longer exists in the real world.

FeatureType.name: ElectricityCableExtended
FeatureType.title: Electricity cable (Extended)
FeatureType.definition: Extends the ElectricityCable feature in the Core Utility Network Profile.

FeatureAttribute.name: electricityCableType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of electricity cable.

FeatureAttribute.name: electricityCableConductorMaterialType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Cable conductor material type.

FeatureAttribute.name: conductorSize
FeatureAttribute.definition: Size of the conductor.

FeatureType.name: OilGasChemicalsPipeExtended
FeatureType.title: Oil, gas and chemicals pipe (Extended)
FeatureType.definition: Extends the OilGasChemicalsPipe feature in the Core Utility Network Profile.

FeatureAttribute.name: oilGasChemicalsPipeType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of oil/gas/chemicals pipe.

FeatureAttribute.name: averageVolume
FeatureAttribute.definition: Average volume of the pipe.

FeatureAttribute.name: maxCapacity
FeatureAttribute.definition: Maximum capacity of the pipe.

FeatureType.name: SewerPipeExtended
FeatureType.title: Sewer pipe (Extended)
FeatureType.definition: Extends the SewerPipe feature in the Core Utility Network Profile.

FeatureAttribute.name: sewerPipeType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of sewer pipe.

FeatureAttribute.name: averageVolume
FeatureAttribute.definition: Average volume of the pipe.

FeatureAttribute.name: maxCapacity
FeatureAttribute.definition: Maximum capacity of the pipe.

FeatureType.name: ThermalPipeExtended
FeatureType.title: Thermal pipe (Extended)
FeatureType.definition: Extends the ThermalPipe feature in the Core Utility Network Profile.

FeatureAttribute.name: thermalPipeType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of thermal pipe.

FeatureType.name: WaterPipeExtended
FeatureType.title: Water pipe (Extended)
FeatureType.definition: Extends the WaterPipe feature in the Core Utility Network Profile.

FeatureAttribute.name: waterPipeType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of water pipe.

FeatureAttribute.name: averageVolume
FeatureAttribute.definition: Average volume of the pipe.

FeatureAttribute.name: maxCapacity
FeatureAttribute.definition: Maximum capacity of the pipe.

FeatureType.name: GeologicFeature
FeatureType.definition: A conceptual geological feature that is hypothesized to exist coherently in the world.
FeatureType.description: This corresponds with a "legend item" from a traditional geologic map. While the bounding coordinates of a Geologic Feature may be described, its shape is not.
The implemented Geologic Feature instance acts as the "description package"
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: The name of the geologic feature.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: a lithostratigraphic unit, mineral occurrence, or major fault.
Not all GeologicFeatures will have names, for example minor faults.

RelationshipRole.name: geologicHistory
RelationshipRole.definition: An association that relates one or more geologic events to a geologic feature to describe their age or geologic history.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32202
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: themeClass
RelationshipRole.definition: A thematic classification of the geologic feature.
RelationshipRole.description: A GeologicFeature may be classified according to one or more thematic schema, for example ground stability or mineral resource potential.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32199
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: NaturalGeomorphologicFeature
FeatureType.definition: A geomorphologic feature (ie, landform) that has been created by natural Earth processes.
FeatureType.description: EXAMPLE: river channel, beach ridge, caldera, canyon, moraine, mud flat.

FeatureAttribute.name: naturalGeomorphologicFeatureType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of the natural geomorphologic feature.

FeatureAttribute.name: activity
FeatureAttribute.definition: The level of activity of the natural geomorphologic feature.

FeatureType.name: AnthropogenicGeomorphologicFeature
FeatureType.definition: A geomorphologic feature (ie, landform) which has been created by human activity.
FeatureType.description: EXAMPLE: dredged channel, midden, open pit, reclaimed land.

FeatureAttribute.name: anthropogenicGeomorphologicFeatureType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Terms describing the type of a geomorphologic feature.

FeatureType.name: ThematicClass
FeatureType.definition: A generic thematic classifier to enable the reclassification of Geologic Features with user defined classes appropriate to thematic maps.
FeatureType.description: This datatype allows Geologic Features to be classified against thematic classes. This provides a generic means of delivering geological thematic map data.

FeatureAttribute.name: themeClassification
FeatureAttribute.definition: The used classification.

FeatureAttribute.name: themeClass
FeatureAttribute.definition: The value of the thematic class.
FeatureAttribute.description: The thematic class value should be constrained by a codelist of defined terms, but these will commonly be specific to a particular thematic map.

FeatureType.name: GeologicEvent
FeatureType.definition: An identifiable event during which one or more geological processes act to modify geological entities.
FeatureType.description: A GeologicEvent should have a specified geologic age and process, and may have a specified environment. An example might be a cratonic uplift event during which erosion, sedimentation, and volcanism all take place. A GeologicEvent age can represent an instant in time or an interval of time.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: The name of the Geologic Event.
FeatureAttribute.description: Only major Geologic Events, such as orogenies, are likely to have names.

FeatureAttribute.name: eventEnvironment
FeatureAttribute.definition: The physical setting within which the geologic event takes place.
FeatureAttribute.description: GeologicEnvironment is construed broadly to include physical settings on the Earth surface specified by climate, tectonics, physiography or geography, and settings in the Earth’s interior specified by pressure, temperature, chemical environment, or tectonics.

FeatureAttribute.name: eventProcess
FeatureAttribute.definition: The process or processes that occurred during the geologic event.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: deposition, extrusion, intrusion, cooling.

FeatureAttribute.name: olderNamedAge
FeatureAttribute.definition: Older boundary of the age of the event.
FeatureAttribute.description: This is expressed using a geochronologic era defined in a vocabulary of recognised units, such as those of the International Commission on Stratigraphy (ICS) Stratigraphic Chart.

FeatureAttribute.name: youngerNamedAge
FeatureAttribute.definition: Younger boundary of the age of the event.
FeatureAttribute.description: This is expressed using a geochronologic era defined in a vocabulary of recognised units, such as those of the International Commission on Stratigraphy (ICS) Stratigraphic Chart.

FeatureType.name: GeologicUnit
FeatureType.definition: A volume of rock with distinct characteristics.
FeatureType.description: Includes both formal units (i.e. formally adopted and named in an official lexicon) and informal units (i.e. named but not promoted to the lexicon) and unnamed units (i.e. recognisable and described and delineable in the field but not otherwise formalised).
Spatial properties are only available through association with a MappedFeature.

FeatureAttribute.name: geologicUnitType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of geological the unit.
FeatureAttribute.description: Logical constraints of definition of unit and valid property cardinalities should be contained in the definition.

RelationshipRole.name: composition
RelationshipRole.definition: Describes the composition of the geologic unit.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32208
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: CompositionPart
FeatureType.definition: The composition of a geologic unit in terms of lithological constituents.

FeatureAttribute.name: material
FeatureAttribute.definition: The material that comprises part or all of the geologic unit.
FeatureAttribute.description: This refers to a vocabulary of lithological terms.

FeatureAttribute.name: proportion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Quantity that specifies the fraction of the geologic unit composed of the material.

FeatureAttribute.name: role
FeatureAttribute.definition: The relationship of the composition part to the geologic unit composition as a whole.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: vein, interbedded constituent, layers, dominant constituent.

FeatureType.name: ShearDisplacementStructure
FeatureType.definition: Brittle to ductile style structures along which displacement has occurred.
FeatureType.description: These range from from a simple, single 'planar' brittle or ductile surface to a fault system comprised of tens of strands of both brittle and ductile nature.

FeatureAttribute.name: faultType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Refers to a vocabulary of terms describing the type of shear displacement structure.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: thrust fault, normal fault, wrench fault.

FeatureType.name: Borehole
FeatureType.definition: A borehole is the generalized term for any narrow shaft drilled in the ground.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: downholeGeometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The downhole geometry of the borehole

FeatureAttribute.name: boreholeLength
FeatureAttribute.definition: The distance along a borehole.
FeatureAttribute.description: This will be determined by the data provider (ie, "length" can have different sources, like drillers measurement, loggers measurement, survey).

FeatureAttribute.name: elevation
FeatureAttribute.definition: The vertical height above datum of the borehole collar.
FeatureAttribute.description: This is a compromise approach to supply elevation explictly for location; this is to allow for software that cannot process 3-D GM_Point. Use null if elevation is unknown. Direct position shall have a dimension of 1, and CRS will be a "vertical" CRS (e.g. EPSG CRSs in the range 5600-5799).

FeatureAttribute.name: location
FeatureAttribute.definition: The location of the borehole collar.

FeatureAttribute.name: purpose
FeatureAttribute.definition: The purpose for which the borehole was drilled.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: site investigation, mineral exploration, hydrocarbon exploration, water resources.

RelationshipRole.name: logElement
RelationshipRole.definition: 1-D MappedFeature instances that are logged (interpreted) intervals within a borehole.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32215
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: MappedFeature
FeatureType.definition: A spatial representation of a GeologicFeature.
FeatureType.description: A MappedFeature is part of a geological interpretation.

It provides a link between a notional feature (description package) and one spatial representation of it, or part of it (exposures, surface traces and intercepts, etc) which forms the specific bounded occurrence, such as an outcrop or map polygon.

FeatureAttribute.name: shape
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry of the mapped feature.

FeatureAttribute.name: mappingFrame
FeatureAttribute.definition: The surface on which the mapped feature is projected.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: Topographic surface, Bedrock surface, Base of Permian

RelationshipRole.name: specification
RelationshipRole.definition: A description association that links a mapped feature to a notional geologic feature.
RelationshipRole.description: A geologic feature, such as a geologic unit may be linked to mapped features from a number of different maps. A mapped feature, however is always associated with only a single description (geologic feature).

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32212
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: Fold
FeatureType.definition: One or more systematically curved layers, surfaces, or lines in a rock body.
FeatureType.description: A fold denotes a structure formed by the deformation of a Geologic Structure to form a structure that may be described by the translation of an abstract line (the fold axis) parallel to itself along some curvilinear path (the fold profile). Folds have a hinge zone (zone of maximum curvature along the surface) and limbs (parts of the deformed surface not in the hinge zone).

FeatureAttribute.name: profileType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of the fold.
FeatureAttribute.description: Folds are typed according to the concave/convex geometry of the fold relative to the earth surface, and the relationship to younging direction in folded strata if known.
EXAMPLE: antiform, synform, anticline, syncline, etc.

FeatureType.name: GeomorphologicFeature
FeatureType.definition: An abstract spatial object type describing the shape and nature of the Earth's land surface (ie, a landform).
FeatureType.description: These landforms may be created by natural Earth processes (eg, river channel, beach, moraine, mountain) or through human (anthropogenic) activity (eg, dredged channel, reclaimed land, mine waste dumps).
This type is abstract.

FeatureType.name: GeologicStructure
FeatureType.definition: A configuration of matter in the Earth based on describable inhomogeneity, pattern, or fracture in an earth material.
FeatureType.description: The identity of a GeologicStructure is independent of the material that is the substrate for the structure.
This type is abstract.

FeatureType.name: GeologicCollection
FeatureType.definition: A collection of geological or geophysical objects.
FeatureType.description: Geologic objects are commonly grouped into collections such as geological maps, thematic maps, or the required input to a geological model.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: The name of the collection.
