FeatureAttribute.name: collectionType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of the collection.
FeatureAttribute.description: Refers to a vocabulary of types.
EXAMPLE: geological map, thematic map etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: reference
FeatureAttribute.definition: A reference for the collection.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

RelationshipRole.name: geophObjectSet
RelationshipRole.definition: A GeophObjectSet member of a Geologic Collection.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32196
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: geophObjectMember
RelationshipRole.definition: A GeophObject member of a Geologic Collection.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32197
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: boreholeMember
RelationshipRole.definition: A Borehole member of a Geologic Collection.
RelationshipRole.description: Association that allows Borehole objects to be included as members in a GML Collection, through the use of the GeologicCollection class.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32198
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: mapMember
RelationshipRole.definition: A Mapped Feature member of a Geologic Collection.
RelationshipRole.description: Association that allows MappedFeature objects to be included as members in a GML Collection, through the use of the GeologicCollection class.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32213
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: MappedInterval
FeatureType.definition: A special kind of mapped feature whose shape is a 1-D interval and which uses the SRS of the containing borehole.
FeatureType.description: A MappedFeature is part of a geological interpretation.

It provides a link between a notional feature (description package) and one spatial representation of it, or part of it (exposures, surface traces and intercepts, etc) which forms the specific bounded occurrence, such as an outcrop or map polygon.

FeatureType.name: GeophObject
FeatureType.definition: A generic class for geophysical objects.
FeatureType.description: GeophObject models single geophysical entities that are used for spatial sampling either by means of data acquisition or data processing.
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the measurement.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: citation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Citation of geophysical documentation
FeatureAttribute.description: Used for title, date of related documentation and URL for online access. At the minimum a short name (title) shall be given.

FeatureAttribute.name: projectedGeometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: 2D projection of the feature to the ground surface (as a representative point, curve or bounding polygon) to be used by an INSPIRE view service to display the spatial object location on a map.
FeatureAttribute.description: When measurement setup is 3 dimensional, it is necessary to define a 2D geometry for displaying purposes. It shall be the 2D projection of the spatial object on the ground surface. Allowed types: point, track and outline. Examples: projected geometry of a borehole logging measurement is a point coincident with the borehole collar location. Projected geometry of a 3D multielectrode DC measurement is a polygon

FeatureAttribute.name: verticalExtent
FeatureAttribute.definition: Vertical extent of the range of interest.
FeatureAttribute.description: This parameter serves discovery purposes. It may refer both to the vertical extent of the measurement setup (p.e. borehole logging) or the extent of the range where processed data is spatially referenced to (Vertical Electric Sounding). The aim is to give an idea to the user about the estimated depth of investigation.

FeatureAttribute.name: distributionInfo
FeatureAttribute.definition: Distribution metadata
FeatureAttribute.description: Data providers may use external services to provide information on a geophysical measurement. Links to the access points, description of ordering procedures or external services can be added in distributionInfo, that is an ISO MD_Distributor record.

FeatureAttribute.name: largerWork
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identifier of a larger work dataset, typically a campaign or project
FeatureAttribute.description: Measurements are usually made in campaigns. The largerWork identifier points to the parent Campaign or Project

FeatureType.name: GeophStation
FeatureType.definition: Geophysical measurement spatially referenced to a single point location
FeatureType.description: Used to collect data at a single location. The source-sensor setup may be elongated or two dimensional, but the collected data is spatially referenced to a single point. Example: Gravity station, Magnetic station
NOTE 1. Processing results of geophStations are often vertical curve coverages

FeatureAttribute.name: stationType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of geophysical station

FeatureAttribute.name: stationRank
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geophysical stations may be part of a hierarchical system. Rank is proportional to the importance of a station
FeatureAttribute.description: Significance of stations can be very different even for the same geophysical method. Rank maz take the following values: 1stOrderBase, 2ndOrderBase, secularStation, observatory. Base stations are used to tie local measurements to higher level networks. Secular stations are visited from time to time to detect long term temporal changes of physical parameters. Observatories are important facilities that collect data continuously, or on a regular basis.

FeatureType.name: Campaign
FeatureType.definition: Geophysical activity extending over a limited time range and limited area for producing similar geophysical measurements, processing results or models.
FeatureType.description: Campaigns can be considered as parents of geophysical measurements or models. Children may refer to parent campaigns through the largerWork identifier.

FeatureAttribute.name: campaignType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of activity to produce data
FeatureAttribute.description: Value shall be one of the items defined in codelist CampaignTypeValue

FeatureAttribute.name: surveyType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of geophysical survey
FeatureAttribute.description: The geophysical method is specified by this attribute. Value shall be one of the items defined in codelist SurveyTypeValue.

FeatureAttribute.name: client
FeatureAttribute.definition: Party for which data was created.

FeatureAttribute.name: contractor
FeatureAttribute.definition: Party by which data was created
FeatureAttribute.description: Party responsible for creating the data related to the campaign

FeatureType.name: GeophProfile
FeatureType.definition: Geophysical measurement spatially referenced to a curve
FeatureType.description: Used to collect data along a curve. Examples: 2D seismic line (field measurement), borehole logging, airborne geophysical flight line
NOTE1. Processing results of geophProfiles are often vertical surface coverages

FeatureAttribute.name: profileType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of geophysical profile

FeatureType.name: GeophSwath
FeatureType.definition: Geophysical measurement spatially referenced to a surface
FeatureType.description: Used to collect data over a surface. Example: 3D seismic swath
NOTE1. Processing results of geophSwaths can be both surface and solid coverages

FeatureAttribute.name: swathType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of geophysical swath

FeatureType.name: GeophObjectSet
FeatureType.definition: Generic class for collections of geophysical objects
FeatureType.description: It is a set of geophysical objects that are grouped by some common property. p.e: created in the same measuring campaign. GeophObjectSets are used for spatial sampling either by means of data acquisition or data processing. The produced result of a geophObjectSet is always collective, e.g. a map constructed from the results of the individual member objects.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: citation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Citation of geophysical documentation
FeatureAttribute.description: Used for title, date of related documentation and URL for online access. At the minimum a short name (title) shall be given.

FeatureAttribute.name: verticalExtent
FeatureAttribute.definition: Vertical extent of the range of interest.
FeatureAttribute.description: This parameter serves discovery purposes. It may refer both to the vertical extent of the setup of measurements within the survey, or the extent of the range where processed data is spatially referenced to (estimated depth of investigation). The aim is to give an idea to the user about the estimated depth of investigation.

FeatureAttribute.name: distributionInfo
FeatureAttribute.definition: Distribution metadata
FeatureAttribute.description: Data providers may use external services to provide access to data or information on a survey. Links to the access points, description of ordering procedures, fees can be added in distributionInfo that is an ISO MD_Distributor record.

FeatureAttribute.name: projectedGeometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: 2D projection of the feature to the ground surface (as a representative point, curve or bounding polygon) to be used by an INSPIRE view service to display the spatial object on a map..
FeatureAttribute.description: Projected geometry of the object set (survey), that is usually the bounding polygon of the working area.

FeatureAttribute.name: largerWork
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identifier of a larger work dataset
FeatureAttribute.description: The largerWork identifier points to the parent Campaign or Project

FeatureType.name: GeophMeasurement
FeatureType.definition: Generic spatial object type for geophysical measurements.
FeatureType.description: Geophysical measurements collect data outside or on the boundary of the observed spatial domain.
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: relatedModel
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identifier of the geophysical model that was created from the measurement
FeatureAttribute.description: Results of the measurement can be referenced by these identifiers.

FeatureAttribute.name: platformType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Platform from which the measurement was carried out
FeatureAttribute.description: Values to be used are defined in codelist PlatformTypeValue.

FeatureAttribute.name: relatedNetwork
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name of a national or international observation network to which the facility belongs, or to which measured data is reported.
FeatureAttribute.description: Permanent measuring installations maz be part of larger observation networks. It means that observation data is regularly sent to the archives of the related network in an official way.

FeatureType.name: ExistingLandUseGrid
FeatureType.title: existing land use grid
FeatureType.definition: An existing land use grid is a collection of pixels for which information on existing (present or past) land use is provided. The HILUCS system shall be used for classification.
FeatureType.description: A rectified grid is a grid for which there is an affine transformation between the grid coordinates and the coordinates of a coordinate reference system.
NOTE This type can be used for both discrete and continuous coverages.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Human readable name of the data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the sampled land use data grid.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: Contains the extent of the data set.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Extents may be specified in space, time or space-time.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the grid is no longer a valid representation of reality.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: First date at which this grid is a valid representation of reality.

ApplicationSchema.name: HabitatsAndBiotopes
ApplicationSchema.definition: Application schema for Habitats and Biotopes

FeatureType.name: LocalNameType
FeatureType.title: local name type
FeatureType.definition: Name according to a local classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: localScheme
FeatureAttribute.title: local scheme
FeatureAttribute.definition: Uniform resource identifier of a local classification scheme.
FeatureAttribute.description: Classification scheme, which is used locally and contains all classification types, their codes and/or very often their names in natural language.

EXAMPLE "http://www.rac-spa.org/sites/default/files/doc_fsd/lchm_en.pdf", for the Classification of Benthic Marine Habitat Types for the Mediterranean Region or "http://www.lifenatura2000.ro/doc/Habitatele din Romania.pdf", for the Romanian habitats classification.

FeatureAttribute.name: localNameCode
FeatureAttribute.title: local name code
FeatureAttribute.definition: Natural language name according to a local classification scheme.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: "Comunitati vest-pontice cu Camphosma annua si Kochia laniflora" for the habitat „R1508" from the Romanian habitat classification or „Biocenosis of abyssal muds" for the habitat „VI.1.1." from the Classification of Benthic Marine Habitat Types for the Mediterranean Region or "Stellario alsines – Montietum rivularis (Franzi 1984)" for a vegetation type.

FeatureAttribute.name: localName
FeatureAttribute.title: local name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name according to a local classification scheme.
FeatureAttribute.description: Name according to local classification scheme. It is strongly recommended take all local names from a registered classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: qualifierLocalName
FeatureAttribute.title: qualifier local name
FeatureAttribute.definition: The relation between the local name and the corresponding name in the Pan-European schema.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE The local habitat type can be conceptually the same as the related Pan-European habitat type, the relationship then is called “congruent” or the local habitat type may be a subtype of the Pan-European habitat type, therefore the relationship should be "includedIn", etc.

FeatureType.name: Habitat
FeatureType.title: habitat
FeatureType.definition: Geographical areas characterised by specific ecological conditions, processes, structure, and functions that physically support the organisms that live there.
FeatureType.description: Includes terrestrial and aquatic areas distinguished by geographical, abiotic and biotic features, whether entirely natural or semi-natural [Directive 2007/2/EC].

A Habitat area, line or point may comprise one or more HabitatTypesCoverTypes according to one or more habitat classification schemes, often depending on the data capture process or related to the scale of a map. So a habitat feature might represent a complex of different HabitatTypesCoverTypes.
NOTE Although habitats in principle are geographical areas, they may also be depicted as lines or points.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.title: inspire id
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The extent of the habitat based on natural boundaries.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE 1 Can be polygons, lines or points.
NOTE 2 Can also support 3-dimensional features.

FeatureAttribute.name: habitat
FeatureAttribute.title: habitat type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The identifier for a habitat class, defined and described in an international, national or local habitat classification scheme.
FeatureAttribute.description: Habitats and biotopes may be common in some characteristics on a certain level of detail and may thus be classified as abstract types: e.g. as woodland, pastures, heathland – referring to their vegetation structure - or as running waters, limestone rocks or sand dunes - referring to abiotic features - but also as wintering areas, nesting areas or wandering corridors etc. - referring to relevant phases for the life-cycle of a certain species or ecological guild. These typological classes are usually organised in classification systems (e.g. EUNIS habitat classification).

FeatureAttribute.name: habitatSpecies
FeatureAttribute.title: habitat species
FeatureAttribute.definition: List of species which occur in or constitute a certain habitat at the time of mapping.

FeatureAttribute.name: habitatVegetation
FeatureAttribute.title: habitat vegetation
FeatureAttribute.definition: List of vegetation types which constitute a certain habitat.
FeatureAttribute.description: The cover of plants may be common in some characteristics on a certain level of detail and may thus be classified by vegetation science as abstract types.

E.g. vegetation may be classified as Tundra or Mediterranean Deciduous Forests – referring to their structure and their bio-geographic formations - or as Nordic vegetation type 5141 Koeleria glauca-Typ or Ranunculetum fluitantis - referring to their floristic composition - or as chamaephytes or hemi-cryptophytes - referring to structural traits etc.

Many vegetation type classification systems exist all over Europe. Some of these systems have a deep hierarchical structure. Therefore it is recommended to register the vegetation type scheme which was used.

FeatureType.name: HabitatSpeciesType
FeatureType.title: habitat species type
FeatureType.definition: Species which occurs in a certain habitat at the time of mapping.

FeatureAttribute.name: referenceSpeciesId
FeatureAttribute.title: reference species id
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identifier of one of the reference lists given by the referenceSpeciesScheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: referenceSpeciesScheme
FeatureAttribute.title: reference species scheme
FeatureAttribute.definition: Reference list defining a nomenclatural and taxonomical standard to which all local species names and taxonomic concepts shall be mapped to.
FeatureAttribute.description: Closed codelist of accepted PAN-european taxonomical reference lists defining the nomenclature and taxonomical concept of a given species name. This must not be regarded as the ultimate taxonomic truth: this will always change. It serves as a definition of a taxonomic concept described by systematic and synonym relations where other names and there inherent taxonomic concepts can be mapped to. The code list comprises of Eu-Nomen, EUNIS and Natura2000. In these sources harmonized species GUIDs and names are maintained by institutions with an assignment outside INSPIRE and the species names are to be retrieved through webservices using GUIDs. Only one of these list must be used for one taxon. The priority is as follows: 1) EU-Nomen, 2) EUNIS, 3) NatureDirectives. This implies: if a taxon is listed in EU-Nomen, this reference must be used as first choice. If it is not listed in EU-Nomen, the second choice is EUNIS, if not in EUNIS, NatureDirectives can be used.

FeatureAttribute.name: localSpeciesName
FeatureAttribute.title: local species name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Scientific name plus author used in national nomenclature with its national taxonomic concept.
FeatureAttribute.description: The LocalSpeciesName provides nomenclatural and taxonomical information about the locally used species name and the taxonomic concepts implied by the use of this name according to a given reference. If omitted the name and concept given by the referenceSpeciesId according to the referenceSpeciesScheme has been used locally.

FeatureType.name: HabitatTypeCoverType
FeatureType.title: habitat type cover type
FeatureType.definition: Habitat type according to an international, national or local habitat classifications scheme.
FeatureType.description: Includes additional information on covered area, covered length, or containing volume.

FeatureAttribute.name: referenceHabitatTypeId
FeatureAttribute.title: reference habitat type id
FeatureAttribute.definition: Habitat type unique identifier (code) according to one Pan-European classification scheme.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE "1110", "40C0", "95A0", etc., if the referenceHabitatScheme is "habitatsDirective", or "A1.111", "A1.1121", "G1.1111", "X34", etc., if the ReferenceHabitatScheme is "eunis".

FeatureAttribute.name: referenceHabitatTypeScheme
FeatureAttribute.title: reference habitat type scheme
FeatureAttribute.definition: One of the Pan-European classification schemes, that are widely used in Europe.
FeatureAttribute.description: The list includes at least the classification of the natural habitat types of community interest listed in Annex I of the Habitats Directive, as well as the hierarchic classification of the habitat types of interest for biodiversity and nature protection listed in the EUNIS database, which is maintained by the EEA.

FeatureAttribute.name: referenceHabitatTypeName
FeatureAttribute.title: reference habitat type name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name of a habitat type according to one Pan-European classification scheme.
FeatureAttribute.description: In the given Pan-European habitat classification systems, the habitat types can be identified by both: a short "identifier" (code) and a name in natural language, which is meant in this attribute.
EXAMPLE Habitats Directive habitat type 3260 (code) "Floating vegetation of Ranunculus" or "Chenopodietum rubri of submountainous rivers" (name).

FeatureAttribute.name: localHabitatName
FeatureAttribute.title: local habitat name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Habitat type according to a local habitat classification scheme.
FeatureAttribute.description: Habitat types used in a certain area (e.g. Mediterranean Sea), or in a certain country, or even more restricted in a certain region, county or any other local level.
It is strongly recommended to register the local classification scheme from which the local habitat names are taken
EXAMPLE Classification of Benthic Marine Habitat Types for the Mediterranean Region, Habitats of Romania, German Biotoptypen, Nordic Vegetation types, UK National Vegetation Classification, etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: areaCovered
FeatureAttribute.title: area covered
FeatureAttribute.definition: The area covered by a certain habitat type within the provided geometry of the habitat spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: The surface area should be expressed in square meters.

It can be used only in the case that the geometry provided in the Habitat feature represents an area in which more than one habitat type exists in other words a complex of different habitat types. In this case, for each habitat type the surface of the covered area can be provided within this attribute.

Since the geometry provided in the Habitat feature can be larger than the total surface of the habitat types listed within that geometry, the total surface of the habitat types can be smaller than the surface of the provided geometry. On the other hand, since some habitat types may overlap (e.g. subterranean caves / habitat type on the surface) or may cover a steep inclination (cliff) the total area of the habitat types can be bigger than the area of the provided geometry.

EXAMPLE Within a given habitat geometry of 30.2 hectares there are several habitat types, out of which two are natural habitat types of community interest, ”91D0” covering 22.5 hectares and ”7110” covering 5.3 hectares, thus in total are smaller than the total area.

FeatureAttribute.name: lengthCovered
FeatureAttribute.title: length covered
FeatureAttribute.definition: The length covered by a certain habitat type within the provided geometry of the habitat spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: The length should be expressed in meters.

EXAMPLE Within a given habitat geometry of 300 square meters there are several habitat types. Two natural habitat types of community interest, ”91F0” and ”9160” cover this total area. However, a third natural habitat types of community interest ”3260” is listed, which is a linear feature and thus expressed in meters of its length (e.g. 120 m).

FeatureAttribute.name: volumeCovered
FeatureAttribute.title: volume covered
FeatureAttribute.definition: The volume covered by a certain habitat type within the provided geometry of the habitat spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: The volume should be expressed in cubic meters.

FeatureType.name: HabitatVegetationType
FeatureType.title: habitat vegetation type
FeatureType.definition: Vegetation type which occurs in a certain habitat.

FeatureAttribute.name: localVegetationName
FeatureAttribute.title: local vegetation name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Natural language name of a vegetation class (vegetation type) according to a local vegetation classification scheme.
FeatureAttribute.description: For better understanding it is strongly recommended to give the full name of the vegetation type rather than any abbreviation or code used in the local scheme.
EXAMPLE "Stellario alsines – Montietum rivularis (Franzi 1984)".

FeatureType.name: Biomarker
FeatureType.definition: A biomarker (of exposure) is the concentration of a chemical, its metabolite or the product of an interaction between a chemical and some target molecule or cell that is measured in a compartment in an organism.

FeatureAttribute.name: biomarkerName
FeatureAttribute.title: Biomarker name
FeatureAttribute.definition: It is the unique identifier for a biomarker, providing information on the chemical that is determined and the matrix in which the chemical was determined.

FeatureAttribute.name: biomarkerStatisticalParameter
FeatureAttribute.title: Biomarker statistical parameter
FeatureAttribute.definition: The statistical summary of a human biomonitoring study, representing the most important statistical features of a biomarker measured in that particular study.

FeatureAttribute.name: referencePeriod
FeatureAttribute.title: Reference period
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time period to which data is referred to.

FeatureAttribute.name: ageRange
FeatureAttribute.title: Age range
FeatureAttribute.definition: Age interval of a specific subpopulation expressed as starting age and an interval, both alternatively expressed in years, months or weeks.

FeatureAttribute.name: gender
FeatureAttribute.title: Gender
FeatureAttribute.definition: Gender of the population considered.

RelationshipRole.name: refersTo
RelationshipRole.definition: biomarker data described by metadata

RelationshipRole.name: describedBy
RelationshipRole.definition: Metadata that are linked to biomarker data

FeatureType.name: ReferencePeriodType
FeatureType.title: Reference period
FeatureType.definition: The time period which the refer.

FeatureAttribute.name: startDate
FeatureAttribute.title: Start date
FeatureAttribute.definition: Start of reference period.

FeatureAttribute.name: endDate
FeatureAttribute.title: End date
FeatureAttribute.definition: End of reference period.

FeatureType.name: Concentration
FeatureType.title: concentration measure
FeatureType.definition: A measure of concentration of a specified component in a specified media.

FeatureAttribute.name: uom
FeatureAttribute.title: unit of measure
FeatureAttribute.definition: The unit of measure.

FeatureType.name: DiseaseMeasure
FeatureType.title: Disease measure
FeatureType.definition: Different ways in which data on diseases and related health problems in a population can be reported.
FeatureType.description: There is a strong agreement between the two codelists addressed in the Data Specifications Document; the “ICD10Value” and the “CODValue” codelist. Taking into account that the main source of harmonized data is Eurostat, the reporting formats of Eurostat should be promoted in the definition of DiseaseMeasureType:
• Absolute numbers: the total prevalence of a disease or mortality cause, without any further weighing or processing;

• Crude death rate: describes mortality in relation to the total population. Expressed in deaths per 100,000 inhabitants, it is calculated as the number of deaths recorded in the population for a given period divided by population in the same period and then multiplied by 100,000;

• Standardised death rate: weighted average of age-specific mortality rates. The weighting factor is the age distribution of a standard reference population. Standardised death rates are calculated for the age group 0-64 ('premature death') and for the total of ages. As most causes of death vary significantly with people's age and sex, the use of standardised death rates improves comparability over time and between countries.
The reporting formats as presented above are regulated through the European Parliament’s “ Regulation on Community statistics on public health and health and safety at work (EC) No 1338/2008”.

FeatureAttribute.name: diseaseMeasureType
FeatureAttribute.title: Disease measure type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Different ways how data on diseases and related health problems in a population can be reported.

FeatureAttribute.name: value
FeatureAttribute.title: Value
FeatureAttribute.definition: Value of the measured disease indicator.

FeatureType.name: BiomarkerStatisticalParameterType
FeatureType.title: Biomarker statistical parameter
FeatureType.definition: A set of statistical features of a biomarker measured for one specific biomarker.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometricMean
FeatureAttribute.title: Geometric mean
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometric mean.

FeatureAttribute.name: CI95ofGM
FeatureAttribute.title: CI95 geometric mean
FeatureAttribute.definition: 95% confidence interval of the geometric mean.

FeatureAttribute.name: P50
FeatureAttribute.title: Percentile 50
FeatureAttribute.definition: The 50<sup>th</sup> Percentile or median value. Value below which 50 percent of the observations may be found.

FeatureAttribute.name: P90
FeatureAttribute.title: Percentile 90
FeatureAttribute.definition: The 90<sup>th</sup> Percentile. The value below which 90 percent of the observations may be found.

FeatureAttribute.name: P95
FeatureAttribute.title: Percentile 95
FeatureAttribute.definition: The 95<sup>th</sup> Percentile. The value below which 95 percent of the observations may be found.

FeatureAttribute.name: CI95ofP95
FeatureAttribute.title: CI95 percentile 95
FeatureAttribute.definition: 95% confidence interval of the percentile 95.

FeatureAttribute.name: maximum
FeatureAttribute.title: maximum value
FeatureAttribute.definition: The highest biomarker value determined in an individual participant in the biomonitoring survey.

FeatureAttribute.name: numberOfPartecipants
FeatureAttribute.title: Number of partecipants
FeatureAttribute.definition: The number of participants that have provided samples that have contributed to the calculation of the biomarker statistical parameter.

FeatureAttribute.name: pinLOD
FeatureAttribute.title: Limit of detection
FeatureAttribute.definition: Proportion of individuals with undetectable levels of tested parameter (below limit of detection).

FeatureAttribute.name: LOQ
FeatureAttribute.title: Limit of quantification
FeatureAttribute.definition: Limit of quantification.

FeatureType.name: Age
FeatureType.definition: Persons' age can be expressed in various ways (for instance years for adults, months or weeks for infants).

FeatureAttribute.name: month
FeatureAttribute.definition: Time period.

FeatureAttribute.name: week
FeatureAttribute.definition: Time period.

FeatureAttribute.name: year
FeatureAttribute.definition: Time period.

FeatureType.name: HealthServicesStatistic
FeatureType.title: Health services statistic
FeatureType.definition: Type of health care indicator.

FeatureAttribute.name: healthServiceType
FeatureAttribute.title: Health service type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of health services.

FeatureAttribute.name: healthServiceValue
FeatureAttribute.title: health service value
FeatureAttribute.definition: Number of the type considered.

FeatureAttribute.name: referencePeriod
FeatureAttribute.title: Reference period
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time period to which data is referred to.

FeatureType.name: UomConcentration
FeatureType.title: Unit of measure for concentration
FeatureType.definition: A unit of measure for concentration of a specified component within a specified media.

FeatureAttribute.name: component
FeatureAttribute.definition: The component whose concentration is measured.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: SO2 in ambient air, lead in drinking water, benzo-a-pyrene in indoor air, ragweed pollens in ambient air.

FeatureAttribute.name: media
FeatureAttribute.definition: The media in which the concentration is measured.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: SO2 in ambient air, lead in drinking water, benzo-a-pyrene in indoor air, ragweed pollens in ambient air.

FeatureType.name: NoiseMeasure
FeatureType.title: noise measure
FeatureType.definition: A measure of noise intensity.

FeatureAttribute.name: uom
FeatureAttribute.title: unit of measure
FeatureAttribute.definition: A unit of measure for noise intensity.

FeatureType.name: Disease
FeatureType.definition: Statistical information related to pathologies linked directly or indirectly to the quality of environment.
FeatureType.description: Statistical information related to diseases, health-related conditions and external causes of disease and injury, as classified in the International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems, 10th Revision (ICD-10). For practical reasons, a short term ‘disease’ is used to label all conditions covered by this definition.

FeatureAttribute.name: ageRange
FeatureAttribute.title: Age range
FeatureAttribute.definition: Age interval of a specific subpopulation expressed as starting age and an interval, both alternatively expressed in years, months or weeks.

FeatureAttribute.name: diseaseMeasure
FeatureAttribute.title: Disease measure
FeatureAttribute.definition: Different ways how data on diseases and related health problems in a population can be reported.

FeatureAttribute.name: gender
FeatureAttribute.title: Gender
FeatureAttribute.definition: Gender of the population considered.

FeatureAttribute.name: referencePeriod
FeatureAttribute.title: Reference period
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time period to which data refers.

FeatureAttribute.name: pathology
FeatureAttribute.title: International classification of diseases .
FeatureAttribute.definition: Disease as defined in the ICD-10 update 2007 "ICD (International Classification of Diseases, 10<sup>th</sup> revision)".
FeatureAttribute.description: As values in the INSPIRE data, the code could be used (e.g A00, A01, A01.1, ...).

FeatureAttribute.name: COD
FeatureAttribute.title: Cause of death
FeatureAttribute.definition: Data on causes of death (COD) that provide information on mortality patterns and form a major element of public health information.

FeatureType.name: AgeRangeType
FeatureType.title: Age range
FeatureType.definition: Age interval of a specific subpopulation expressed as starting age and an interval, both alternatively expressed in years, months or weeks.

FeatureAttribute.name: startAge
FeatureAttribute.title: start age
FeatureAttribute.definition: Beginning of age interval.

FeatureAttribute.name: range
FeatureAttribute.definition: Duration of age interval.

FeatureType.name: EnvHealthDeterminantMeasure
FeatureType.title: environmental health determinant measure
FeatureType.definition: A raw measurement performed at some place that is of interest for human health determinant analysis.

FeatureAttribute.name: location
FeatureAttribute.title: Location
FeatureAttribute.definition: The location of the measurement.
FeatureAttribute.description: This location should be a point geometry in most cases.

FeatureAttribute.name: type
FeatureAttribute.title: Type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of environmental health determinant.

FeatureAttribute.name: measureTime
FeatureAttribute.title: measure time
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time period when the measure has been performed.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: begin lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: end lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.title: valid from
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the information will start being used.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.title: valid to
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the information will stop being used.

RelationshipRole.name: measure
RelationshipRole.title: Measure
RelationshipRole.definition: The measure

RelationshipRole.name: role_S34946
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: BiomarkerThematicMetadata
FeatureType.title: Biomarker thematic metadata
FeatureType.definition: Thematic Metadata describing the purpose of the study, target population and the characteristic of the studied areas.

FeatureAttribute.name: studyType
FeatureAttribute.title: Study type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The aim of the study (hypothesis driven, general population survey, opportunistic) when these choices are predefined.

FeatureAttribute.name: areaType
FeatureAttribute.title: Area type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The characteristics of the sampling area (urban, rural, semi-urban) when these choices are predefined in a human biomonitoring study.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificSubPopulation
FeatureAttribute.title: Specific subpopulation
FeatureAttribute.definition: The characteristics of the sampled population with respect to age, gender, and other population characteristics when these choices are predefined in a human biomonitoring survey.

FeatureAttribute.name: meanAge
FeatureAttribute.title: Mean age
FeatureAttribute.definition: The mean age of the specific sub population.

FeatureType.name: UomNoise
FeatureType.title: noise unit of measure
FeatureType.definition: A unit of measure for noise intensity.

FeatureAttribute.name: source
FeatureAttribute.title: noise source type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The noise source type.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: Road traffic, rail traffic, air traffic, industrial activity, etc.

FeatureType.name: GeneralHealthStatistics
FeatureType.title: General health statistic
FeatureType.definition: Numbers about some aspects of health related to a population or an area. For the purpose of this data model, 'general health' data include issues such as self-perceived health, demographic distribution of various health problems, smokers, etc., expressed as raw numbers, rates, percentage, stratified by gender, age, and/or socio-economic, cultural, ethnic or other factors.

FeatureAttribute.name: ageRange
FeatureAttribute.title: Age range
FeatureAttribute.definition: Age interval of a specific subpopulation expressed as starting age and an interval, both alternatively expressed in years, months or weeks.

FeatureAttribute.name: gender
FeatureAttribute.title: Gender
FeatureAttribute.definition: Gender of the population considered.

FeatureAttribute.name: generalHealthName
FeatureAttribute.title: General health name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Health status indicator.

FeatureAttribute.name: generalHealthValue
FeatureAttribute.title: General health value
FeatureAttribute.definition: A numerical expression of a health index/indicator.

FeatureAttribute.name: referencePeriod
FeatureAttribute.title: Reference period
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time period to which data is referred to.

FeatureType.name: EnvHealthDeterminantStatisticalData
FeatureType.title: environmental health determinant statistical data
FeatureType.definition: A statistical data of interest for human health determinant analysis, resulting from the aggregation of raw measurements located within a statistical unit.

FeatureAttribute.name: statisticalMethod
FeatureAttribute.title: statistical method
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of statistical method used to aggregate the raw measurement data on the statistical unit.

FeatureAttribute.name: type
FeatureAttribute.title: Type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of environmental health determinant.

RelationshipRole.name: measure
RelationshipRole.title: Measure
RelationshipRole.definition: The measures

RelationshipRole.name: role_S34950
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: BiomarkerType
FeatureType.title: Biomarker type
FeatureType.definition: A biomarker is defined both by a quantified or determined chemical (e.g. cadmium, lead) or its metabolite, and a matrix (e.g. blood, urine) that is used for quantification; for example - cadmium in urine, lead in blood.

FeatureAttribute.name: chemical
FeatureAttribute.title: Chemical
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identification of the compound by name or abbreviation, chemical formula, CAS-PubChem or any other number that is quantified by the measurement.

FeatureAttribute.name: matrix
FeatureAttribute.title: Matrix
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of biological material or body compartment that is sampled to determine or quantify a biomarker.

FeatureType.name: HealthStatisticalData
FeatureType.title: Health statistical data
FeatureType.definition: Human health related data, from recorded diseases and related health problems (according to internationally accepted code lists, such as ICD-10), expressed as morbidity and mortality, to data on general health status (BMI, self perceived health, etc.), data on health care services (health care expenditure, day cases, etc.), and data on biomarkers; these are statistical indices aggregated at different statistical units, collected/reported in different population groups. Inclusion of human biomonitoring data provides an opportunity to explore potential direct or indirect links between human health and the environment.
FeatureType.description: This type is abstract.

RelationshipRole.name: aggregationUnit
RelationshipRole.definition: Statistical unit to which health statistical data refers.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31701
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

ApplicationSchema.name: Hydro - Physical Waters
ApplicationSchema.definition: The 'PhysicalWaters' application schema is concerned primarily with the 'mapping' Use Case

FeatureType.name: Embankment
FeatureType.definition: A man-made raised long mound of earth or other material.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE [DFDD].
NOTE 1 Includes retaining walls, harbours, dikes.
NOTE 2 Regarded as a candidate spatial object in Annex III theme 'Natural risk zones' due to its role in limiting flooding.

FeatureType.name: Falls
FeatureType.definition: A vertically descending part of a watercourse where it falls from a height.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE [Based on DFDD].
EXAMPLE Waterfalls over a rock or a precipice.

FeatureAttribute.name: height
FeatureAttribute.definition: Distance measured from the lowest point of the base at ground or water level (downhill side/downstream side) to the tallest point of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: SOURCE [DFDD].

FeatureType.name: FluvialPoint
FeatureType.definition: A hydro point of interest that affects the flow of a watercourse.
FeatureType.description: EXAMPLE Fluvial points (waterfall, cascade, rapids, breaker), spring/water hole (spring, source, geyser, thermal spring, natural fountain, well, also fumarole, artesian), sinkhole (sinkhole, drainage loss).
NOTE A hydro point of interest may create a flow constriction in the network.
This type is abstract.

FeatureType.name: DamOrWeir
FeatureType.definition: A permanent barrier across a watercourse used to impound water or to control its flow.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE [EuroRegionalMap].

FeatureType.name: Sluice
FeatureType.definition: An open, inclined conduit fitted with a gate for regulating water flow.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE [DFDD].

FeatureType.name: Watercourse
FeatureType.definition: A natural or man-made flowing watercourse or stream.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE [EuroRegionalMap].

FeatureAttribute.name: condition
FeatureAttribute.definition: The state of planning, construction, repair, and/or maintenance of a watercourse.
FeatureAttribute.description: SOURCE [Based on DFDD].
NOTE Only relevant for a man-made watercourse.

FeatureAttribute.name: delineationKnown
FeatureAttribute.definition: An indication that the delineation (for example: limits and information) of a spatial object is known.
FeatureAttribute.description: SOURCE [DFDD].
EXAMPLE The delineation may not be known in the following situations:
- an underground watercourse
- real underground network segment (pipeline or natural network section)
- transition area between a broad river and a smaller tributary

FeatureAttribute.name: length
FeatureAttribute.definition: Length of the watercourse.

FeatureAttribute.name: level
FeatureAttribute.definition: Vertical location of watercourse relative to ground.

FeatureAttribute.name: streamOrder
FeatureAttribute.definition: Number (or code) expressing the degree of branching in a stream system.
FeatureAttribute.description: SOURCE [Based on UNESCO/WMO International Glossary of Hydrology].

FeatureAttribute.name: width
FeatureAttribute.definition: Width of watercourse (as a range) along its length.

FeatureType.name: Crossing
FeatureType.definition: A man-made object allowing the passage of water above or below an obstacle.
FeatureType.description: EXAMPLE Aqueduct, bridge, culvert, siphon.

FeatureAttribute.name: type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of physical crossing.

FeatureType.name: Ford
FeatureType.definition: A shallow part of a watercourse used as a road crossing.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE [DFDD].

FeatureType.name: Wetland
FeatureType.definition: A poorly drained or periodically flooded area where the soil is saturated with water, and vegetation is supported.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE [EuroRegionalMap].
EXAMPLE Marsh/swamp, bog/moor.
NOTE Regarded as a candidate spatial object in Annex II theme 'Land cover' due to explicit mention in 2007/2/EC Ann. II 2.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry of the wetland, as a surface.

FeatureAttribute.name: localType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Provides 'local' name for the type of wetland.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE Bog, swamp.

FeatureAttribute.name: tidal
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identifies whether the wetland is affected by tidal water.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureType.name: HydroPointOfInterest
FeatureType.definition: A natural place where water appears, disappears or changes its flow.
FeatureType.description: EXAMPLE Fluvial points (waterfall, cascade, rapids, breaker), spring/water hole (spring, source, geyser, thermal spring, natural fountain, well, also fumarole, artesian), sinkhole (sinkhole, drainage loss).
NOTE A hydro point of interest may create a flow constriction in the network.
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry of the hydro point of interest, as a point, curve or surface.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: levelOfDetail
FeatureAttribute.definition: Resolution, expressed as the inverse of an indicative scale or a ground distance.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The object is captured at a scale of this level of detail; rules apply for portrayal and visualisation.

FeatureType.name: ShorelineConstruction
FeatureType.definition: An artificial structure attached to land bordering a body of water and fixed in position.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE [DFDD].

NOTE 1 It is usually fixed to the waterbody bottom (for example: a mole) but may occasionally be fixed in position (for example: attached to the shore at one end and held between pilings at the other) but floating. Shoreline constructions are normally used for berthing and/or protection.
NOTE 2 Includes breakwater/groyne/wharf; but has more flexibility - also applies to inland waters.

FeatureType.name: LandWaterBoundary
FeatureType.definition: The line where a land mass is in contact with a body of water.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE [DFDD].

NOTE The plane of reference for the land-water boundary should be a high water datum, such as 'Mean High Water Springs', 'High Water' or 'Mean Higher High Water'. Where there is little appreciable change in waterlevels / tide at the adjacent shore, then 'Mean Sea Level' or 'Local Datum' may be used.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry of the land-water boundary, as a curve.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: origin
FeatureAttribute.definition: Origin of the land-water boundary.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE Natural, man-made, etc.; a sea defence is a land-water boundary of man-made origin.

FeatureAttribute.name: waterLevelCategory
FeatureAttribute.definition: Water-level defining the land-water boundary.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE High water, low water, etc.

FeatureType.name: RiverBasin
FeatureType.definition: The area of land from which all surface run-off flows through a sequence of streams, rivers and, possibly, lakes into the sea at a single river mouth, estuary or delta.

FeatureType.name: HydroOrderCode
FeatureType.definition: A hydrologically meaningful 'order code' for ordering hierarchies of watercourses and drainage basins.

FeatureAttribute.name: order
FeatureAttribute.definition: Number (or code) expressing the degree of branching or dividing in a stream or drainage basin system.
FeatureAttribute.description: SOURCE [Based on UNESCO/WMO International Glossary of Hydrology].

FeatureAttribute.name: orderScheme
FeatureAttribute.definition: A description of the concept for ordering.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE Strahler, Horton, Pfaffstetter etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: scope
FeatureAttribute.definition: An indicator of the scope or origin for an order code (including whether it is national, supranational or European).
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE In the case of a national hydrographic identifier it may start with a two-letter country code as per ISO 3166-1-Alpha-2.

FeatureType.name: Shore
FeatureType.definition: The narrow strip of land in immediate contact with any body of water including the area between high and low water lines.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE [IHO S-32].
NOTE Regarded as a candidate spatial object in Annex II theme 'Land cover' due to unconsolidated shore inclusion in coastal land-cover classificaction schemes.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry of the shore.

FeatureAttribute.name: composition
FeatureAttribute.definition: <font color="#1a1a1a">The primary type(s) of material composing a spatial object, exclusive of the surface.</font>
FeatureAttribute.description: <font color="#1a1a1a">SOURCE [Based on DFDD].</font>
<font color="#1a1a1a">NOTE The basis for 'primary' may be, for example, compositional dominance or structural organization.</font>

FeatureAttribute.name: delineationKnown
FeatureAttribute.definition: An indication that the delineation (for example: limits and information) of a spatial object is known.
FeatureAttribute.description: SOURCE [Based on DFDD].

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureType.name: DrainageBasin
FeatureType.definition: Area having a common outlet for its surface runoff.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE [UNESCO/WMO International Glossary of Hydrology].

NOTE 1 Regarding the different classifications of drainage basins, no distinction is made between drainage basins / sub-basins since this will vary with application. It is possible to build basins from other basins.
NOTE 2 The outlet of a drainage basin may be a canal or a lake.
NOTE 3 Synonyms for drainage basin include: catchment; catchment area; drainage area; river basin; watershed.

FeatureAttribute.name: area
FeatureAttribute.definition: Size of the drainage basin area.

FeatureAttribute.name: basinOrder
FeatureAttribute.definition: Number (or code) expressing the degree of branching/dividing in a drainage basin system.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry of the drainage basin, as a surface.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: origin
FeatureAttribute.definition: Origin of the drainage basin.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE Natural, man-made, etc.
NOTE A polder is a drainage basin of man-made origin.

RelationshipRole.name: containsBasin
RelationshipRole.definition: A smaller sub-basin contained within a larger basin.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32398
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: outlet
RelationshipRole.definition: The surface water outlet(s) of a drainage basin.

RelationshipRole.name: drainsBasin
RelationshipRole.definition: The basin(s) drained by a surface water.

FeatureType.name: WidthRange
FeatureType.definition: The range of a watercourse's horizontal width along its length.

FeatureAttribute.name: lower
FeatureAttribute.definition: Lower bound of width.

FeatureAttribute.name: upper
FeatureAttribute.definition: Upper bound of width.

FeatureType.name: Rapids
FeatureType.definition: Portions of a stream with accelerated current where it descends rapidly but without a break in the slope of the bed sufficient to form a waterfall.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE [DFDD].

FeatureType.name: ManMadeObject
FeatureType.definition: An artificial object which lies inside a body of water and has one of the following types of function:
- Retains the water;
- Regulates the quantity of water;
- Alters the course of the water;
- Allows watercourses to cross each other.
FeatureType.description: NOTE Derived 'views' of real-world hydrographic objects are represented through specialisations in other application schemas; all representations of the same real-world object share a common geographic name or hydrographic identifier.
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: condition
FeatureAttribute.definition: The state of planning, construction, repair, and/or maintenance of the structures and/or equipment comprising a facility and/or located at a site, as a whole.
FeatureAttribute.description: SOURCE [DFDD].

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry of the man-made object, as a point, curve or surface.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: levelOfDetail
FeatureAttribute.definition: Resolution, expressed as the inverse of an indicative scale or a ground distance.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The object is captured at a scale of this level of detail; rules apply for portrayal and visualisation.

FeatureType.name: StandingWater
FeatureType.definition: A body of water that is entirely surrounded by land.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE [DFDD].

NOTE It may occur in a natural terrain depression in which water collects, or may be impounded by a dam, or formed by its bed being hollowed out of the soil, or formed by embanking and/or damming up a natural hollow (for example: by a beaver dam). It may be connected to inflowing / outflowing watercourses or other standing waters.

FeatureAttribute.name: elevation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Elevation above mean sea level.
FeatureAttribute.description: SOURCE [Based on EuroRegionalMap].

FeatureAttribute.name: meanDepth
FeatureAttribute.definition: Average depth of the body of water.

FeatureAttribute.name: surfaceArea
FeatureAttribute.definition: Surface area of the body of water.

FeatureType.name: Lock
FeatureType.definition: An enclosure with a pair or series of gates used for raising or lowering vessels as they pass from one water level to another.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE [DFDD].

FeatureType.name: SurfaceWater
FeatureType.definition: Any known inland waterway body.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE [Based on DFDD].
EXAMPLE Lake/pond, reservoir, river/stream, etc.
NOTE May include islands, represented as 'holes' in its geometry. Islands may be surrounded by a shore and / or land-ware boundary.
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry of the surface water:
- either a curve or surface for a watercourse;
- either a point or surface for a standing water.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: levelOfDetail
FeatureAttribute.definition: Resolution, expressed as the inverse of an indicative scale or a ground distance.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The object is captured at a scale of this level of detail; rules apply for portrayal and visualisation.

FeatureAttribute.name: localType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Provides 'local' name for the type of surface water.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE Canal, channel, ditch, etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: origin
FeatureAttribute.definition: Origin of the surface water.
FeatureAttribute.description: SOURCE [Based on EuroRegionalMap].
EXAMPLE Natural, man-made, etc.

NOTE 1 Natural surface waters are natural watercourses (e.g. rivers, streams) and standing waters (e.g. pools, lakes) naturally preserved and that have been canalised and / or dammed either for navigation or for preventing flood disaster.
NOTE 2 A man-made surface water is a surface water entirely created by man for drainage, storage or transportation purpose, this includes canals, ditches and reservoirs.

FeatureAttribute.name: persistence
FeatureAttribute.definition: The degree of persistence of water.
FeatureAttribute.description: SOURCE [Based on DFDD].

FeatureAttribute.name: tidal
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identifies whether the surface water is affected by tidal water.

RelationshipRole.name: neighbour
RelationshipRole.definition: An association to another instance of the same real-world surface water in another data set.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32408
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: bank
RelationshipRole.definition: The bank(s) associated to a surface water.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32415
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: QuantityValue
FeatureType.definition: Data container with a single quantity value or a range of quantity values .

FeatureAttribute.name: singleQuantity
FeatureAttribute.title: Single Quantity
FeatureAttribute.definition: Scalar component with decimal representation and a unit of measure used to store value of a continuous quantity.

FeatureAttribute.name: quantityInterval
FeatureAttribute.title: Quantity Interval
FeatureAttribute.definition: Decimal pair for specifying a quantity range with a unit of measure.

FeatureType.name: Aquiclude
FeatureType.definition: An impermeable body of rock or stratum of sediment that acts as a barrier to the flow of groundwater.
FeatureType.description: A formation which, although porous and capable of absorbing water slowly, will not transmit water fast enough to furnish an appreciable supply for a well or spring. Aquicludes are characterized by very low values of "leakage" (the ratio of vertical Hydraulic Conductivity to thickness), so that they transmit only minor inter-aquifer flow and also have very low rates of yield from compressible storage. Therefore, they constitute boundaries of aquifer flow systems.

FeatureType.name: HydrogeologicalObjectManMade
FeatureType.title: Hydrogeological Object Man-made
FeatureType.definition: A man-made hydrogeological object.
FeatureType.description: Examples of manmade hydrogeological objects are: well, groundwater intake, groundwater monitoring station or monitoring well.
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.title: Valid From
FeatureAttribute.definition: Official date and time the hydrogeological object was/will be legally established.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE This is the date and time the register reference can be used in legal acts.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.title: Valid To
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which the hydrogeological object legally ceased/will cease to be used.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE This is the date and time the register reference can no longer be used in legal acts.

FeatureAttribute.name: statusCode
FeatureAttribute.title: Status Code
FeatureAttribute.definition: A code defining the formal status of a man-made hydrogeological object.

FeatureType.name: HydrogeologicalObject
FeatureType.title: Hydrogeological Object
FeatureType.definition: An abstract class for man-made facilities or natural features that have an interaction with the hydrogeological system.
FeatureType.description: Hydrogeological objects may be natural (eg. spring) or the manmade (eg. wells). The vast majority of hydrogeological objects are manmade.
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.title: INSPIRE Identifier
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.title: Geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry defining the spatial location of the HydrogeologicalObject.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.title: Name
FeatureAttribute.definition: The name or code of the HydrogeologicalObject.

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.title: Description
FeatureAttribute.definition: The description of the HydrogeologicalObject.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: Begin Life Span Version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: End Life Span Version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

RelationshipRole.name: aquifer
RelationshipRole.title: Aquifer
RelationshipRole.definition: The Aquifer within which the HydrogeologicalObject occurs.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32186
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: HydrogeologicalUnit
FeatureType.title: Hydrogeological Unit
FeatureType.definition: A part of the lithosphere with distinctive parameters for water storage and conduction.
FeatureType.description: Includes both formal units (i.e. formally adopted and named in an official lexicon) and informal units (i.e. named but not promoted to the lexicon) and unnamed units (i.e. recognisable and described and delineable in the field but not otherwise formalised).
Spatial properties are only available through association with a MappedFeature.
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.title: Description
FeatureAttribute.definition: The description of the HydrogeologicalUnit

FeatureAttribute.name: approximateDepth
FeatureAttribute.title: Approximate Depth
FeatureAttribute.definition: The approximate depth of the HydrogeologicalUnit occurrence.

FeatureAttribute.name: approximateThickness
FeatureAttribute.title: Approximate Thickness
FeatureAttribute.definition: The approximate thickness of the HydrogeologicalUnit.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: Begin Life Span Version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: End Life Span Version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

RelationshipRole.name: geologicStructure
RelationshipRole.title: Geologic Structure
RelationshipRole.definition: Relates one or many HydrogeologicalUnit(s) to a GeologicStructure.
RelationshipRole.description: Allows the description of groundwater occurrence in geological structures.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32204
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: AquiferSystem
FeatureType.title: Aquifer System
FeatureType.definition: A collection of aquifers and aquitards, which together constitute the environment of groundwater - "communicating vessels", that are filled or can be filled with water.
FeatureType.description: Attributes of Aquifer System and its components determine the feasibility of water collection, its movement, as well as the impact on its chemical state.
NOTE: The Aquifer System components and their attributes (including geometry) are relatively stable over time except in special cases.

FeatureAttribute.name: isLayered
FeatureAttribute.title: Is Layered
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indicates if the AquiferSystem consists of more than one layer.

RelationshipRole.name: aquifer
RelationshipRole.title: Aquifer
RelationshipRole.definition: The Aquifer(s) contained in the AquiferSystem.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32189
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: aquiclude
RelationshipRole.title: Aquiclude
RelationshipRole.definition: An Aquiclude enclosing the AquiferSystem.
RelationshipRole.description: This acts as a barrier for groundwater flow.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32177
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: aquitard
RelationshipRole.title: Aquitard
RelationshipRole.definition: The Aquitard(s) contained within the AquiferSystem.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32174
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: Aquifer
FeatureType.definition: A wet underground layer of water-bearing permeable rock or unconsolidated materials (gravel, sand, silt, or clay) from which groundwater can be usefully extracted using a water well.
FeatureType.description: An underground geological formation able to store and yield water.

FeatureAttribute.name: aquiferType
FeatureAttribute.title: Type of Aquifer
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of aquifer.
FeatureAttribute.description: Water in an Aquifer is, or is not, under pressure. Based on that unconfined, confined, artesian, or subartesian types are distinguished.

FeatureAttribute.name: mediaType
FeatureAttribute.title: Type of Media
FeatureAttribute.definition: The classification of the medium in which the groundwater flow occurs.

FeatureAttribute.name: isExploited
FeatureAttribute.title: Is Exploited
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indicates if groundwater from aquifer is exploited by wells or intakes

FeatureAttribute.name: isMainInSystem
FeatureAttribute.title: Is Main In System
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indicates if aquifer is the main useful aquifer in the aquifer system

FeatureAttribute.name: vulnerabilityToPollution
FeatureAttribute.title: Vulnerability To Pollution
FeatureAttribute.definition: An index value or interval of values determining the potential degree of aquifer risk arising from the geological structure, hydrogeological conditions and the existence of real or potential source of contamination.
FeatureAttribute.description: A single value should be used if it is determined directly from the DRASTIC method. If attribute data comes from another data source which is expressed by categorized items, for example: low, moderate or high, interval should be used expressed by lowest and highest value of category. EXAMPLE: ‘Moderate’ means interval from 101 to 140.

FeatureAttribute.name: permeabilityCoefficient
FeatureAttribute.title: Permeability Coefficient
FeatureAttribute.definition: The volume of an incompressible fluid that will flow in unit time through a unit cube of a porous substance across which a unit pressure difference is maintained.
FeatureAttribute.description: The parameter represents the hydraulic conductivity of a rock container. Describes the ease with which water can move through pore spaces or fractures. It depends on the intrinsic permeability of the material and on the degree of saturation.
NOTE: Because of their high porosity and permeability, sand and gravel have higher hydraulic conductivity than clay or unfractured granite aquifers.

FeatureAttribute.name: storativityCoefficient
FeatureAttribute.title: Storativity Coefficient
FeatureAttribute.definition: The ability of an aquifer to store water.

FeatureAttribute.name: hydroGeochemicalRockType
FeatureAttribute.title: Hydrogeochemical Type of Rock
FeatureAttribute.definition: The rock type with respect to the soluble rock components and their hydrogeochemical influence of groundwater.
FeatureAttribute.description: Defines the prevailing geochemical character of natural groundwater within the Aquifer.

RelationshipRole.name: aquitard
RelationshipRole.title: Aquitard
RelationshipRole.definition: The Aquitard(s) that separates the Aquifer.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32185
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: hydrogeologicalObject
RelationshipRole.title: Hydrogeological Object
RelationshipRole.definition: The HydrogeologicalObject(s) related to the aquifer.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32188
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: aquiferSystem
RelationshipRole.title: Aquifer System
RelationshipRole.definition: The specific AquiferSystem where the Aquitard occurs.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32190
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: GroundWaterBody
FeatureType.title: Groundwater Body
FeatureType.definition: A distinct volume of groundwater within an aquifer or system of aquifers, which is hydraulically isolated from nearby groundwater bodies.
FeatureType.description: Groundwater bodies form the principal management units under the European Water Framework Directive (2000/60/CE, 2000). They should be hydraulically continuous entities, and must be defined on the basis of flow or abstraction, and are inextricably linked to surface water bodies.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.title: INSPIRE Identifier
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE: An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: approximateHorizontalExtend
FeatureAttribute.title: Approximate Horizontal Extend
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry defining the boundary of the GroundWaterBody.

FeatureAttribute.name: conditionOfGroundWaterBody
FeatureAttribute.title: Condition of Groundwater Body
FeatureAttribute.definition: The approximate degree of change to groundwater as a result of human activity.

FeatureAttribute.name: mineralization
FeatureAttribute.title: Water Type
FeatureAttribute.definition: One of the main chemical characteristics of water. A value is a sum of all water chemical concentration components.

FeatureAttribute.name: piezometricState
FeatureAttribute.title: Piezometric State
FeatureAttribute.definition: Specifies the piezometric state of the GroundwaterBody water table

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: Begin Life Span Version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: End Life Span Version
