FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

RelationshipRole.name: hydrogeologicalObjectNatural
RelationshipRole.title: Hydrogeological Object Natural
RelationshipRole.definition: A HydrogeologicalObjectNatural interacting with the GroundwaterBody.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32192
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: activeWell
RelationshipRole.title: Active Well
RelationshipRole.definition: The ActiveWell which changes the state of the GroundwaterBody through the extraction of groundwater resources.
RelationshipRole.description: ActiveWell by extracting groundwater resources influences the state of GroundWaterBody resources it is installed in.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32181
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: aquiferSystem
RelationshipRole.title: Aquifer System
RelationshipRole.definition: The AquiferSystem which includes the GroundWaterBody.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32182
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: observationWell
RelationshipRole.definition: The observation wells which monitor the GroundWaterBody

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32183
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: HydrogeologicalObjectNatural
FeatureType.title: Hydrogeological Object Natural
FeatureType.definition: HydrogeologicalObject which was created by natural processes.
FeatureType.description: Examples of natural hydrogeological objects are: a source, vanishing point and geyser.

FeatureAttribute.name: naturalObjectType
FeatureAttribute.title: Natural Object Type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of natural hydrogeological object.

FeatureAttribute.name: waterPersistence
FeatureAttribute.title: Water Persistence
FeatureAttribute.definition: The degree of persistence of water flow.

FeatureAttribute.name: approximateQuantityOfFlow
FeatureAttribute.title: Approximate Quantity of Flow
FeatureAttribute.definition: An approximate value defining the water yield in a natural hydrogeological object.
FeatureAttribute.description: The discharge of water flow for a certain cross-section per time unit.

RelationshipRole.name: groundWaterBody
RelationshipRole.title: Groundwater Body
RelationshipRole.definition: The GroundWateBody with which the natural hydrogeological object interacts.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32194
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: HydrogeologicalSurface
FeatureType.title: Hydrogeological Surface
FeatureType.definition: A surface that represents the interpolated groundwater table, or other surface, for a local or regional area.
FeatureType.description: This is the 2.5D geometry for hydrogeological surfaces and is based on hydrogeological measurements in a group of wells or other sources of data.

FeatureAttribute.name: surfaceRectifiedGrid
FeatureAttribute.title: Surface as Rectified Grid
FeatureAttribute.definition: A surface whose domain is a rectified grid.
FeatureAttribute.description: A rectified grid is a grid for which there is an affine transformation between the grid coordinates and the coordinates of a coordinate system. It can be used for both discrete and continuous coverages.

FeatureAttribute.name: surfaceReferencableGrid
FeatureAttribute.title: Surface as Referenceable Grid.
FeatureAttribute.definition: Surface whose domain consists of a referenceable grid.
FeatureAttribute.description: A referenceable grid is a grid associated with a transformation that can be used to convert grid coordinate values to values of coordinates referenced to a coordinate reference system. It can be used for both discrete and continuous coverages.

FeatureAttribute.name: surfacePointCollection
FeatureAttribute.title: Surface Point Collection
FeatureAttribute.definition: Hydrogeological surface represented by collection of observations in points.

FeatureType.name: PiezometricState
FeatureType.title: Piezometric State
FeatureType.definition: The piezometric state of a GroundWaterBody
FeatureType.description: Groundwater state (level) as a surface. It can be a set of point observations or interpolated to form a coverage.

FeatureAttribute.name: observationTime
FeatureAttribute.title: Observation Time
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time of groundwater state observation.

FeatureAttribute.name: piezometricSurface
FeatureAttribute.title: Piezometric Surface
FeatureAttribute.definition: A surface that represents the level to which water will rise in tightly cased wells.
FeatureAttribute.description: If the head varies significantly with depth in the aquifer, then there may be more than one potentiometric surface. The water table is a particular potentiometric surface for an unconfined aquifer.

FeatureType.name: ActiveWell
FeatureType.title: Active Well
FeatureType.definition: A well influencing the groundwater resources of the aquifer.
FeatureType.description: The most common examples of Active Well are: extracting, artificial recharging, or dewatering wells.
NOTE: ActiveWell by extracting, recharging or dewatering influences and changes the state of groundwater resources.

FeatureAttribute.name: activityType
FeatureAttribute.title: Active Well Type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of activity carried out by the well.
FeatureAttribute.description: Indicates if the well is used for extracting, recharging, dewatering etc of the groundwater resources.

RelationshipRole.name: groundWaterBody
RelationshipRole.title: Groundwater Body
RelationshipRole.definition: The GroundWaterBody from which the ActiveWell extracts groundwater resources.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32180
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: environmentalMonitoringFacility
RelationshipRole.title: Environmental Monitoring Facility
RelationshipRole.definition: The related EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility.
RelationshipRole.description: The Environmental Monitoring Facility commonly comprises one or more Active Wells acting as groundwater observation wells.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32172
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: borehole
RelationshipRole.title: Borehole
RelationshipRole.definition: The Borehole upon which the ActiveWell is based.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32195
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: Aquitard
FeatureType.definition: A saturated, but poorly permeable bed that impedes groundwater movement.
FeatureType.description: It does not yield water freely to wells, but may transmit appreciable water to or from adjacent aquifers and, where sufficiently thick, may constitute an important ground-water storage unit. Aquitards are characterized by values of leakance that may range from relatively low to relatively high. A really extensive aquitard of relatively low leakance may function regionally as boundaries of aquifer flow systems.

FeatureAttribute.name: approximatePermeabilityCoefficient
FeatureAttribute.title: Approximate Permeability Coefficient
FeatureAttribute.definition: The volume of an incompressible fluid that will flow in unit time through a unit cube of a porous substance across which a unit pressure difference is maintained.
FeatureAttribute.description: The parameter represents the hydraulic conductivity of a rock container. Describes the ease with which water can move through pore spaces or fractures. It depends on the intrinsic permeability of the material and on the degree of saturation.
NOTE: Because of their high porosity and permeability, sand and gravel have higher hydraulic conductivity than clay or unfractured granite aquifers.

FeatureAttribute.name: approximateStorativityCoefficient
FeatureAttribute.title: Approximate Storativity Coefficient
FeatureAttribute.definition: The ability of an aquifer to store water.

RelationshipRole.name: aquifer
RelationshipRole.title: Aquifer
RelationshipRole.definition: The Aquifers separated by the Aquitard.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32191
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: aquiferSystem
RelationshipRole.title: Aquifer System
RelationshipRole.definition: The AquiferSystem of which the Aquitard is a part.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32173
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: SpecificPresence
FeatureType.title: specific presence
FeatureType.definition: Presence of one or several land use classification values in an area according to the code list
provided by the data provider, indicated either as the percentage covered for each value or as
the values listed in their order of importance.
FeatureType.description: NOTE 1: The order of land use value presence without percentages enable providing an order of dominance/importance of each land use present in the land use object
NOTE 2: The sum of the percentages can be below 100%, or above. The order is provided according to the respective importance when the percentages are not known.

FeatureType.name: HILUCSPresence
FeatureType.title: HILUCS presence
FeatureType.definition: Presence of one or several HILUCS values in an area, indicated either as the percentage covered for each value or as the values listed in their order of importance.
FeatureType.description: The HILUCS presence data type enables the provision of information on land uses inside one land use object in order to collect more than one land use existence perfectly identifiable by importance order or percentages.
NOTE 1: The order of land use value presence without percentages enable providing an order of dominance/importance of each land use present in the land use object
NOTE 2: The sum of the percentages can be below 100%, or above. The order is provided according to the respective importance when the percentages are not known.

FeatureType.name: SpecificPercentage
FeatureType.title: specific percentage
FeatureType.definition: Percentage of land use object that is covered by this specific presence.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificValue
FeatureAttribute.definition: specific value category for this specific percentage.

FeatureAttribute.name: percentage
FeatureAttribute.definition: Percentage of land use object that is covered by a specific presence.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The percentage is according to the socio-economic importance of the use. In section 5.2.1.1.2. examples of the use of percentages are given.

FeatureType.name: HILUCSPercentage
FeatureType.title: HILUCS percentage
FeatureType.definition: Percentage of land use object that is covered by this HILUCS presence.
FeatureType.description: NOTE1:The percentage is according to the socio-economic or functional importance of the use.
NOTE2:examples are provided in the narrative description part of the data specification.

FeatureAttribute.name: hilucsValue
FeatureAttribute.definition: HILUCS category for this HILUCS percentage.

FeatureAttribute.name: percentage
FeatureAttribute.definition: Percentage of land use object that is covered by this specific presence.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The percentage is according to the socio-economic importance of the use. In section 5.2.1.1.2. examples of the use of percentages are given.

ApplicationSchema.name: LandCoverNomenclature
ApplicationSchema.definition: application schema for Land Cover Nomenclature

FeatureType.name: LandCoverNomenclature
FeatureType.title: Land Cover Nomenclature
FeatureType.definition: Information about reference national, institutional or local Land Cover nomenclature.
FeatureType.description: Land Cover Nomenclature allows to reference nomenclatures documentation and associated code list, and to define them through an external reference or included within the data according 19144-2.

FeatureAttribute.name: embeddedDescription
FeatureAttribute.title: embedded Description
FeatureAttribute.definition: An embedded encoding of the classification system according to ISO 19144-2.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: nomenclatureCodeList
FeatureAttribute.definition: An http URI pointing to the code list attached to the nomenclature used.

FeatureAttribute.name: externalDescription
FeatureAttribute.definition: Document describing the nomenclature used in this data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: responsibleParty
FeatureAttribute.title: responsible party
FeatureAttribute.definition: Party responsible for the development and/or maintenance of the nomenclature.
FeatureAttribute.description: The responsible party could be EEA, a national or local mapping agency, ...

ApplicationSchema.name: LandCoverRaster
ApplicationSchema.definition: application schema for Land Cover Raster

FeatureType.name: LandCoverGridCoverage
FeatureType.title: Land Cover Grid Coverage
FeatureType.definition: A raster representation for Land Cover data.
FeatureType.description: This representation allows Land Cover data being supported by rectified grid coverage (ISO 19123).

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: Contains the extent of the data set.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Extents may be specified in space, time or space-time.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name of the Land Cover coverage.

FeatureAttribute.name: nomenclatureDocumentation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Information about the nomenclature used in this coverage.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the phenomenon started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the phenomenon no longer exists in the real world.

ApplicationSchema.name: LandCoverVector
ApplicationSchema.definition: application schema for Land Cover Vector

FeatureType.name: LandCoverUnit
FeatureType.title: Land Cover Unit
FeatureType.definition: An individual element of the LC dataset represented by a point or polygon.
FeatureType.description: Every unit support Land Cover information.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Spatial representation of the Land Cover unit.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Restricted to point or surface.

FeatureAttribute.name: landCoverObservation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Land cover information at a specific time and place.

FeatureType.name: LandCoverValue
FeatureType.title: Land Cover Value
FeatureType.definition: Generic class supporting Land Cover value and percentage.

FeatureAttribute.name: class
FeatureAttribute.definition: Assignment of a land cover spatial object to a land
cover class through a classification code identifier.
FeatureAttribute.description: The identifier, eg 1, 1.1.2, ... (for CORINE LC classes) allow to access to the value and the definition or narrative description of the corresponding class.

FeatureAttribute.name: coveredPercentage
FeatureAttribute.title: Covered percentage
FeatureAttribute.definition: Fraction of the LandCoverUnit being concerned with the classification value.

FeatureType.name: LandCoverDataset
FeatureType.title: Land Cover Data set
FeatureType.definition: A vector representation for Land Cover data.
FeatureType.description: This representation allows Land Cover data being supported by a vector geometry.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: Contains the extent of the data set.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Extents may be specified in space, time or space-time.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name of the Land Cover data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: nomenclatureDocumentation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Information about the nomenclature used in this data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the phenomenon started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the phenomenon no longer exists in the real world.

RelationshipRole.name: member
RelationshipRole.title: element
RelationshipRole.definition: A Land Cover Unit being part of the data set.
RelationshipRole.description: A Land Cover dataset is a collection of LandCover units, each one being called an element.

RelationshipRole.name: role_T32140
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: LandCoverObservation
FeatureType.title: Land Cover Observation
FeatureType.definition: Land Cover information interpreted at a specific time and place.

FeatureAttribute.name: class
FeatureAttribute.definition: The assignment of a land cover class to a land cover unit through a classification code identifier
FeatureAttribute.description: The identifier, eg 1.1.1, 1.1.2, ... (for CORINE LC classes) allow to access to the value and the definition or narrative description of the corresponding class.

FeatureAttribute.name: mosaic
FeatureAttribute.definition: List of classification values describing into details a land cover unit, associated with percentages.

FeatureAttribute.name: observationDate
FeatureAttribute.definition: The observation date associated of an observation.
FeatureAttribute.description: Defines the observation date of the classification value. It could be the date of an aerial/satellital acquisition or of an update on the field. The observation date allows the user to have accurate date of when each value was observed in the real word. In a database, not all polygon informations are necessarily updated at the same time.

FeatureType.name: MaritimeZone
FeatureType.title: maritime zone
FeatureType.definition: A belt of sea defined by international treaties and conventions, where coastal State executes jurisdictional rights.
FeatureType.description: NOTE 1 The zone is established for e.g. cadastral, administrative, economic, security or safety purposes. It is not established for environmental management or regulation, which is covered by the theme Area management/restriction/regulation zones and reporting areas, or for environmental protection, which is covered by the theme Protected sites.
NOTE 2 The maritime zone can be either internal waters, territorial sea, contiguous zone, exclusive economic zone or continental shelf.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: begin lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: country
FeatureAttribute.definition: The country that this maritime zone belongs to.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifepanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: end lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometric representation of spatial area covered by this maritime zone.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.title: inspire id
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name(s) of the maritime zone.

FeatureAttribute.name: zoneType
FeatureAttribute.title: zone type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of maritime zone.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32484
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32485
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32486
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: baseline
RelationshipRole.definition: Baseline or baselines used for the delineation of this maritime zone.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32487
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: boundary
RelationshipRole.definition: The boundary or boundaries of this maritime zone.

RelationshipRole.name: role_T32489
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: Baseline
FeatureType.title: baseline
FeatureType.definition: The line from which the outer limits of the territorial sea and certain other outer limits are measured.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE IHO Dictionary, S-32, Fifth Edition.
NOTE The baseline comprises of one or more baseline segments.
According to United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea (UNCLOS), the baseline segment can be normal, straight or archipelagic depending on the method used to determine the baseline segment.
COMMENT: For this moment there is no clearly identified use-case that would require Baseline spatial object types, therefore it is not strictly necessary to include these objects in the dataset.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: begin lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: end lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.title: inspire id
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

RelationshipRole.name: segment
RelationshipRole.definition: Segment of a baseline.

RelationshipRole.name: role_T32488
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: MaritimeBoundary
FeatureType.title: maritime boundary
FeatureType.definition: A line depicting the separation of any type of maritime jurisdiction.
FeatureType.description: SOURCE IHO Dictionary, S-32, Fifth Edition.
NOTE 1 Maritime boundary represents either:
1) the seaward outer limits of the maritime zones of a coastal State, such as territorial sea, contiguous zone, exclusive economic zone and continental shelf;
2) the limits of the maritime zones of States with opposite or adjacent coasts.

Maritime boundaries are a politically sensitive subject, because it affects coastal State's jurisdiction concerning fishery, petroleum and other resources of the sea as well as other uses of the sea. [Source: "Maritime Boundary", S.P. Jagota]

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: begin lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: country
FeatureAttribute.definition: The country that the maritime zone of this boundary belongs to.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE If the boundary divides two maritime zones belonging to the same country, only this country should be specified. If the boundary divides maritime zones belonging to neigbouring countries, both countries should be specified.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: end lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometric representation of the maritime boundary.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.title: inspire id
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: legalStatus
FeatureAttribute.title: legal status
FeatureAttribute.definition: Legal status of this maritime boundary.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The legal status is considered in terms of political agreement or disagreement of the maritime boundary.

FeatureAttribute.name: technicalStatus
FeatureAttribute.title: technical status
FeatureAttribute.definition: The technical status of the maritime boundary.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The technical status of the maritime boundary is considered in terms of its topological matching or not-matching with the borders of maritime zones separated by this boundary. Edge-matched means that the same set of coordinates is used.

FeatureType.name: BaselineSegment
FeatureType.title: baseline segment
FeatureType.definition: Segment of the baseline from which the outer limits of the territorial sea and certain other outer limits are measured.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometric representation of the baseline segment.

FeatureAttribute.name: segmentType
FeatureAttribute.title: segment type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The baseline type used for this segment.
FeatureAttribute.description: The type can be 'normal', 'straight' or 'archipelagic'.

FeatureType.name: Mine
FeatureType.definition: An excavation carried out for the extraction of mineral deposits.
FeatureType.description: ‘True’ mines are underground workings and open-pit workings (also called open-sky mines) generally for the extraction of metallic commodities. The Mine feature also includes open workings generally for the extraction of industrial minerals, commonly referred to as quarries.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

RelationshipRole.name: relatedActivity
RelationshipRole.definition: The MiningActivity associated with the Mine.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31643
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureAttribute.name: startDate
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date on which the mine commenced operation.

FeatureAttribute.name: mineName
FeatureAttribute.definition: Data type indicating the Mine Name and whether it is the preferred name.

FeatureAttribute.name: sourceReference
FeatureAttribute.definition: The source reference for the mine.
FeatureAttribute.description: Allows citing mine plans etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: status
FeatureAttribute.definition: Operational status value of the mine.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: Care & Maintenance; Pending Approval; Operating continually.

RelationshipRole.name: relatedMine
RelationshipRole.definition: A related mine.
RelationshipRole.description: A mine currently exploited may result from the resumption and the extension of a – or several – former or older (abandoned) mine(s). Mines need not aggregate to form other mines, they may just be associated in some way or another (eg the Kalgoorlie SuperPit is associated with its preceding mines).

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31626
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureAttribute.name: endDate
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date on which the mine ceased operation.

FeatureType.name: Commodity
FeatureType.definition: The material of economic interest in the EarthResource

RelationshipRole.name: source
RelationshipRole.definition: The deposit/resource from which the commodity comes.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31636
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureAttribute.name: commodity
FeatureAttribute.definition: The earth resource commodity.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: Cu, Au, Dimension Stone etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: commodityImportance
FeatureAttribute.definition: The importance of the deposit for the commodity.
FeatureAttribute.description: Several commodities may be of interest inside a deposit. A deposit may be a very large deposit for one commodity (this commodity is the main one) and only a medium-sized deposit for some other commodities. Such a ranking is based on a statistical study of a large set of deposits throughout the world to ensure that it is valid. It is made using histograms allowing for each commodity to define class boundaries and what is a super large, a large, a medium-sized etc deposit for this commodity. This classification is based on the potential or endowment: reserves + resources.

FeatureAttribute.name: commodityRank
FeatureAttribute.definition: The rank of the commodity.
FeatureAttribute.description: Commodity rank is based on endowment, i.e. (cumulated) past production + reserves (not including past production) + resources, or if the deposit has never been exploited, reserves + resources. A statistical comparison with a large set of deposits throughout the world enables the determination of the deposit as class A (very large), B (large), or C (medium-sized) for a particular commodity, and also which commodity is the main one, the 2nd one, etc. The rank of a commodity is thus not based on political or economic considerations.

FeatureType.name: MiningFeatureOccurrence
FeatureType.definition: A spatial representation of a MiningFeature.
FeatureType.description: A MiningFeatureOccurrence provides a link between a notional feature (description package) and one spatial representation of it, or part of it. The MiningFeatureOccurrence carries a geometry and the association with a Mining Feature provides specification of all the other descriptors.

FeatureAttribute.name: shape
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry of the MiningFeature.

RelationshipRole.name: specification
RelationshipRole.definition: Indicates the MiningFeature that the MiningFeatureOccurrence specifies.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31630
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: EarthResource
FeatureType.definition: The kinds of observable or inferred phenomena required to classify economic and non-economic earth resources.
FeatureType.description: This corresponds with a "legend item" from a traditional geologic map. While the bounding coordinates of a Geologic Feature may be described, its shape is not.
The implemented Geologic Feature instance acts as the "description package"
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanversion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

RelationshipRole.name: resourceExtraction
RelationshipRole.definition: One or more periods of mining activity of the earth resource.
RelationshipRole.description: Indicates if this resource is the subject of exploitation, and if so of which type. Depending on several factors (type of mineralization, size, grade, shape, depth, etc.) one or several (combined) methods may be used, including off site methods, surface mining (among which methods related to the exploitation of alluvial/elluvial deposits), underground mining. Knowledge about these methods is important as it may be strongly related to the quantity and type of wastes and environmental impacts generated by the extraction.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31646
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: commodityDescription
RelationshipRole.definition: The commodities present in the resource ranked by importance order.
RelationshipRole.description: Determining the rank of a commodity is not as simple as it may look: not only the tonnage (expressed in tons of metal) has to be taken into account, but also the scarcity and thus the price of the commodity. A deposit containing 500,000 t Cu and only 50 t Au will be classified as an Au-(Cu) deposit.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31637
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: explorationHistory
RelationshipRole.definition: Chronological list of surveys undertaken to better define the potential of a mineral occurrence.
RelationshipRole.description: Recaps the work which has been done from regional reconnaissance, surface detailed prospecting, subsurface prospecting, assessment of the resource, to evaluation of the ore deposit. Depending on the work done on occurrences and prospects, allows an estimate of the 'still to be discovered' potential of an area. A detailed assessment with no result would lead to a pessimistic opinion.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31638
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureAttribute.name: sourceReference
FeatureAttribute.definition: The source or reference for the Earth Resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: dimension
FeatureAttribute.definition: The size/volume of the earth resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: expression
FeatureAttribute.definition: An indicator of whether an EarthResource appears on the surface or has been detected under cover rocks.

FeatureAttribute.name: form
FeatureAttribute.definition: The orebody's typical physical and structural relationship to wallrocks and associated rocks.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: stratiform, stratabound, cross-cutting, vein, intrusive contact etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: linearOrientation
FeatureAttribute.definition: The linear orientation of the Earth Resource.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: Plunge etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: planarOrientation
FeatureAttribute.definition: The planar orientation of the Earth Resource.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: Dip/Dip Direction etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: shape
FeatureAttribute.definition: The typical geometrical shape of the Earth Resource.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: lenticular, pipelike, irregular etc.

RelationshipRole.name: classification
RelationshipRole.definition: Classification of the EarthResource.
RelationshipRole.description: Systematically arranged information describing the essential attributes of a class of mineral deposits. May be empirical (descriptive) or theoretical (genetic).

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31642
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: oreAmount
RelationshipRole.definition: The estimated or calculated amount of ore with the identification of the commodities contained and their grade.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31635
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: Endowment
FeatureType.definition: The quantity of a mineral (or a group of minerals for industrial rocks) in accumulations (deposits) meeting specified physical characteristics such as quality, size and depth.
FeatureType.description: Usually includes Resources, as unlike the latter, it does not have to have prospects for "eventual economic extraction". It often includes the total amount of a commodity originally introduced to a particular location during the deposit forming processes - and thus can include resources, reserves, past production and mining and metallurgical losses.

FeatureAttribute.name: includesReserves
FeatureAttribute.definition: A flag indicating if the estimate includes the reserves value.

FeatureAttribute.name: includesResources
FeatureAttribute.definition: A flag indicating if the estimate includes the resources value.

FeatureType.name: MiningFeature
FeatureType.definition: Spatial object type grouping the common properties of mines and mining activities.
FeatureType.description: This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

FeatureType.name: Reserve
FeatureType.definition: The economically mineable part of a Measured and/or Indicated Mineral Resource.
FeatureType.description: It includes diluting materials and allowances for losses, which may occur when the material is mined. ‘Marketable Coal Reserves’ maybe reported in conjunction with, but not instead of, reports of Ore (Coal) Reserves. ‘Saleable product’ (e.g. for industrial minerals) can be reported in conjunction with ore reserve.

Synonyms: Ore Reserve; Coal Reserve (s); Diamond (or gemstone) Ore Reserve; Mineral Reserves (not preferred, should be stated that used to mean the same as JORC’s Ore Reserve); Mineable production estimates

FeatureAttribute.name: category
FeatureAttribute.definition: The level of confidence of the estimate (proved, probable).

FeatureType.name: MineralOccurrence
FeatureType.definition: <font color="#400040">A mineral accumulation in the lithosphere. </font>

FeatureAttribute.name: type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of mineral occurrence.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: prospect, occurrence, mineral deposit, ore deposit.

FeatureAttribute.name: endusePotential
FeatureAttribute.definition: The end-use potential of the mineral.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: for energy, fertilizer, building raw material.

FeatureType.name: MiningActivity
FeatureType.definition: The process of extracting metallic, non-metallic mineral, or industrial rock deposits from the Earth.
FeatureType.description: The term may also include preliminary treatment eg. cleaning or sizing.

FeatureAttribute.name: processingType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of processing carried out during the mining activity.

RelationshipRole.name: associatedMine
RelationshipRole.definition: The mine where the mining activity takes, or took, place.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31647
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: deposit
RelationshipRole.definition: The deposit to which the mining activity is associated.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31648
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureAttribute.name: activityDuration
FeatureAttribute.definition: Period, or extent in time, of the mining activity.
FeatureAttribute.description: The beginning of the activity links the TM_Period to the TM_Instant at which it starts. The ending links the TM_Period to the TM_Instant at which it ends. For a variety of reasons, the position of the TM_Instant designated by 'begin' or 'end' may be inderterminate.

FeatureAttribute.name: activityType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of mining activity.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: Open Pit, Underground Mine, multiple, unspecified) or processing activity (eg Ore Processing) or production.

Using activity to distinguish between the extraction, processing and production activities allows distinguishing between ore mined/grade/recovery, ore treated/grade/recovery and produced payable/plant recovery.

FeatureAttribute.name: oreProcessed
FeatureAttribute.definition: The amount of ore processed by the activity.

FeatureType.name: CommodityMeasure
FeatureType.definition: A measure of the amount of the commodity based on a Reserve, Resource or Endowment calculation.
FeatureType.description: Where OreMeasure is Resource or Reserve CommodityMeasure is mandatory

FeatureAttribute.name: commodityAmount
FeatureAttribute.definition: The amount of the commodity.

FeatureAttribute.name: cutOffGrade
FeatureAttribute.definition: The cut off grade used for calculating the commodity measure.
FeatureAttribute.description: The lowest concentration of a mineralized material that qualifies as ore in a given deposit (adapted from Neuendorf, 2005).

FeatureAttribute.name: grade
FeatureAttribute.definition: The grade of the commodity.

RelationshipRole.name: commodityOfInterest
RelationshipRole.definition: The commodity to which the CommodityMeasure refers.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31640
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: Resource
FeatureType.definition: An accumulation of material of intrinsic economic interest in or on the Earth’s crust in such form, quality and quantity that there are reasonable prospects for economic extraction.
FeatureType.description: Synonyms: Mineral Resource; Coal Resource (s); Diamond (Gemstone) Resource; Potentially Mineable Mineralisation.

FeatureAttribute.name: category
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indication of whether the resource is measured, indicated, or inferred.

FeatureAttribute.name: includesReserves
FeatureAttribute.definition: A flag indicating whether the estimate of resources includes reserve values.

FeatureType.name: MineName
FeatureType.definition: A data type indicating the Mine Name and whether it is the preferred name.

FeatureAttribute.name: isPreferred
FeatureAttribute.definition: A boolean operator indicating if the value in mineName is the preferred name of the mine.

FeatureAttribute.name: mineName
FeatureAttribute.definition: The name of the mine.

FeatureType.name: ExplorationActivity
FeatureType.definition: A period of exploration activity.

FeatureAttribute.name: activityDuration
FeatureAttribute.definition: Period, or extent in time, of the exploration activity.
FeatureAttribute.description: The beginning of the activity links the TM_Period to the TM_Instant at which it starts. The ending links the TM_Period to the TM_Instant at which it ends. For a variety of reasons, the position of the TM_Instant designated by 'begin' or 'end' may be inderterminate.

FeatureAttribute.name: activityType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of exploration activity.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: geological mapping, drilling, geophysical surveys, geochemical mapping, etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: explorationResult
FeatureAttribute.definition: The result of the exploration activity.

FeatureType.name: OreMeasure
FeatureType.definition: The estimate of the Reserve, Resource or Endowment ore amount.
FeatureType.description: This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: classificationMethodUsed
FeatureAttribute.definition: Means of calculating the measurement.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: JORC, PERC, Unspecified, UNESCO/World Bank and the Canadian CIM.

FeatureAttribute.name: date
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date of calculated or estimated value.
FeatureAttribute.description: This may be a single date or a range.

FeatureAttribute.name: dimension
FeatureAttribute.definition: Size of the body used in the calculation.

FeatureAttribute.name: proposedExtractionMethod
FeatureAttribute.definition: The method proposed to extract the commodity.

FeatureAttribute.name: sourceReference
FeatureAttribute.definition: The reference for the OreMeasure values.

FeatureAttribute.name: ore
FeatureAttribute.definition: Amount of ore.

RelationshipRole.name: measureDetails
RelationshipRole.definition: A measure of the amount of each commodity, based on a reserve, resource or endowment calculation.
RelationshipRole.description: This measure is obtained by multiplying the ore tonnage by the average grade of the commodity within the ore (generally expressed in tons of metal).

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31641
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: EarthResourceDimension
FeatureType.definition: The size and volume of the earth resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: area
FeatureAttribute.definition: The area of the Earth Resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: depth
FeatureAttribute.definition: The depth of the Earth Resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: length
FeatureAttribute.definition: The length of the Earth Resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: width
FeatureAttribute.definition: The width of the Earth Resource.

FeatureType.name: MineralDepositModel
FeatureType.definition: Systematically arranged information describing the essential attributes of a class of mineral deposits. It may be empirical (descriptive) or theoretical (genetic).

FeatureAttribute.name: mineralDepositGroup
FeatureAttribute.definition: A grouping of mineral deposits defined by generic characteristics
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: host rock, host structure, commodity, association with similar mineral processes e.g. porphyry. Regional, national and more universal lists e.g. Cox and Singer 1986.

FeatureAttribute.name: mineralDepositType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Style of mineral occurrence or deposit.
FeatureAttribute.description: Generally a local or regional term. Should be referenced for definitions and descriptions. Single deposit terms may form member of a Mineral Deposit Group in local and regional schemas.

ApplicationSchema.name: NUTS
ApplicationSchema.definition: Example of INSPIRE compliant view of the NUTS model (produced by Eurostat).

FeatureType.name: NUTSTessellation
FeatureType.title: NUTS tesselation
FeatureType.definition: A statistical tessellation composed of NUTS regions.
FeatureType.description: NOTE level attribute values should be among the NUTSHierarchy CodeList.

FeatureAttribute.name: level
FeatureAttribute.title: Level
FeatureAttribute.definition: The level in the hierarchy.

RelationshipRole.name: units
RelationshipRole.definition: The units composing a tesselation.

RelationshipRole.name: tessellation
RelationshipRole.definition: The tesselation composed of units.

FeatureType.name: NUTSRegion
FeatureType.title: NUTS region
FeatureType.definition: Territorial unit for statistics defined in the framework of the Regulation (EC) No 1059/2003 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 May 2003.
FeatureType.description: NOTE NUTS regions subdivide each Member State into a whole number of territorial units for statistic at NUTS1 level. Each of these is then subdivided into regions at NUTS2 level and these in turn into regions at NUTS3 level.

FeatureType.name: ObservedEventCoverage
FeatureType.definition: A coverage representing continuous information about observed events.

FeatureType.name: HazardArea
FeatureType.definition: Discrete spatial objects representing a natural hazard.
FeatureType.description: A natural hazard is a natural process or phenomenon that may cause loss of life, injury or other impacts, property damage, loss livelihoods and services, social and economic disruption, or environmental damage. [Council of The European Union - Commission Staff Working Paper - Risk Assessment and Mapping Guidelines for Disaster Management].

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometric representation of spatial extent covered by the hazard area.

FeatureAttribute.name: likelihoodOfOccurrence
FeatureAttribute.definition: Likelihood is a general concept relating to the chance of an event occuring.

FeatureAttribute.name: magnitudeOrIntensity
FeatureAttribute.definition: An expression of the magnitude or the intensity of a phenomenon.
FeatureAttribute.description: It may address a value within the Richter scale, or a description of the european macro-seismic scale, or a flood flow, etc...

FeatureType.name: ObservedEvent
FeatureType.definition: Discrete spatial objects representing natural phenomenon relevant to the study of natural hazards which occurred, or is currently occuring, and which has been observed.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometric representation of the spatial extent covered by the observed event.

FeatureAttribute.name: magnitudeOrIntensity
FeatureAttribute.definition: An expression of the magnitude or the intensity of a phenomenon.

FeatureType.name: HazardCoverage
FeatureType.definition: A coverage representing continuous information about a type of natural hazard.
FeatureType.description: A natural hazard is a natural process or phenomenon that may cause loss of life, injury or other impacts, property damage, loss livelihoods and services, social and economic disruption, or environmental damage. [Council of The European Union - Commission Staff Working Paper - Risk Assessment and Mapping Guidelines for Disaster Management].

FeatureType.name: RiskZone
FeatureType.definition: Discrete spatial objects representing the spatial extent of a combination of the consequences of an event (hazard) and the associated probability/likelihood of its occurrence.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometric representation of spatial extent covered by this risk zone.

FeatureAttribute.name: levelOfRisk
FeatureAttribute.definition: The level of risk is an assessment of the combination of the consequences of an event (hazard) and the associated probability/likelihood of the occurrence of the event.

FeatureType.name: LikelihoodOfOccurrence
FeatureType.definition: Likelihood is a general concept relating to the chance of an event occurring.
FeatureType.description: Likelihood is generally expressed as a probability or a frequency. [EXCIFF].

FeatureAttribute.name: qualitativeLikelihood
FeatureAttribute.definition: A qualitative assessment of the likelihood of occurrence of a hazard.
FeatureAttribute.description: Sometimes, this is known as susceptibility.

FeatureAttribute.name: quantitativeLikelihood
FeatureAttribute.definition: A frequency of occurence or return period of a hazard phenomenon.
FeatureAttribute.description: Sometimes, this is known as susceptibility.

FeatureAttribute.name: assessmentMethod
FeatureAttribute.definition: A citation to the method used to express the likelihood.

FeatureType.name: RiskCoverage
FeatureType.definition: A coverage representation of natural risks.

FeatureType.name: VulnerabilityAssessment
FeatureType.definition: Assessment of the vulnerability.
FeatureType.description: It contains piece of information about the source the vulnerability, about the level of vulnerability and about the magnitude or intensity of the hazard for which vulnerability is assessed.

FeatureAttribute.name: sourceOfVulnerability
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of hazard for which the vulnerability is assessed.

FeatureAttribute.name: levelOfVulnerability
FeatureAttribute.definition: Level of vulnerability.
FeatureAttribute.description: When assessed quantitatively, it is a percentage.

FeatureAttribute.name: magnitudeOrIntensityOfHazard
FeatureAttribute.definition: An expression of the magnitude or the intensity of a phenomenon.
FeatureAttribute.description: It may address a value within the Richter scale, or a description of the european macro-seismic scale, or a flood flow, etc...

FeatureAttribute.name: typeOfElement
FeatureAttribute.definition: A classification of the exposed element.

FeatureType.name: AbstractExposedElement
FeatureType.definition: SOURCE : [UNISDR, 2009]
People, property, systems, or other elements present in hazard zones that are thereby subject to potential losses.
FeatureType.description: This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the exposed element.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the exposed element started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the exposed element no longer exists in the real world.

RelationshipRole.name: sourceOfSpatialRepresentation
RelationshipRole.definition: The source object which is used to represent the exposed element.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S33316
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: AbstractRiskZone
FeatureType.definition: A risk zone is the spatial extent of a combination of the consequences of an event (hazard) and the associated probability/likelihood of its occurrence.
FeatureType.description: This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: sourceOfRisk
FeatureAttribute.definition: A generic classification and a specific classification of the type of hazard which is the source of risk.

FeatureAttribute.name: validityPeriod
FeatureAttribute.definition: Future finite time frame where the model applies.
FeatureAttribute.description: It is an interval of dates, or the expression of a time frame for which the estimates are meant (eg: until 2090; summer of 2011; winter seasons until 2015).

RelationshipRole.name: exposedElement
RelationshipRole.definition: The element that is within a hazardous area.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31603
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: source
RelationshipRole.definition: The hazard which is considered for the creation of the risk zone object.

RelationshipRole.name: role_T31610
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: ExposedElement
FeatureType.definition: Discrete spatial objects representing exposed element.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometric representation of the exposed element.
FeatureAttribute.description: If the feature is linked to a spatially referenced INSPIRE feature, then it has no geometry. If not, then it has a geometry.

FeatureAttribute.name: assessmentOfVulnerability
FeatureAttribute.definition: Assessment of the vulnerability of the exposed element.

FeatureType.name: NaturalHazardClassification
FeatureType.definition: This class provides piece of information about the nature of the natural hazard as well as the type of hazard which is the source of risk.

FeatureAttribute.name: hazardCategory
FeatureAttribute.definition: A generic classification of types of natural hazards or risks.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificHazardType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Additional classification of the natural hazard that further specifies the hazard type according to a nomenclature that is specific to this dataset.

FeatureType.name: ExposedElementCoverage
FeatureType.definition: A coverage representating continuous information about exposed elements.

FeatureAttribute.name: typeOfElement
FeatureAttribute.definition: A classification of the exposed element.

FeatureType.name: AbstractObservedEvent
FeatureType.definition: A natural phenomenon relevant to the study of natural hazards which occurred and which has been observed.
FeatureType.description: This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: nameOfEvent
FeatureAttribute.definition: common name of the observed event.

FeatureAttribute.name: typeOfHazard
FeatureAttribute.definition: A generic classification and a specific classification of the type of hazard.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the observed event started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the observed event no longer exists in the real world.

RelationshipRole.name: isMonitoredBy
RelationshipRole.definition: The program that monitors the observed event.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31795
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: LevelOrIntensity
FeatureType.definition: Quantitative or qualitative assessment of either risk, hazard or vulnerability.
FeatureType.description: Common concept for assessing the level of risk, or the level of hazard, or the level of vulnerability.

FeatureAttribute.name: qualitativeValue
FeatureAttribute.definition: A qualitative assessment of the level or intensity.

FeatureAttribute.name: quantitativeValue
FeatureAttribute.definition: A quantitative assessment of the level or intensity.

FeatureAttribute.name: assessmentMethod
FeatureAttribute.definition: A citation to the method used to express the level or intensity.

FeatureType.name: AbstractHazardArea
FeatureType.definition: An area affected by a natural hazard.
FeatureType.description: A natural hazard is a natural process or phenomenon that may cause loss of life, injury or other impacts, property damage, loss livelihoods and services, social and economic disruption, or environmental damage. [Council of The European Union - Commission Staff Working Paper - Risk Assessment and Mapping Guidelines for Disaster Management].
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: determinationMethod
FeatureAttribute.definition: Specifies if the hazard area result is delineated after modelling or determined after interpretation.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the hazard area.

FeatureAttribute.name: typeOfHazard
FeatureAttribute.definition: A generic classification and a specific classification of the type of natural hazard.

FeatureAttribute.name: validityPeriod
FeatureAttribute.definition: Future finite time frame where the hazard applies.
FeatureAttribute.description: It is an interval of dates, or the expression of a time frame for which the estimates are meant (eg: until 2090; summer of 2011; winter seasons until 2015).

RelationshipRole.name: source
RelationshipRole.definition: The observed event that triggered the modelling of a hazard area.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31614
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: ExposedElementClassification
FeatureType.definition: This class provides piece of information about the nature of the exposed element which is relevant to risk analysis.

FeatureAttribute.name: exposedElementCategory
FeatureAttribute.definition: A generic classification of the types of elements that are exposed to a risk.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificExposedElementType
FeatureAttribute.definition: An additional denomination of exposed element according to a nomenclature that is specific to this dataset.

FeatureType.name: QuantitativeLikelihood
FeatureType.definition: A frequency of occurrence or return period of a hazard phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: probabilityOfOccurrence
FeatureAttribute.definition: The probability of occurrence of a hazard event, expressed as a value between 0 and 1.
FeatureAttribute.description: This is the inverse value of the return period.

FeatureAttribute.name: returnPeriod
FeatureAttribute.definition: Long-term average interval of time or number of years within which an event will be equalled or exceeded [UNESCO].

FeatureType.name: ObservableProperty
FeatureType.title: Observable Property
FeatureType.definition: Represents a single observable property e.g. 'temperature'.
FeatureType.description: The Observable Property represents a single observable property e.g. 'temperature'. It may have associations to additional constraints or measures that make it more complex e.g. 'daily mean temperature'.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31314
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureAttribute.name: basePhenomenon
FeatureAttribute.definition: The phenomenon that the Observable Property description builds upon.
FeatureAttribute.description: The phenomenon that the Observable Property description builds upon. e.g. if the Observable property describes 'monthly minimum temperature' then the basePhenomenon should reference the vocabulary term 'temperature'.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31320
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: AbstractObservableProperty
FeatureType.title: Abstract Observable Property
FeatureType.definition: An abstract class that represents an observable property (or phenomenon).
FeatureType.description: An abstract class that represents an observable property (or phenomenon). This class is intended to be used in the context of ISO 19156 'observedProperty' role but may be used in other contexts.
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: label
FeatureAttribute.definition: A human readable title for the observable property

FeatureType.name: RangeBounds
FeatureType.title: Range Bounds
FeatureType.definition: The start and end bounding values of a numerical range (e.g. start >=50, end <=99)

FeatureAttribute.name: startComparison
FeatureAttribute.definition: The comparator used for the lower range limit (e.g. greaterThanOrEqualTo)

FeatureAttribute.name: rangeStart
FeatureAttribute.definition: The lower limit of the range.

FeatureAttribute.name: endComparison
FeatureAttribute.definition: The comparator used for the upper range limit (e.g. lessThan)

FeatureAttribute.name: rangeEnd
FeatureAttribute.definition: The upper limit of the range.

FeatureType.name: CompositeObservableProperty
FeatureType.title: Composite Observable Property
FeatureType.definition: A composite of mulitple Observable Properties.
FeatureType.description: A composite of multiple Observable Properties, for example U,V winds.
There is no requirement that the observable properties in the composite are related to each other.
A composite observable property may have components which are observabel properties or other composite observable properties.

FeatureAttribute.name: count
FeatureAttribute.definition: Number of components in this composite

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31319
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: StatisticalMeasure
FeatureType.title: Statistical Measure
FeatureType.definition: A descripton of some statistical measure e.g. "daily maximum"
FeatureType.description: A descripton of some statistical measure e.g. "daily maximum"
The measure is usually some function over some time (e.g. an hour, a day) or space (e.g. a length, area or volume)
Other aggregation types can be supported via the 'otherAggregation' extension point.

RelationshipRole.name: derivedFrom
RelationshipRole.title: derived from
RelationshipRole.definition: One statistical measure may be derived from another. e.g. Monthly Maximum temperatures may be derived from Daily Mean temperatures.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31321
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureAttribute.name: statisticalFunction
FeatureAttribute.definition: A statistical function e.g. (mean)

FeatureAttribute.name: aggregationTimePeriod
FeatureAttribute.definition: A temporal range over which a statistic is calculated. e.g. A day, An hour.

FeatureAttribute.name: aggregationLength
FeatureAttribute.definition: A one dimensional spatial range over which a statistic is calculated for example 1 metre.

FeatureAttribute.name: aggregationArea
FeatureAttribute.definition: A two dimensional spatial range over which a statistic is calculated for example 1 square metre

FeatureAttribute.name: aggregationVolume
FeatureAttribute.definition: A three dimensional spatial range over which a statistic is calculated for example 1 cubic metre

FeatureAttribute.name: otherAggregation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Any other type of aggregation.

FeatureAttribute.name: label
FeatureAttribute.definition: A human readable title for the statistical measure

FeatureType.name: OtherConstraint
FeatureType.title: Other Constraint
FeatureType.definition: A constraint, not modelled in a structured way, but may be described using the freetext 'description' attribute.
FeatureType.description: A constraint on some property e.g. wavelength = 200nm. This property is typically not the same property as the base phenomenon of the observed property. e.g.
the observed property has a base phenomenon 'radiance'.
a constraint is added to say 'wavelength = 200nm'
So the overall ObservableProperty which is represented is 'radiance where wavelength = 200nm'
The Constraint class is specialised into several specific classes covering Scalar, Range and Categorical constraints

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.definition: A description of the constraint.

FeatureType.name: ScalarConstraint
FeatureType.title: Scalar Constraint
FeatureType.definition: A numerical scalar constraint on some property e.g. length >= 1m
FeatureType.description: A scalar constraint on some property e.g. length >= 1m

FeatureAttribute.name: value
FeatureAttribute.definition: The numerical value of the property that is constrained

FeatureAttribute.name: comparison
FeatureAttribute.definition: The comparator to be used in the constraint e.g. greaterThan

FeatureAttribute.name: uom
FeatureAttribute.definition: Units of measure used in the constraint

FeatureType.name: Constraint
FeatureType.definition: A constraint on some property e.g. wavelength = 200nm.
FeatureType.description: A constraint on some property e.g. wavelength = 200nm. This property is typically not the same property as the base phenomenon of the observed property. e.g.
the observed property has a base phenomenon 'radiance'.
a constraint is added to say 'wavelength = 200nm'
So the overall ObservableProperty which is represented is 'radiance where wavelength = 200nm'
The Constraint class is specialised into several specific classes covering Scalar, Range and Categorical constraints

FeatureAttribute.name: constrainedProperty
FeatureAttribute.definition: The property being constrained. e.g. 'colour' if the constraint is 'colour = blue'

FeatureAttribute.name: label
FeatureAttribute.title: description
FeatureAttribute.definition: A human readable title for the constraint as a whole

FeatureType.name: RangeConstraint
FeatureType.title: Range Constraint
FeatureType.definition: A numerical range constraint on some property e.g. wavelength >=300nm and wavelength <=600nm
FeatureType.description: A numerical range constraint on some property e.g. wavelength >=300nm and wavelength <=600nm
e.g. To be used when data is observed in particular bands or groupings based on a numerical quantity.

FeatureAttribute.name: value
FeatureAttribute.definition: The numerical value range of the property that is constrained

FeatureAttribute.name: uom
FeatureAttribute.definition: Units of measure used in the constraint

FeatureType.name: CategoryConstraint
FeatureType.title: Category Constraint
FeatureType.definition: A constraint based on some qualifying category. e..g colour = 'Red'.
FeatureType.description: A constraint based on some qualifying category. e..g colour = 'Red'.
The value ('Red') of the constraint ('colour') can be any string, although it may be desirable to constrain this in particular application domains.

FeatureAttribute.name: comparison
FeatureAttribute.definition: A comparison operator. In the case of a category constraint it should be 'equalTo' or 'notEqualTo'.

FeatureAttribute.name: value
FeatureAttribute.definition: The value of the property that is constrained e.g. 'blue' (if the constrained property is colour)

FeatureType.name: ObservationSet
FeatureType.definition: Links a set of Observations
FeatureType.description: This class is used to link multiple related Observations together

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: Information about the spatial and temporal extent.

RelationshipRole.name: member
RelationshipRole.definition: One member of the ObservationSet

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32851
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: OilGasChemicalsPipe
FeatureType.title: oil, gas and chemicals pipe
FeatureType.definition: A pipe used to convey oil, gas or chemicals from one location to another.

FeatureAttribute.name: oilGasChemicalsProductType
FeatureAttribute.title: oil, gas and chemicals product type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of oil, gas or chemicals product that is conveyed through the oil, gas, chemicals pipe.

FeatureType.name: AggregatedMosaicElement
FeatureType.title: aggregated mosaic element
FeatureType.definition: Mosaic element relating to several input images that share the same acquisition time at a given level of definition (e.g. day, month).
FeatureType.description: NOTE The geometry of an aggregated mosaic element corresponds to the union of the contributing areas, in the mosaic, of several input images.

FeatureType.name: SingleMosaicElement
FeatureType.title: single mosaic element
FeatureType.definition: Mosaic element relating to a single input image.
FeatureType.description: NOTE The geometry of a single mosaic element corresponds exactly to the contributing area, in the mosaic, of the single input image.

FeatureAttribute.name: imageSourceReference
FeatureAttribute.title: image source reference
FeatureAttribute.definition: Reference to the input image.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE 1 There is no restriction on the nature of the input image. It can be raw or pre-processed or orthorectified, for instance.
NOTE 2 modelling and delivery of input images lie outside the scope of the present specification.
NOTE 3 Identifiers of the input images should be URIs in the “http” scheme (See D2.7) though full national or local codes are allowed.
EXAMPLE: http://land.data.gov.uk/id/imagery/2011-5864726.

FeatureType.name: OrthoimageAggregation
FeatureType.title: orthoimage aggregation
FeatureType.definition: Geometrical characteristics of the orthoimage aggregation.

FeatureAttribute.name: contributingFootprint
FeatureAttribute.title: contributing footprint
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometric representation delineating the geographic area of an orthoimage coverage that contributes to the aggregated orthoimage coverage.

FeatureType.name: OrthoimageCoverage
FeatureType.title: orthoimage coverage
FeatureType.definition: Raster image of the Earth surface that has been geometrically corrected ("orthorectified") to remove distortion caused by differences in elevation, sensor tilt and, optionally, by sensor optics.
FeatureType.description: NOTE 1 An orthoimage coverage is a continuous coverage based on a rectified quadrilateral grid. It is provided with an interpolation method to evaluate value records at any direct position within its domain.
NOTE 2 An orthoimage coverage can be derived from one single input image or from different input images which have been mosaicked and merged together.

NOTE 3 An orthoimage coverage may be an aggregation of subsets extracted from other orthoimage coverages. For the avoidance of data duplication, this kind of aggregated orthoimage is dynamically constructed thanks to references to the contributing orthoimage coverages .

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.title: inspire identifier
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: domainExtent
FeatureAttribute.title: domain extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: Extent of the spatiotemporal domain of the coverage.
FeatureAttribute.description: SOURCE [ISO 19123]
NOTE 1 The data type EX_Extent is defined in ISO 19103. Extents may be specified in both space and time.

NOTE 2 The domain extent shall be specified in space at least by using a subtype of EX_GeographicExtent (EX_BoundingPolygon, EX_GeographicBoundingBox or EX_GeographicDescription). The whole geographic extent of the orthoimage coverage is affected, including areas where grid points hold nil reason values.

FeatureAttribute.name: footprint
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geographic area enclosing valid data of the orthoimage coverage.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE 1 The footprint shall be enclosed in the geographic domain extent that it refines.
NOTE 2 This property is mandatory if the OrthoimageCoverage instance is an aggregation of other OrthoimageCoverage instances or if mosaic elements are provided.

FeatureAttribute.name: interpolationType
FeatureAttribute.title: interpolation type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Mathematical method which shall be used to evaluate a continuous coverage, i.e. determine the values of the coverage at any direct position within the domain of the coverage.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE 1 Nearestneighbor is set as a default value in case where this information is omitted by data producers.
NOTE 2 A continuous grid coverage that uses nearest neighbour interpolation acts as a discrete surface coverage.
This attribute is initialised with the value nearestneighbor.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Free text name of the orthoimage coverage.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE This field is intended to hold a name that a data provider may use in addition to the inspire identifier

EXAMPLE 1 "Orthofoto's, middenschalig, kleur, provincie Limburg, opname 2011" is the name used by the Flemish Geographic Information Agency (AGIV) to indicate the OrthoImageCoverage Instance holding the orthophotomosaic covering the administrative unit 'provincie Limburg' at a resolution of 25 cm 'middenschalig' acquired in the year 2011 'opname 2011'

EXAMPLE 2 "BDOrtho coverage on Savoie at 50 cm - 2011" could be the name of an OrthoimageCoverage instance corresponding to a subset of the BDOrtho product of IGN France, the orthophoto of the "department" Savoie (an administrative unit) at a resolution of 50 cm.

FeatureAttribute.name: phenomenonTime
FeatureAttribute.title: phenomenon time
FeatureAttribute.definition: Description of the observation/acquisition extent in time.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE 1 This temporal extent refers to the range in time in which the image(s) contributing to the orthoImage coverage has/have been acquired.
NOTE 2 When the acquisition is considered as instantaneous, despite the exposure time, the end date and time can be identical to the begin date and time.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: begin lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Temporal position at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Since this information is not always automatically recorded by a system, but can be captured manually, the provision of the time is not required here. That is the reason why TM_Position was chosen as value type instead of DateTime, which is, however, commonly used in other INSPIRE data specifications.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: end lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Temporal position at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired from the spatial data set.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Since this information is not always automatically recorded by a system, but can be captured manually, the provision of the time is not required here. That is the reason why TM_Position was chosen as value type instead of DateTime, which is, however, commonly used in other INSPIRE data specifications.

RelationshipRole.name: mosaicElement
