RelationshipRole.definition: Spatial representation of the acquisition time of a mosaicked orthoimage coverage.
RelationshipRole.description: NOTE This association shall be used only when the orthoimage coverage is a mosaic.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32136
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: contributingOrthoimageCoverage
RelationshipRole.definition: Reference to the orthoimage coverages that compose an aggregated orthoimage coverage.

RelationshipRole.name: role_T32135
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: MosaicElement
FeatureType.title: mosaic element
FeatureType.definition: Abstract type identifying both the contributing area and the acquisition time of one or several input images used to generate a mosaicked orthoimage coverage.
FeatureType.description: NOTE The main purpose of this feature type is the provision of a mechanism for describing the spatial distribution of the acquisition dates and times over a mosaicked orthoimage. The acquisition time can be supplied either for each individual input image, or for sets of input images grouped together according to temporal criteria.
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.title: inspire identifier
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE 1 An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.
NOTE 2 This property should be used to reference indirect MosaicElement instances from Orthoimage instances unambiguously.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometric representation spatially delineating the date and time of acquisition of the several input images that contribute to the final mosaic.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The boundaries of the geometries are commonly based on the seamlines used for the mosaicking process.

FeatureAttribute.name: phenomenonTime
FeatureAttribute.title: phenomenon time
FeatureAttribute.definition: Description of the observation/acquisition extent in time of the input image(s).
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE 1 This temporal extent refers to the interval of time in wich the input image(s) was/were acquired by the sensor.
NOTE 2 When the acquisition is considered as instantaneous, despite the exposure time, the end date and time can be identical to the begin date and time.

FeatureType.name: DimensioningIndicationIntegerValue
FeatureType.title: dimension indication integer value
FeatureType.definition: Dimensioning indication whose value is of type integer.

FeatureType.name: DimensioningIndicationMeasureValue
FeatureType.title: dimension indication measure value
FeatureType.definition: Dimensioning indication whose value is a measure.

FeatureType.name: DimensioningIndicationCharacterValue
FeatureType.title: dimension indication character value
FeatureType.definition: Dimensioning indication whose value is of type CharacterString.

FeatureAttribute.name: value
FeatureAttribute.definition: value of the dimension indications.

FeatureType.name: DimensioningIndicationRealValue
FeatureType.title: dimension indication real value
FeatureType.definition: Dimensioning indication whose value is a floating point number.

FeatureType.name: SupplementaryRegulation
FeatureType.title: supplementary regulation
FeatureType.definition: A spatial object (point, line or polygon) of a spatial plan that provides supplementary information and/or limitation of the use of land/water necessary for spatial planning reasons or to formalise external rules defined in legal text.
FeatureType.description: NOTE the supplementary regulations affects all land use that overlap with the geometry

EXAMPLE an air field generates restriction in its surroundings regarding aircraft landing, radar and telecommunication devices. It is the buffer around these artefacts that generates the supplementary regulation on the Land Use.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: First date at which this version of this supplementary regulation is valid in reality.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the supplementary regulation is no longer valid.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificSupplementaryRegulation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Reference to a category of supplementary regulation provided in a specific nomenclature of supplementary regulations provided by the data provider.

FeatureAttribute.name: processStepGeneral
FeatureAttribute.definition: General indication of the step of the planning process that the supplementary regulation is undergoing.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE This enumeration contains values that are common to most planning systems.

FeatureAttribute.name: backgroundMap
FeatureAttribute.title: background map
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identification of the background map that has been used for constructing the supplementary regulation.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: dimensioningIndication
FeatureAttribute.definition: Specifications about the dimensioning that are added to the dimensioning of the zoning elements that overlap the geometry of the supplementary regulation.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometry of the piece of land on which the supplementary regulation applies.

FeatureAttribute.name: inheritedFromOtherPlans
FeatureAttribute.title: inherited from other plans
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indication whether the supplementary regulation is inherited from another spatial plan.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificRegulationNature
FeatureAttribute.title: specific regulation nature
FeatureAttribute.definition: Legal nature of the land use regulation from a national perspective.
FeatureAttribute.description: On member state level the legal classification for plan regulations may be complex. A supplementary regulation may be principally "bindingOnlyForAuthorities" but according to national law this regulation have to be more specified to explain the specific degree of binding. (e.g. on state or regional planning level in Germany: principles of spatial planning, other spatial planning requirements or goals of spatial planning).
NOTE This attribute complements the information provided by the attribute regulationNature.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Official name of the supplementary regulation

FeatureAttribute.name: regulationNature
FeatureAttribute.definition: Legal nature of the land use regulation.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Indicates whether the land use regulation is legally binding or not.

FeatureAttribute.name: supplementaryRegulation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Code of the supplementary regulation from the hierarchical supplementary regulation code list agreed at the European level.

RelationshipRole.name: officialDocument
RelationshipRole.definition: Link to the Textual regulations that correspond to this supplementary regulation.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31675
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: plan
RelationshipRole.definition: Link to the plan this supplementary regulation is part of.

RelationshipRole.name: restriction
RelationshipRole.definition: Links to supplementary regulations providing information and/or limitations on the use of land/water that supplements the zoning as part of this spatial plan.

FeatureType.name: DimensioningIndicationValue
FeatureType.title: Dimension Indication
FeatureType.definition: Specifications about the dimensioning of the urban developments.

FeatureAttribute.name: indicationReference
FeatureAttribute.definition: Description of the dimension indication.

FeatureType.name: OrdinanceValue
FeatureType.definition: Reference to administrative ordinance. Ordinance is a regulation/rule that is adopted by an authority that is legally mandated to take such ordinance.

FeatureAttribute.name: ordinanceDate
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date of the relevant administrative ordinance.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE This attribute is multiple because, independently from the current legal status of the plan, there can be references to the dates of more than one ordinance, in relation to the different steps that the planning process has already undergone (e.g. ordinance for the preparation of a new plan, ordinance of adoption, ordinance of approval, etc.).

FeatureAttribute.name: ordinanceReference
FeatureAttribute.definition: Reference to relevant administrative ordinance.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE This attribute is multiple because, independently from the current legal status of the plan, there can be references to more than one ordinance, in relation to the different steps that the planning process has already undergone (e.g. ordinance for the preparation of a new plan, ordinance of adoption, ordinance of approval, etc.).

FeatureType.name: SpatialPlan
FeatureType.title: spatial plan
FeatureType.definition: A set of documents that indicates a strategic direction for the development of a given geographic area, states the policies, priorities, programmes and land allocations that will implement the strategic direction and influences the distribution of people and activities in spaces of various scales. Spatial plans may be developed for urban planning, regional planning, environmental planning, landscape planning, national spatial plans, or spatial planning at the Union level.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial plan.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometrical union of all the instances of the spatial objects ZoningElement and SupplementaryRegulation. When a SpatialPlan is only composed of a document, the attribute extent is the border of the cartographic image that contains the land use information (i.e. the land use map extent).

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: officialTitle
FeatureAttribute.definition: Official title of the spatial plan.

FeatureAttribute.name: levelOfSpatialPlan
FeatureAttribute.title: level of spatial plan
FeatureAttribute.definition: Level of the administrative units covered by the plan.
FeatureAttribute.description: Member states should make a mapping to this enumeration.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: First date at which this spatial plan is valid in reality.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the spatial plan no longer exists in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: alternativeTitle
FeatureAttribute.definition: Alternative (unofficial) title of the spatial plan.

FeatureAttribute.name: planTypeName
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name of the type of plan that the Member State has given to the plan.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The admissible values for this attribute are managed at the member state level via a code list
EXAMPLE:
FR: DTA, SCOT, PLU, etc.
DE: Bebauungsplan, Flächennutzungsplan, Regionalplan, Landesentwicklungsplan
NL: bestemmingsplan, structuurvisie.

FeatureAttribute.name: processStepGeneral
FeatureAttribute.definition: General indication of the step of the planning process that the plan is undergoing.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE This enumeration contains values that are common to most planning systems.

FeatureAttribute.name: backgroundMap
FeatureAttribute.title: background map
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identification of the background map that has been used for constructing this Plan.

FeatureAttribute.name: ordinance
FeatureAttribute.definition: Reference to relevant administrative ordinance.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE This attribute is multiple because, independently from the current legal status of the plan, there can be references to more than one ordinance, in relation to the different steps that the planning process has already undergone (e.g. ordinance for the preparation of a new plan, ordinance of adoption, ordinance of approval, etc.).

RelationshipRole.name: officialDocument
RelationshipRole.definition: Link to the official documents that relate to the spatial plan.

RelationshipRole.name: role_T31667
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: member
RelationshipRole.definition: Reference to the ZoningElements which belong to this SpatialPlan.

RelationshipRole.name: plan
RelationshipRole.definition: SpatialPlan which this ZoningElement belongs to.

FeatureType.name: BackgroundMapValue
FeatureType.definition: Information regarding the map that has been used as a background in the definition of a spatial plan, a zoning element or a supplementary regulation.

FeatureAttribute.name: backgroundMapDate
FeatureAttribute.title: background map date
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date of the background map used.

FeatureAttribute.name: backgroundMapReference
FeatureAttribute.definition: Reference to the background map that has been used.

FeatureAttribute.name: backgroudMapURI
FeatureAttribute.title: background map URI
FeatureAttribute.definition: URI referring to service that provides background map.

FeatureType.name: ZoningElement
FeatureType.title: zoning element
FeatureType.definition: A spatial object which is homogeneous regarding the permitted uses of land based on zoning which separate one set of land uses from another.
FeatureType.description: Zoning elements refer to the regulation of the kinds of activities which will be acceptable on particular lots (such as open space, residential, agricultural, commercial or industrial). The intensity of use at which those activities can be performed (from low-density housing such as single family homes to high-density such as high-rise apartment buildings), the height of buildings, the amount of space that structures may occupy, the proportions of the types of space on a lot, such as how much landscaped space, impervious surface, traffic lanes, and parking may be provided.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometry of this zoning element

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The date when the phenomenon started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the phenomenon no longer exists in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: hilucsLandUse
FeatureAttribute.definition: Land use HILUCS class that is dominant in this land use object.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: hilucsPresence
FeatureAttribute.title: land use presence
FeatureAttribute.definition: Actual presence of a land use HILUCS category wihtin the object.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificLandUse
FeatureAttribute.definition: Land Use Category according to the nomenclature specific to this data set.
FeatureAttribute.description: Reference to an entry in the classfication that is part of the SpecificLandUseClassification.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificPresence
FeatureAttribute.title: land use presence
FeatureAttribute.definition: Actual presence of a land use category wihtin the object.

FeatureAttribute.name: regulationNature
FeatureAttribute.definition: Legal nature of the land use indication.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Indicates whether the land use indication is legally binding or not.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: processStepGeneral
FeatureAttribute.definition: General indication of the step of the planning process that the zoning element is undergoing.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE This enumeration contains values that are common to most planning systems.

FeatureAttribute.name: backgroundMap
FeatureAttribute.title: background map
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identification of the background map that has been used for constructing this zoning element.

FeatureAttribute.name: dimensioningIndication
FeatureAttribute.definition: Specifications about the dimensioning of the urban developments.

RelationshipRole.name: officialDocument
RelationshipRole.definition: Textual Regulation that is part of this zoning element.

RelationshipRole.name: role_T31671
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: OfficialDocumentation
FeatureType.title: official documentation
FeatureType.definition: The official documentation that composes the spatial plan; it may be composed of, the applicable legislation, the regulations, cartographic elements, descriptive elements that may be associated with the complete spatial plan, a zoning element or a supplementary regulation . In some Member States the actual textual regulation will be part of the data set (and can be put in the regulationText attribute), in other Member States the text will not be part of the data set and will be referenced via a reference to a document or a legal act.
At least one of the three voidable values shall be provided.
FeatureType.description: NOTE: The LegislationCitation is the value type of the attribute regulation reference. An example of a regulation reference would be: http://www2.vlaanderen.be /ruimtelijk/grup/00350/00362_00001/data/ 212_00362_00001_d_0BVR.pdf.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of this spatial textual regulation.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: legislationCitation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Reference to the document that contains the text of the regulation.

FeatureAttribute.name: regulationText
FeatureAttribute.definition: Text of the regulation.

FeatureAttribute.name: planDocument
FeatureAttribute.definition: Citation of scanned plans and structural drawings which may sometimes be geo-referenced or not,. E.g. raster images, vector drawings or scanned text.

FeatureType.name: Classification
FeatureType.definition: A classification used for a statistical distribution.
FeatureType.description: This code list describes the classification of the provided statistical values. It is the composition of the classification items.

FeatureAttribute.name: type
FeatureAttribute.title: Type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The classification type.

RelationshipRole.name: item
RelationshipRole.title: Item
RelationshipRole.definition: The items composing the classification.
RelationshipRole.description: EXAMPLE: The classification with a type "gender" is composed of the items "female", "male" and "unknown".

RelationshipRole.name: role_T31581
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: StatisticalValue
FeatureType.title: Statistical value
FeatureType.definition: The pieces of datum of the distribution.

FeatureAttribute.name: value
FeatureAttribute.title: Value
FeatureAttribute.definition: The value for the piece of datum.

FeatureAttribute.name: specialValue
FeatureAttribute.title: Special value
FeatureAttribute.definition: Some conventional string when value for the piece of datum cannot be provided: missing value, value hidden because of confidentiality.

FeatureAttribute.name: conventionallyLocatedProportion
FeatureAttribute.title: Conventionally located proportion
FeatureAttribute.definition: The proportion of population counted in the piece of datum but that cannot actually be physically located anywhere within the area of interest.
EXAMPLE: This proportion will include homeless people who where given the address of the organisation that distributes social benefis to them.

FeatureAttribute.name: approximatelyLocatedPopulationProportion
FeatureAttribute.title: Approximately located proportion
FeatureAttribute.definition: The proportion of population count that doesn’t follow the common rule for location. “Population” can be persons if persons are counted, dwellings if the StatisticalDatadistribution is about dwellings, etc.

EXAMPLE : A statistical distribution of the people is supposed to have been produced after the people were located in the cadastral parcel they live in. For some incorrectness in the registers used, the actual location of the cadastral parcel was not found fro some of them and an estimated location was computed. The number of people in this case must be reported in the attribute.

FeatureAttribute.name: comment
FeatureAttribute.title: Comment
FeatureAttribute.definition: Free style comment about the value.

FeatureAttribute.name: flags
FeatureAttribute.title: Flags
FeatureAttribute.definition: A set of one-character encoded comments about the data.

FeatureAttribute.name: periodOfMeasurement
FeatureAttribute.title: Period of measurement
FeatureAttribute.definition: The collection period of the statistical value. This period overrides the period specified in the associated statistical distribution.

FeatureAttribute.name: status
FeatureAttribute.title: Status
FeatureAttribute.definition: The status of the statistical data.

RelationshipRole.name: dimensions
RelationshipRole.title: Dimensions
RelationshipRole.definition: The part of the world the piece of datum refers to. Dimensions contains a description of the geographic location (2D dimension) together with possible additional dimensions when population counts are produced simultaneously for different individual characteristics.

EXAMPLE: A simple population count for each part of the area of Dissemination will need only identification of these parts, while population count by gender will require and additional dimension (gender) to make a difference between the male and the female.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31578
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: ClassificationItem
FeatureType.title: Classification item
FeatureType.definition: An item composing a classification.
FeatureType.description: EXAMPLE: The classification with a type "gender" is composed of the items "female", "male" and "unknown".

FeatureAttribute.name: type
FeatureAttribute.title: Type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The classification item type.

FeatureType.name: StatisticalDistribution
FeatureType.title: Statistical distribution
FeatureType.definition: Set of measures describing how a phenomenon is spread within some part of the 2D world.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.title: INSPIRE identifier
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: areaOfDissemination
FeatureAttribute.title: Area of dissemination
FeatureAttribute.definition: The part of the 2D world the StatisticalDataDistribution describes.

FeatureAttribute.name: universe
FeatureAttribute.title: Universe
FeatureAttribute.definition: When distribution is related to a subset of the population and not the population in its whole, the literal description of the way this subset was defined.

EXAMPLE : A dataset can give the population distribution of the unemployed persons under 25. The variable will be “unemployedPopulation”, the measure a “count “ and the measurementUnit “person”. The only way to express that the distribution doesn’t cover the whole unemployed population would be to describe that situation in the Unviverse attribute.

FeatureAttribute.name: domain
FeatureAttribute.title: Domain
FeatureAttribute.definition: The part of statistical knowledge the data refers to.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLES: Demography, activity, etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: measure
FeatureAttribute.title: Measure
FeatureAttribute.definition: The measure concerned by the distribution.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: Population by age and gender, households by size, etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: measurementMethod
FeatureAttribute.title: Measurement method
FeatureAttribute.definition: The description of the statistic measurement method.

FeatureAttribute.name: measurementUnit
FeatureAttribute.title: Measurement unit
FeatureAttribute.definition: The unit of the measurement.

FeatureAttribute.name: notCountedProportion
FeatureAttribute.title: Not counted proportion
FeatureAttribute.definition: The proportion of population of the area of interest that is not counted in any of its spatial components.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE: This situation can occur when the total population of the area of interest is collected by some process (e.g. administrative register) but population in the spatial components of the area of interest by another process (e.g. estimation).

FeatureAttribute.name: periodOfMeasurement
FeatureAttribute.title: Period of measurement
FeatureAttribute.definition: The date or period the observation has been taken, the data was collected.

FeatureAttribute.name: periodOfReference
FeatureAttribute.title: Period of reference
FeatureAttribute.definition: The period when the data is supposed to give a picture of the area of interest.

FeatureAttribute.name: periodOfValidity
FeatureAttribute.title: Period of validity
FeatureAttribute.definition: The period in which the data remains relevant.
FeatureAttribute.description: Outside this period the data will not be used and must be replaced by new data. In most cases this is forever and the 2nd date is left empty.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: Begin life span version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: End life span version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: generalStatus
FeatureAttribute.title: general status
FeatureAttribute.definition: The status of the statistical data distribution.

RelationshipRole.name: classification
RelationshipRole.title: Classification
RelationshipRole.definition: Additional classifications used to split a total value of the described phenomenon. The StatisticalDistribution object will provide actually several distributions, one for each item of the used classification.
NB: When no classification is provided, the statistical value is the total population.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31579
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: value
RelationshipRole.title: Value
RelationshipRole.definition: The statistical values composing the distribution.

RelationshipRole.name: role_T31580
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: Dimensions
FeatureType.definition: The identification of what the piece of datum refers to in terms of geographic location or individual characteristics.

RelationshipRole.name: spatial
RelationshipRole.title: Spatial
RelationshipRole.definition: The spatial dimension of the statistical value.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31577
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: thematic
RelationshipRole.title: Thematic
RelationshipRole.definition: The thematic dimensions of the statistical value.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31582
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: ProcessParameter
FeatureType.title: Process Parameter
FeatureType.definition: Description of the given parameter

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name of the process parameter.

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.definition: Description of the process parameter.

FeatureType.name: Process
FeatureType.definition: Description of an observation process

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name of the Process

FeatureAttribute.name: type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of process.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE raingauge, numerical model.

FeatureAttribute.name: documentation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Further information ( online/offline) associated with the process .

FeatureAttribute.name: processParameter
FeatureAttribute.title: process parameter
FeatureAttribute.definition: Parameter controlling the application of the process and as a consequence its output.
FeatureAttribute.description: Typical examples of using processParameter are: description of instrumentation settings for a specific measurement or measurement series ; description of intial contidions in numerical computations e.g. simulations.

NOTE The values of a procesParameter are stored in OM_Observation.parameter>NamedValue.value as they are specific to the event of the observation and not to the applied process . The relevant OM_Observation.parameter>NamedValue.name shall be the same with Process.processParameter>ProcessParameter.name.
EXAMPLE Analysis time of a forecast
<ul>
• Instance of Process
Process.processParameter>ProcessParameter.name:
http://inspire.jrc.ec.europa.eu/inspire/processParameterValue.html#AnalysisTime
<ul>
• Instance of OM_Observation
OM_OObservation.parameter>NamedValue.name:
http://inspire.jrc.ec.europa.eu/inspire/processParameterValue.html#AnalysisTime
OM_Observation.parameter>NamedValue.value:

FeatureAttribute.name: responsibleParty
FeatureAttribute.title: responsible party
FeatureAttribute.definition: Individual or organisation related to the process.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE For a numerical simulation a responsible party may be the NWP centre which conducted the simulation

FeatureType.name: ProductionInstallation
FeatureType.title: production installation
FeatureType.definition: A technical unit, such as machinery, apparatus, devices or equipment placed in position or connected for use.
FeatureType.description: Stationary technical unit part of a facility where one or more activities are carried out, and any other directly associated activities which have a technical connection to the activities carried out on that site and which could have an effect on the environment.
May be a technical unit within an establishment in which dangerous substances are produced, used, handled or stored.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: thematicId
FeatureAttribute.definition: Thematic object identifier (e.g. ICAO location identifiers for airports or NUTS codes for administrative areas).
FeatureAttribute.description: It may be the identification code provided by the Member States to identify the object on their own databases.

FeatureAttribute.name: pointGeometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Spatial property of the spatial object with a value that is a vector geometry type from ISO 19107.
FeatureAttribute.description: This is the basic geometry property for the Production Installation and it is set as an optional property to identify the location point for the Installation. It is intended, if available, to furnish an additional spatial information beside the basic mandatory geometry fixed for the Production Facility.

FeatureAttribute.name: surfaceGeometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Spatial property of the spatial object with a value that is a vector geometry type from ISO 19107.
FeatureAttribute.description: This is the secondary geometry property for the Production Installation and it is set as an optional property to identify the location area for the Installation. It is intended, if available, to furnish a detailed spatial information beside the basic mandatory geometry fixed for the Production Facility.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Official denomination or proper or conventional name of the installation.

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.definition: Descriptive statement about the installation.

FeatureAttribute.name: status
FeatureAttribute.definition: The state or condition of the installation, with regard to its functional and operational order, in which it is arranged for a limited or extended time period.

FeatureAttribute.name: type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Special kind of an installation, denoting the operative function which has to be performed.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE Radiological installation, containing radiological equipment.

RelationshipRole.name: groupedInstallationPart
RelationshipRole.definition: An InstallationPart is grouped by one Installation

RelationshipRole.name: groupingInstallation
RelationshipRole.definition: An Installation may group one or more InstallationParts
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: StatusType
FeatureType.definition: The state or condition of a technical component, with regard to the functional and operational order, in which it is arranged for a limited or extended time period.
FeatureType.description: It applies equally to the technical unit (facility, installation or installation part), to the production site, to the parcel and to the production building.

FeatureAttribute.name: statusType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The state or condition of a technical component referring to a list of predefined potential values.
FeatureAttribute.description: The reference values are holded in the ConditionOfFacilityValue code list.

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.definition: Descriptive statement about the declared status.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The starting time of validity for a status type.
FeatureAttribute.description: A date gives values for year, month and day.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The ending time of validity for a status type.
FeatureAttribute.description: A date gives values for year, month and day.

FeatureType.name: ProductionPlot
FeatureType.title: Production Plot
FeatureType.definition: A portion of land or water part of a production facility destined to functional purposes.
FeatureType.description: A potential sub-division of a major site as delimited extension of land in which are performed extensive operations related with the activity or one of the activities performed by a facility.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: thematicId
FeatureAttribute.definition: Thematic object identifier (e.g. ICAO location identifiers for airports or NUTS codes for administrative areas).
FeatureAttribute.description: It may be the identification code provided by the Member States to identify the object on their own databases.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Spatial property of the spatial object with a value that is a vector geometry type from ISO 19107.
FeatureAttribute.description: This is the geometry property for the Parcel and it is set as a optional property to identify the location area for the Parcel. It is intended, if available, to furnish a detailed spatial information beside the basic mandatory geometry fixed for the Production Facility.

FeatureAttribute.name: status
FeatureAttribute.definition: The state or condition of the plot, with regard to the functional and operational order, in which it is arranged for a limited or extended time period.

FeatureType.name: ProductionBuilding
FeatureType.title: production building
FeatureType.definition: Artificial construction, part of the production facility that are useful to host or provide shelter to activity development.
FeatureType.description: Inside a facility, and in relation with the definition of building, this entity should represent a construction under responsibility of the facility, either as an independent unit or as a functional infrastructure for an installation.

FeatureAttribute.name: thematicId
FeatureAttribute.definition: Thematic object identifier (e.g. ICAO location identifiers for airports or NUTS codes for administrative areas).
FeatureAttribute.description: It may be the identification code provided by the Member States to identify the object on their own databases.

FeatureAttribute.name: typeOfBuilding
FeatureAttribute.definition: Descriptive classification about the production and industrial building.

FeatureAttribute.name: status
FeatureAttribute.definition: The state or condition of the production and industrial building, with regard to the functional and operational order, in which it is arranged for a limited or extended time period.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S32010
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: TechnicalUnit
FeatureType.title: technical unit
FeatureType.definition: Represents the common "abstract level" for production infrastructures: facilities, installations, installation parts.
FeatureType.description: It applies since the production infrastructures (facility, installation, installation part) may have an UML "equivalent behaviour": this means they have properties in common and the same associations to be reused.
This type is abstract.

FeatureType.name: ProductionInstallationPart
FeatureType.title: production installation part
FeatureType.definition: A single engineered facility that performs specific functionalities related with a production activity.
--Description --

This level of description covers specific parts of the Production Installation which must be registered by the legal mandate of the competent authorities. Points of emission as chimneys (for pollutants) or tanks (for special products), will be included in this definition.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: thematicId
FeatureAttribute.definition: Thematic object identifier (e.g. ICAO location identifiers for airports or NUTS codes for administrative areas).
FeatureAttribute.description: It may be the identification code provided by the Member States to identify the object on their own databases.

FeatureAttribute.name: pointGeometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Spatial property of the spatial object with a value that is a vector geometry type from ISO 19107.
FeatureAttribute.description: This is the basic geometry property for the Production Installation Part and it is set as an optional property to identify the location point for the Installation Part. It is intended, if available, to furnish an additional spatial information beside the basic mandatory geometry fixed for the Production Facility.

FeatureAttribute.name: surfaceGeometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Spatial property of the spatial object with a value that is a vector geometry type from ISO 19107.
FeatureAttribute.description: This is the secondary geometry property for the Production Installation Part and it is set as an optional property to identify the location area for the Installation Part. It is intended, if available, to furnish a detailed spatial information beside the basic mandatory geometry fixed for the Production Facility.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Official denomination or proper or conventional name of the installation part.

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.definition: Descriptive statement about the installation part.

FeatureAttribute.name: status
FeatureAttribute.definition: The state or condition of the installation part, with regard to the functional and operational order, in which it is arranged for a limited or extended time period.

FeatureAttribute.name: type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Special kind of an installation part, denoting the operative function which has to be performed.
FeatureAttribute.description: EXAMPLE Chimney, pump.

FeatureAttribute.name: technique
FeatureAttribute.definition: Method to reduce pollutant concentration due to the emissions of a technical component, tipically a chimney.
FeatureAttribute.description: This information is referring to a list of predefined potential values.
The reference values are holded in the PollutionAbatementTechnique code list.

FeatureType.name: ProductionSite
FeatureType.title: production site
FeatureType.definition: All land at a distinct geographic location where the production facility was, is, or is intended to be located. This includes all infrastructure, equipment and materials;
FeatureType.description: An area of land or water that one or more process plants is or may be situated on, or else a single location, in which, if there is more than one manufacturer of (a) substance(s), certain infrastructure and facilities are shared.

A continuous surface, maritime or terrestrial in which production facilities have been already implanted or urban and/or engineering activities have been developed for production purposes. The location will be defined by means of geographical boundaries within which activities under the control of an organization may be carried out. The geographical boundaries may be on land and in water, and include above and below surface structures, both natural and man-made.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: thematicId
FeatureAttribute.definition: Thematic object identifier (e.g. ICAO location identifiers for airports or NUTS codes for administrative areas).
FeatureAttribute.description: It may be the identification code provided by the Member States to identify the object on their own databases.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Spatial property of the spatial object with a value that is a vector geometry type from ISO 19107.
FeatureAttribute.description: This is the geometry property for the Production Site and it is set as an optional property to identify the location area for the Site. It is intended, if available, to furnish a detailed spatial information beside the basic mandatory geometry fixed for the Production Facility.

FeatureAttribute.name: sitePlan
FeatureAttribute.definition: External reference to documentation concerning the configuration and organisation of the site ((Site Plans, technical descriptions, ...).

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Official denomination or proper or conventional name of the site.

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.definition: Descriptive statement about the site.

FeatureAttribute.name: status
FeatureAttribute.definition: The state or condition of the site, with regard to the functional and operational order, in which it is arranged for a limited or extended time period.

FeatureType.name: ProductionFacility
FeatureType.title: production facility
FeatureType.definition: One or more installations on the same site operated by the same natural or legal person,
designed, built or installed to serve specific production or industrial purposes, comprehending
all infrastructure, equipment and materials.
FeatureType.description: A production facility groups together a single installation, set of installations or production processes (stationary or mobile), which can be defined within a single geographical boundary, organizational unit or production process. A production facility can also be identified as one or more installations located on the same site that are operated by the same natural or legal person and in which production activities are being carried out. Such a facility groups potentially the land, buildings, and equipment used in carrying on an industrial business or other undertaking or service.

FeatureAttribute.name: surfaceGeometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Spatial property of the spatial object with a value that is a vector geometry type from ISO 19107.
FeatureAttribute.description: This is the secondary geometry property for the Production Facility and it is set as an optional property to identify the location area for the Facility. It is intended, if available, to furnish a more detailed spatial information in addition to the basic mandatory geometry.

FeatureAttribute.name: riverBasinDistrict
FeatureAttribute.definition: Code identifier and/or name assigned to the basin district of a watercourse.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE Information required (not registered in the Hydrography Theme) according to Article 3(1) of Directive 2000/60/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 23 October 2000 establishing
a framework for Community action in the field of water policy (OJ L 327, 22.12.2000, p. 1). Directive as amended by Decision

FeatureAttribute.name: status
FeatureAttribute.definition: The state or condition of the facility, with regard to the functional and operational order, in which it is arranged for a limited or extended time period.

RelationshipRole.name: groupedFacility
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: hostingSite
RelationshipRole.definition: A Site hosts one or more Facilities

RelationshipRole.name: hostedFacility
RelationshipRole.definition: A Facility may be located on one Site
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: groupedInstallation
RelationshipRole.definition: An Installation is grouped by one Facility

RelationshipRole.name: groupingFacility
RelationshipRole.definition: A Facility may group one or more Installations
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: groupedPlot
RelationshipRole.definition: A Plot is grouped by one or more Facilities (this means a Plot may be shared by different Facilities)

RelationshipRole.name: groupingFacility
RelationshipRole.definition: A Facility may group one or more Plots
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: ProcessOutput
FeatureType.title: process output
FeatureType.definition: Declares any kind of process item as substance, energy, waste, product, emission resulting from a production cycle and possibly the corresponding amount.

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.definition: Descriptive statement about the energy, waste, product or emission in line with the declared classification.

FeatureAttribute.name: processItem
FeatureAttribute.definition: States the special kind of the process item listed in one of the families of substances, energies, wastes, products, where these lists are following, as far as possible, official classifications.

FeatureAttribute.name: amount
FeatureAttribute.definition: Declared or measured quantity of any kind of energy, waste, product, emission springing from a production cycle.

FeatureType.name: Activity
FeatureType.title: activity
FeatureType.definition: In the production context the individual or organized set of processes finalized with the production of consuming goods.
FeatureType.description: Processing typically describes the act of taking something through an established and usually routine set of procedures to convert it from one form to another, such as a manufacturing. One or more activities may be performed in the facility or smaller unit of the facility (that is an installation or an installation part).

FeatureAttribute.name: activityCode
FeatureAttribute.definition: Classification of the activity according to European legislation.

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.definition: Descriptive statement about the activity in line with the declared classification from legislation.
FeatureAttribute.description: It may be also a descriptive value from a local code list.

FeatureAttribute.name: mainEconomicActivity
FeatureAttribute.definition: Primary activity in terms of significance and production volume.

FeatureType.name: ProductionInstallationExtended
FeatureType.definition: A technical unit, such as machinery, apparatus, devices or equipment placed in position or connected for use.
FeatureType.description: Stationary technical unit part of a facility where one or more activities are carried out, and any other directly associated activities which have a technical connection to the activities carried out on that site and which could have an effect on the environment.
May be a technical unit within an establishment in which dangerous substances are produced, used, handled or stored.

FeatureType.name: ProcessInput
FeatureType.title: process input
FeatureType.definition: Declares any kind of process item as substance, energy, waste, product entering a production cycle and possibly the corresponding amount.

FeatureAttribute.name: description
FeatureAttribute.definition: Descriptive statement about the substance, energy, waste or product in line with the declared classification.

FeatureAttribute.name: amount
FeatureAttribute.definition: Declared or measured quantity of any kind of material, energy, waste, product entering a production cycle.

FeatureAttribute.name: processItem
FeatureAttribute.definition: States the special kind of the process item listed in one of the families of substances, energies, wastes, products, where these lists are following, as far as possible, official classifications.

FeatureAttribute.name: dangerousSubstance
FeatureAttribute.definition: A substance, mixture or preparation present as a raw material, product, by-product, residue or intermediate, including those substances which it is reasonable to suppose may be generated in the event of accident, with a potential for creating damage to human health and/or the environment.

FeatureType.name: ProductionProcess
FeatureType.definition: Production processes performed by the facility

RelationshipRole.name: destinedInput
RelationshipRole.definition: A ProcessInput is destined to a ProductionProcess

RelationshipRole.name: receivingProcess
RelationshipRole.definition: A ProductionProcess may receive one or more ProcessInputs
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

RelationshipRole.name: releasedOutput
RelationshipRole.definition: A ProcessOutput is released by a ProductionProcess

RelationshipRole.name: releasingProcess
RelationshipRole.definition: A ProductionProcess may release one or more ProcessOutputs
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: TechnicalUnit
FeatureType.title: technical unit
FeatureType.definition: Represents the common "abstract level" for production infrastructures: facilities, installations, installation parts.
FeatureType.description: It applies since the production infrastructures (facility, installation, installation part) may have an UML "equivalent behaviour": this means they have properties in common and the same associations to be reused.
This type is abstract.

RelationshipRole.name: performingUnit
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: ProductionFacilityExtended
FeatureType.definition: Represents the common "abstract level" for production infrastructures: facilities, installations, installation parts.
FeatureType.description: It applies since the production infrastructures (facility, installation, installation part) may have an UML "equivalent behaviour": this means they have properties in common and the same associations to be reused.

FeatureType.name: Measure
FeatureType.definition: Declared or measured quantity of any kind of physical entity.

FeatureAttribute.name: value
FeatureAttribute.definition: Declared or measured physical size expressed as a numerical quantity.
FeatureAttribute.description: The data format is decimal. Decimal is a data type in which the number represents an exact value, as a finite representation of a decimal number.

FeatureAttribute.name: unitOfMeasure
FeatureAttribute.definition: Unit of measure accompanying the numerical quantity declared or measured for a physical entity.

FeatureType.name: Emission
FeatureType.title: emission
FeatureType.definition: The direct or indirect release of substances, vibrations, heat or noise from individual or diffuse sources in the plant into the air, water or soil.
FeatureType.description: Referring to emission events from a source the release total amount in a year and each meaningful accidental release shall be recorded.

FeatureAttribute.name: heightOfEmissionPoint
FeatureAttribute.definition: The spatial location of the emission point, fixed as the vertical distance from the ground level.

FeatureAttribute.name: areaOfEmission
FeatureAttribute.definition: The surface extension related to the emission point, fixed as the area of the mouth (for instance the smokestack mouth) from where the emission comes out.

FeatureAttribute.name: destination
FeatureAttribute.definition: Final destination to which the emission released into the environment is devoted.

FeatureAttribute.name: release
FeatureAttribute.definition: The release nature related to the emissive amount for emission events: the release total amount in a year and each meaningful accidental release shall be distinguished.

FeatureAttribute.name: flowAmount
FeatureAttribute.definition: The flood content related to the emission point, fixed as the flow amount coming out from the mouth (for instance the smokestack mouth).
FeatureAttribute.description: The unit of measure normally used is m3 /h and the reference parameters 0°C for temperature and 0,101MPa for pressure.

FeatureAttribute.name: flowDuration
FeatureAttribute.definition: The flood period of time related to the emission point, fixed as the duration of the flow coming out from the mouth (for instance the smokestack mouth).
FeatureAttribute.description: The unit of measure normally used is hour/day.

FeatureAttribute.name: flowAppearance
FeatureAttribute.definition: The flood property related to the emission point, fixed as the flow appearance in time coming out from the mouth (for instance the smokestack mouth).

FeatureAttribute.name: flowTemperature
FeatureAttribute.definition: The warmth related to the emission point, fixed as the temperature of the flow coming out from the mouth (for instance the smokestack mouth).
FeatureAttribute.description: The unit of measure normally used is °C.

FeatureAttribute.name: ambientTemperature
FeatureAttribute.definition: The external temperature in the surroundings of the emission point.
FeatureAttribute.description: The unit of measure normally used is °C.

FeatureAttribute.name: measurementRegistration
FeatureAttribute.definition: The temporal reference related to the emission event, fixed as the time the measurements (flow and temperature and concentrations) were registered together.

FeatureAttribute.name: registrationNature
FeatureAttribute.definition: The way the registration event was accomplished, fixed as the procedure such as the registered parameters were picked up in a definite time.

FeatureAttribute.name: pollutantSubstance
FeatureAttribute.definition: The pollution content related to the emission point, fixed as the declaration of each pollutant substance coming out from the mouth (for instance the smokestack mouth).
FeatureAttribute.description: The classification of pollutant substances is made according to the Council Directive 67/548/EEC and the Council Directive 1999/45/EC. Each substance consists of any chemical element and its compounds, with the exception of some specific substances. The exception deals with the following substances: radioactive substances as defined in Article 1 of Council Directive 96/29/Euratom of 13 May 1996 laying down basic safety standards for the protection of the health of workers and the general public against the dangers arising from ionising radiation(2); genetically modified micro-organisms as defined in Article 2(b) of Directive 2009/41/EC of the European Parliament and the Council of 6 May 2009 on the contained use of genetically modified micro-organisms; genetically modified organisms as defined in point 2 of Article 2 of Directive 2001/18/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 12 March 2001 on the deliberate release into the environment of genetically modified organisms.

FeatureAttribute.name: dangerousSubstance
FeatureAttribute.definition: A substance, mixture or preparation present as a raw material, product, by-product, residue or intermediate, including those substances which it is reasonable to suppose may be generated in the event of accident, with a potential for creating damage to human health and/or the environment.

FeatureAttribute.name: pollutantConcentration
FeatureAttribute.definition: The pollution content related to the emission point, fixed as the pollutant concentration for each pollutant substance coming out from the mouth (for instance the smokestack mouth).
FeatureAttribute.description: The unit of measure normally used is mg/m3.

FeatureType.name: ProductionInstallationPartExtended
FeatureType.definition: A single engineered facility that performs specific functionalities related with a production activity.
--Description --

This level of description covers specific parts of the Production Installation which must be registered by the legal mandate of the competent authorities. Points of emission as chimneys (for pollutants) or tanks (for special products), will be included in this definition.
FeatureType.description: It applies since the production infrastructures (facility, installation, installation part) may have an UML "equivalent behaviour": this means they have properties in common and the same associations to be reused.

FeatureType.name: ProductionFacility
FeatureType.title: production facility
FeatureType.definition: Something designed, built, installed to serve a specific function with production purposes, comprehending the complete equipment or apparatus for a particular process or operation.
FeatureType.description: A production facility groups together a single installation, set of installations or production processes (stationary or mobile), which can be defined within a single geographical boundary, organizational unit or production process. A production facility can also be identified as one or more installations located on the same site that are operated by the same natural or legal person and in which production activities are being carried out. Such a facility groups potentially the land, buildings, and equipment used in carrying on an industrial business or other undertaking or service.

FeatureType.name: SampledExistingLandUseDataSet
FeatureType.title: sampled existing land use data set
FeatureType.definition: A sampled existing land use data set is a collection of locations for which information on existing (present or past) land uses is provided.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the sampled land use data set.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: The convex hull of all the instances of the spatial object type ExistingLandUseSample.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Human readable name of the data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: First date at which this data set is valid in reality.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the data set no longer exists in the real world.

RelationshipRole.name: member
RelationshipRole.definition: Reference to the members of the sampled existing land use data set.

RelationshipRole.name: dataset
RelationshipRole.definition: Data set to which this sample belongs.

FeatureType.name: ExistingLandUseSample
FeatureType.title: existing land use sample
FeatureType.definition: Description of the existing land use that is present at the specific location.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the land use sample.
FeatureAttribute.description: An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: location
FeatureAttribute.definition: Location where the land use sample is taken.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: hilucsLandUse
FeatureAttribute.definition: Land use HILUCS classes that are present in this existing land use sample.
FeatureAttribute.description: NOTE The Sampled Existing Land Use model enables the provision of information on land uses inside one land use object. The ExistingLandUseObject may be associated with 1 to many HILUCSLandUse that represents the Land Uses for the polygon from the economical point of view. It makes possible the assignment of more than one HILUCSLandUse existences when they cannot be managed by HILUCSPresences.

FeatureAttribute.name: hilucsPresence
FeatureAttribute.title: land use presence
FeatureAttribute.definition: Actual presence of a land use category according to HILUCS within the object.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificLandUse
FeatureAttribute.definition: Land Use Category according to the nomenclature specific to this data set.
FeatureAttribute.description: Reference to an entry in the classfication that is part of the SpecificLandUseClassification provided by the data producer.

FeatureAttribute.name: observationDate
FeatureAttribute.title: Observation Date.
FeatureAttribute.definition: The observation date associated to a description.
FeatureAttribute.description: Defines the observation date of the description. It could be the date of an aerial/satellital acquisition or a field survey. The observation date allows the user to have accurate date of when the description was made in the real word. In a database, not all object informations are necessarily captured at the same time.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificPresence
FeatureAttribute.definition: Actual presence of a land use category within the object.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the phenomenon started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the phenomenon no longer exists in the real world.

ApplicationSchema.name: Sea Regions
ApplicationSchema.definition: Physical conditions of seas and saline water bodies divided into regions and sub-regions with common characteristics. (2007/2/EC)
A historical version of the theme definition is found in the INSPIRE IMS paper:

• Seas and saline water bodies divided into regions and sub-regions. Each region with common characteristics, concerning water flow/ circulation, adjacent river catchments, bio-chemical or temperature of water, based on scientific criteria. Detailed information at regional level exist. (INSPIRE IMS, 2003)

Both 'Oceanographic geographical features' and 'Sea-regions' are concerned with physical conditions of marine water-masses. (This is a similar overlap to that which exists for themes 7.13 "Atmospheric Conditions" and 7.14 "Meteorological geographical features".) To resolve the ambiguity, we consider the multi-level approach to data needs assessment applied in ETC. Data at local or regional level are often needed for management and policy implementation, while lower resolution ('smaller scale') data are often required for reporting and policy development/evaluation. The latter includes summaries and integrated data products.
We regard the "Sea regions" theme as focussing on the local/regional level coastal zone.

Whereas 7.15 'Oceanographic geographical features' focuses on physical conditions and general circulation of offshore oceanic waters, the 'Sea regions' theme is concerned with marine features of the coastal zone ? regions defined as 'transitional waters' and 'coastal waters' in the Water Framework Directive:

• transitional waters: bodies of surface water in the vicinity of river mouths which are partly saline in character as a result of their proximity to coastal waters but which are substantially influenced by freshwater flows

• coastal waters: surface water on the landward side of a line, every point of which is at a distance of one nautical mile on the seaward side from the nearest point of the baseline from which the breadth of territorial waters is measured, extending where appropriate up to the outer limit of transitional waters
The World Meteorological Organisation also has a geometry-based sea region classification, dividing the ocean into Marsden Squares.

Both biotic and physical parameters and indicators are important in the classification and delineation of sea regions. Physical data requirements for important indicators defined in the WFD and the Integrated Coastal Zone Management policy are outlined in the ETC paper. These include:
• nutrients (nitrate, phosphate and nitrogen: phosphorus ratio) by regional sea and water body type
• concentrations of hazardous substances and pollutants (incl. heavy metals, persistent organic pollutants)
• water masses/layers characterised by bulk temperature and salinity properties
• wind (climatological and meteorolog• benthic parameters (sediment, benthic communities/habitats)

FeatureType.name: Shoreline
FeatureType.definition: Any Boundary between a Sea Area and land.
FeatureType.description: NOTE Derived 'views' of real-world hydrographic objects are represented through specialisations in other application schemas; all representations of the same real-world object share a common geographic name or hydrographic identifier.

FeatureAttribute.name: segment
FeatureAttribute.definition: A section of shoreline.

FeatureAttribute.name: waterLevel
FeatureAttribute.title: water level
FeatureAttribute.definition: The water level used when defining this shoreline (e.g. meanHighWater)

FeatureType.name: SeaBedArea
FeatureType.title: Sea Bed Area
FeatureType.definition: An area of the sea bed with some identified type of cover. e.g. an area of vegetation or sediment type.
FeatureType.description: This describes a sea region according to the characteristics of the sea bed rather than characteristics of the water column in general. It does not include the subsea geology and is analogous to the concept of LandCover (INSPIRE Annex III).

FeatureAttribute.name: surfaceType
FeatureAttribute.title: Surface Type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Surface type of sea bed.
FeatureAttribute.description: Surface type of sea bed.

FeatureType.name: SeaSurfaceArea
FeatureType.title: Sea Surface Area
FeatureType.definition: An area of the sea surface with some type of cover e.g. an area of sea ice.
FeatureType.description: This describes a sea region according to the characteristics of the sea surface rather than characteristics of the water column in general. It is analogous to the concept of LandCover (INSPIRE Annex III).

FeatureAttribute.name: surfaceType
FeatureAttribute.title: surface type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Surface type of sea area.

FeatureType.name: SeaArea
FeatureType.title: Sea Area
FeatureType.definition: An area of sea defined according to its physical and chemical characteristics. It may have multiple geometries (extent) to represent different tidal states.
FeatureType.description: A SeaArea is a type of HydroObject as described in the Annex1 theme Hydrography. It has geometry described by one or more GM_MultiSurfaces. Multiple geometries are allowed to enable a SeaArea to be described according to different tidal states.

Typically however, specialisations of SeaArea will restrict the geometry to a particular tidal state or set of tidal states. SeaAreas include named seas such as ‘Baltic Sea’ and also un-named areas of sea that have particular chemical and physical characteristics. SeaAreas are 2D objects and carry no explicit information about the depth of the sea, this is specified in the INSPIRE Elevation Theme.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.title: inspire ID
FeatureAttribute.definition: "External object identifier of the spatial object.".
FeatureAttribute.description: "An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.".

FeatureAttribute.name: seaAreaType
FeatureAttribute.title: Sea Area Type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of the sea area according to the classifications in the SeaAreaTypeClassificationValue codelist. e.g. Estuary

FeatureAttribute.name: extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: The extent of the Sea Area at a particular tidal state.

FeatureAttribute.name: parameterValue
FeatureAttribute.title: parameter value
FeatureAttribute.definition: A value of some parameter assigned to the SeaArea. E.g. Annual Mean Sea Surface Temperature = 12 degrees Celsius
FeatureAttribute.description: A SeaArea may be attributed with any number of values that are relevant for the sea area polygon as a whole. More detailed observations, such as grids and point data are the subject of the Oceanographic Geographical Features specification.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: Begin lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.title: End lifespan version
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

RelationshipRole.name: subArea
RelationshipRole.definition: SeaAreas can consist of sub areas.
e.g. A SeaArea defining all european seas could be an aggregation of multiple SeaAreas (North Sea, Mediterranean Sea etc)

RelationshipRole.name: role_T31523
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: MarineContour
FeatureType.title: Marine Contour
FeatureType.definition: A set of isolines representing the value of some phenomenon at a particular time.
FeatureType.description: A representation of any physical or chemical phenomenon related to the SeaArea. MarineContour should be derived from an OceanGeographicFeature of the same phenomenon. The source observations used to derive this feature may be linked to via the sourceObservations association. MarineContour is an abstraction of the ‘real world’ to provide an overview of the expected conditions of a SeaArea. Examples would include salinity contours, depth contours, significant wave height.

FeatureAttribute.name: isoline
FeatureAttribute.definition: Isoline used to generate the contour.

FeatureAttribute.name: phenomenon
FeatureAttribute.title: Phenomeneon
FeatureAttribute.definition: The property represented by the isolines (e.g. wave height).

FeatureAttribute.name: validTime
FeatureAttribute.title: Valid Time
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time at which this contour is representative.

RelationshipRole.name: sourceObservations
RelationshipRole.title: Source observations
RelationshipRole.definition: Used to link to a collection of underlying observations which were used to define a marine isoline.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31520
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: MarineLayer
FeatureType.title: Marine Layer
FeatureType.definition: A Marine Layer describes any layer that may cover any part of a sea surface or sea bottom.
FeatureType.description: Examples of surface layers identified in the reference material include oil, algal blooms and ice. Examples of seabed layer identified in the reference material include sediment type and presence or absence of vegetation.

As these phenomena have a dynamic characteristic, the extent they describe (GM_Surface) has a validity period. A marineLayer may not be associated with a particular SeaArea. A SeaArea may have multiple MarineLayers and MarineLayers can overlap each other.
This type is abstract.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.title: Geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometry of the marine layer.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTime
FeatureAttribute.title: Valid Time
FeatureAttribute.definition: Time period for which the marine layer is valid.

RelationshipRole.name: subLayer
RelationshipRole.title: Sub layer
RelationshipRole.definition: A marine layer may have a sub-layer, for example an Oil Slick may have a main slick with several smaller sub-slicks.

RelationshipRole.name: role_S31521
RelationshipRole.description: This is a non-navigable relationship role.

FeatureType.name: InterTidalArea
FeatureType.title: Intertidal Area
FeatureType.definition: The part of the marine environment that is exposed (not covered in water) during a normal tidal cycle; defined as the difference between any high and any low water level.
FeatureType.description: The part of the marine environment that is exposed (not covered in water) during a normal tidal cycle.

FeatureAttribute.name: highWaterLevel
FeatureAttribute.title: high water level
FeatureAttribute.definition: The high water level which was used to define the upper limit of the Intertidal Area, e.g. 'meanHighWater'.

FeatureAttribute.name: lowWaterLevel
FeatureAttribute.title: low water level
FeatureAttribute.definition: The low water level which was used to define the lower limit of the Intertidal Area, e.g. 'meanLowWater'.

FeatureType.name: ShoreSegment
FeatureType.title: Shore Segment
FeatureType.definition: A Shore Segment is a section of shore line.
FeatureType.description: Where it is possible to provide attributes about shore stability (eroding, stable etc) and/or shore type (sand, rock, harbour etc). Then the Shore Segment should be used in place of the GML LineString element to describe curve segments.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry of the ShoreSegment.

FeatureAttribute.name: shoreClassification
FeatureAttribute.title: shore classification
FeatureAttribute.definition: The primary type of the shore segment, taken from the ShoreTypeClassification codelist.

FeatureAttribute.name: shoreStability
FeatureAttribute.title: shore stability
FeatureAttribute.definition: The primary stability type of the shore segment, taken from the ShoreStability codelist.

FeatureType.name: Coastline
FeatureType.definition: A special case of a shoreline defined as the shoreline at Mean High Water (MHW). Where there is not significant variation in water level, Mean Sea Level (MSL) can be used as a substitute for MHW.
FeatureType.description: This feature type is designed for the general use case where the land:sea boundary is required to support general discovery and viewing of datasets.
